reviews.text:
This is an entry level hiking trail, beautiful and great for family outings.
The trail is well maintain, and there are areas for people do breaks, I love this place.

Loving this hiking trail! Was told it’s suitable for beginners. Yes it is, but definitely still need some stamina 🤣. Not too crowded, unless meet tour grp😅. I’m amazed to see quite a number of elderly, they are really strong💪💪. Very pleasant walk! Thank you for maintaining it so well🥰

I went there walking from Yongchun station up to Hushan mountain and from there i continued my way through to Xiangshan mountain. It was a really nice walk and i was there when the sun was going down and i forgot how quick the sun went down. I recommend this trail for hiking and nothing else. The roads and stairs are quite small and narrow at some areas in the mountains.
Best hiking trail for beginners.Even if it's a short trail, I enjoyed a lot as it's surrounded with complete view taipei city and greenery too.

Its amazing to be able to take the train to go for a hike in the jungle. We walked from Houshanpi station and happily wandered for hours through this sacred mountain. It was pouring rain when we went, so all the giant snails and frogs came out and the creeks and waterfalls were joyful! There are a lot of stairs, great workout while admiring beautiful large ferns and canopies of trees.

Number of people: 2 adults
-

🚾There are two toilets next to Zhenguang Zen Temple, one sitting toilet and one squatting toilet
-
Tiger Mountain is one of the Four Beast Mountains in Taipei. The highest altitude is only 140m. There is a parking lot next to the trailhead.

The road is basically flat from the entrance, and there are trees on both sides to provide some shade from the sun☀️The walk will be smooth and you will first pass by the Tiger Roaring Pavilion, the Four Beasts Pavilion & the Four Beasts Square. There will be some stairs but they are not too long or too long. It’s too steep, but we two weaklings still panted slightly when we walked 😅

Go all the way to what looks like the end of the road, and you will connect to the road. Zhenguang Zen Temple will be on the left hand side. There is a restroom next to it that you can use. Then you can walk up the trail next to Zhenguang Zen Temple (with your back to the temple) (right hand side), this section has more stairs, climb all the way to the top.

Above is Yuanyuan Square, and you can see 101 a little further away. Although it was a holiday that day, maybe because it was just noon when we went, we met almost no one along the way.

It took us about 30 minutes to go from the entrance to Yuanyuan Square above. We walked slowly in a relaxed way, sweating and panting slightly. It was a little exercise without being too tired.

details.name: Qixingshan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 5HC3+3J Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Considering transportation and the enjoyment, I rate 9/10. The trail was very beautiful we came from the Xiaoyoukeng bus stop and walk all the way here. The hike from the Xiaoyoukeng area to here was around 1-2 hours, taking a rest time and occasionally stopping to take in the view into account.

A lot of stairs, I think this is a perfect hike for beginners. I started at Meguang pond parking lot and went all the way up to the east peak and finished up at the main peak which is only 0.3KM from the east peak. Overall beautiful scenery!!
Good view and not too difficult to reach the peak. Light smell of sulfur compare to other hot spring field. Do recommend to come over every season except raining day. The stairway is slippy.
The scenery is absolutely stunning! It appears to be a popular hiking destination among elderly locals. However, ascending the trail still demands a reasonable level of physical fitness.

Beautiful hike if you’re visiting Taipei and like hiking. The trail is paved with stones throughout but some portions are steep, so you need a decent fitness level to climb it. I was advised to take an Uber to Xiaoyoukeng, where you see the volcanic fumaroles, climb to Qixingshan Main Peak, then move on to Qixingshan East Peak (just a short distance away from the main peak), then descend to Lengshuikeng and take the S15 bus down to Jiantan MRT station from there.

Considering transportation and the enjoyment, I rate 9/10. The trail was very beautiful we came from the Xiaoyoukeng bus stop and walk all the way here. The hike from the Xiaoyoukeng area to here was around 1-2 hours, taking a rest time and occasionally stopping to take in the view into account.

A lot of stairs, I think this is a perfect hike for beginners. I started at Meguang pond parking lot and went all the way up to the east peak and finished up at the main peak which is only 0.3KM from the east peak. Overall beautiful scenery!!
Good view and not too difficult to reach the peak. Light smell of sulfur compare to other hot spring field. Do recommend to come over every season except raining day. The stairway is slippy.
The scenery is absolutely stunning! It appears to be a popular hiking destination among elderly locals. However, ascending the trail still demands a reasonable level of physical fitness.

Beautiful hike if you’re visiting Taipei and like hiking. The trail is paved with stones throughout but some portions are steep, so you need a decent fitness level to climb it. I was advised to take an Uber to Xiaoyoukeng, where you see the volcanic fumaroles, climb to Qixingshan Main Peak, then move on to Qixingshan East Peak (just a short distance away from the main peak), then descend to Lengshuikeng and take the S15 bus down to Jiantan MRT station from there.

The highest peak in Taipei City is indeed extraordinary. When the sky is clear, you can have an unparalleled view of the Taipei skyline and other mountain and sea cityscapes. You can see the north coast and Keelung Island; when it is covered in heavy fog, it looks like a fairy mountain in the sky or an out-of-this-world floating mountain. The weather here changes very quickly, from sunny days at the foot of the mountain to white walls at the top of the mountain, but there are different styles when you visit in different seasons and climates. Since there are always a lot of people climbing there, mountaineers jokingly call it the Qixing Mountain Vegetable Market.

There are three routes to climb Qixing Mountain. You can connect them from A to B or retrace your steps:
1. Depart from Xiaoyoukeng Service Station: This trail is the shortest and gentlest. There are various volcanic landscapes such as sulfur fumaroles to enjoy along the way, and you will feel a sense of change as you climb up. The whole journey is about 1.6km, and it takes 40-60 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain, and another 10-15 minutes to reach the east peak of Qixing Mountain.

2. Depart from Lengshuikeng Service Station: The whole journey is about 1.8km. It takes 60-80 minutes to reach the East Peak first, and then 10-15 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain. The last 600m of the trail requires some physical strength, but you can reach the top with more effort. . Along the way, you have a good view of Lengshuikeng and Qingtiangang mountains. You can also see the Taipei city skyline halfway. You can also turn to Dream Lake, Qixing Park and other scenic spots halfway.
*The above two routes have almost no shade, so be sure to wear sunscreen and prepare drinking water.

3. Departing from Miaopu Trailhead: This route is the longest, about 2.3km. The first 1.3km is easy to walk on a gentle climb, while the next 1km is steep and tests your physical fitness. The trail ends at the saddle between the main peak and the east peak. You can reach the top of the two peaks by climbing another 150m each. Although this section requires the most physical strength, the whole process is protected from exposure to the sun under beautiful woods, and the forest ecology is rich.
The Miaopu trailhead is located behind the National Park Visitor Center. You can follow the pedestrian-vehicle separation trail from Yangmingshan Bus Terminal. The whole journey is easy and easy to walk, and it takes about 15 minutes. Alternatively, you can transfer to the 108 park bus from the terminal and stop at the Scout Station. Get off the bus and arrive at the trailhead.

The main peak of Qixing Mountain is 1120m above sea level. It is not only the highest peak in Taipei City, but also one of the smallest mountains in Taiwan. There is a first-class triangular point on the top of the mountain. The east peak of Qixing Mountain is 1107m above sea level and has a third-order triangular point foundation stone. The two famous mountains have great views, and there are several large platforms for resting on the top of the main peak.

It is 2.1km up to the main peak from Lengshuikeng...First go to the East Peak, then cut down and then go up to the main peak...There are steep stairs all the way...but the scenery along the way is great and worth the climb.
Great scenery, good luck👍
A good mountain to walk on

details.name: Jiantanshan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 3GHF+RW Taiwan, 台北市中山區劍潭里

reviews.text: Nice and interesting hiking trail. It offers a very beautiful view of Taipei city. The path is very clearly directed, directions and maps are available. Toilet facilities and parking are also well available. The entry gates are also reachable menggunakan public transportation such as buses and MRT.

Easy hike, good for beginners.
Winter would  be the best time for hiking in Taipei - not sunny, not humid and cool.

There's a water cooler at the temple half way and a new look out place.
You can watch the planes flying in.

Nicely paved stairs all the way up.

This is Taipei’s shortest mountain, but the city views are beautiful 😍
Easy walk up and down the stone stairs. You’ll also pass by some temples with local community areas where elderly gather and sing karaoke and exercise in the evenings haha

The leisurely walk up to the Grand Hotel Taipei, then up to the Radio Tower round trip with stops for photos took a little less than 2 hours.

Entrance is just 5 minutes walk away from Jiantan MRT (red line) exit 2.

Not perfect but good enough especially due to the ease of access for Taipei dwellers. Get there by any form of transportation, MRT Jiantan stop, bus stop, YouBike, car, walk. There is an OK bathroom at the entrance, which is lovely and is a challenging flight of stairs so take it easy as you start out. There are more leveled paths once you’re up higher in the mountain so it does get easier. Almost all cement paths or stairs though there are some worn out dirt patches which is easier on the knees. It’s also neat there are many other paths you can take to explore different parts of the mountain so you can plan accordingly to what time you have available. Strangely there are some badminton courts in mostly poor condition and I imagine you don’t find many people playing there. Quite a bit of mosquitoes so I’d recommend wearing long pants and long light jacket with shirt sleeves tshirt even in hot summer months. It gets windy once you’re out in the clearing like “The Usual/Old Place” (老地方) where you have a great view of Taipei City and Songshan Airport (aka “plane spotting area”). Lots of signage so there’s little worries about getting lost. Lots of resting places too though some are a simple stool but it works for those who need it. Bathrooms available up in the trails too but spread out some. Lots of old time bunkers no longer in use but serves nicely for photos. Also lots of small temples everywhere and some have karaoke going on even on weekday mornings. Expect more than usual people since it’s conveniently located in the city. Probably not  good for elementary school children since it’s quite a climb at some parts. Took me about an hour going to the Old Place but only half an hour returning. I tend to enjoying hikes with fewer people around but the location itself is likely to draw me back frequently. Bring enough water as there doesn’t seem to be any replenishments along the trails.

It a very beautiful mountain trail! There are some paths that lead off into storage areas, so if youre new it gets a little confusing. I couldn’t tell where one of the main oaths went to since left was a temple and right was closed off. I didnt known if I was allowed/supposed to walk through the temple areas.
There is sometimes music playing. At first I thought it was the temple’s, but soon realized we were walking past private property and it was people singing karaoke.

There are shade trees along the way, there are places to rest along the way, and you can follow the route as you like. It is a good public outing trail for urbanites, and the facilities are also very well planned.

Located behind the Grand Hotel, there is a trail group with Jiantan Mountain as its core. Climb up from the archway of Yuanshan Scenic Area on Zhongshan North Road. There are stairs all the way up. You will be a little breathless, but it is still an entry-level route for parents and children. The stairs are mostly shaded and will not be directly exposed to the sun, but the magical sounds of karaoke are often accompanied along the way.

It takes about 20 to 30 minutes to reach the viewing platform. There is the eye-catching Zhongguang Yuanshan Microwave Station next to it, and there are also restrooms here. The observation deck has an excellent outlook, with a panoramic view of Taipei city, Songshan Airport and Keelung River. There are also viewing spots such as North Eye Platform and Breeze Platform, and the outlook is impeccable.

From the platform, follow the indicators and it will take about 5 to 10 minutes to reach the triangular point on the top of Jiantan Mountain. Afterwards, you can follow the signs to the popular Bamei Old Place viewing platform, or go on the Wenjian Mountain Crossing and other mountain trails. In the Liumei area, you can see the scenery of Shilin, Guandu and Guanyin Mountain. You can also explore this popular hiking route behind the Grand Hotel or at the Bei'an Road trailhead.
great

reviews.text: My go to hiking spot in Taipei beside the elephant mountain. The place isn’t very crowded. You can walk to and from Fuzhoushan which isn’t very far from this peak. You can also access this peak by walking along side the road before entering the tunnel, the entrance will be on your left. Overall atmosphere is good. On New Years I spent my night here, not too crowded, Taipei 101 view, 9/10.

It's my favorite trail and very convenient, but you have to be careful because, after rain, the trail becomes slippery. Usually, I start from Fuzhoushan, and finish at Heping Rd. It takes around 3 km. For the foreigner who cannot understand mandarin, I suggest reading the sign carefully because some path doesn't work.

details.adr_address: Zhongshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 10491
details.formatted_address: Zhongshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan 10491
details.name: Jiantan Mountain

plus_code.compound_code: 3GMH+PP Zhongshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Jiantan Mountain offers an invigorating hike and breathtaking views of Taipei, the Songshan airport, and the iconic Taipei 101. The trails can be completed in around 30-60 minutes, with moderate inclines that cater to a variety of fitness levels. The routes meander through shaded forests, offering a cool respite from the city bustle and making it a popular choice among locals. Adding to its convenience, Jiantan Mountain is conveniently located near an MRT station.
Nice trail outskirt of Taipei City. Accessible via buses and MRT.

Very nice hikes just beside the Grand Hotel. It's mainly concrete stairs so no special equipment needed. Lots of small tea houses on the way to stop and great view over Taipei from the top and scenic points.

Jiantan Mountain is located in the neighborhood of Jiantan Station (Exit 2) of the Taipei Metro (MRT). When you get off the train, follow the sign and walk across the road. The entrance of the trail is right next to a small temple.

Along the trail there are a number of badminton courts and fenced spots for recreational use. Singing is often heard, and litter is not rarely seen. You do not find much peace and quiet here, but, unfortunately, more disturbance.

When you arrive at the observatory, however, you will be attracted by the expansive view. Jiantan Mountain is in fact one of the few places nearest to the center of Taipei where you can see planes taking off and landing.

I suggest that you continue and arrive at the Laodifang (the Usual Place) to take in a different view.

After that you can return to where you went or choose to get out at Lane 282, Section 5 of Zhongshan North Road (near Ming Chuan University) or Lane 165, Tongbei Street (near Shih Chien University).

One of the advantages of Jiantan Mountain is its proximity to Jiantan Station and its surrounding attractions, Shilin Night Market in particular. You can take a tour and have some snacks after the hike.
A dark corner beside the hiking trails. Not much worthy to look at.

A dark corner beside the hiking trails. Not much worthy to look at.
If you have iron feet, climbing will be easy

With an elevation of 153m, Jiantan Mountain is one of the small mountains in Taiwan. There is a second-class triangular point on the top of the mountain, but there is no special outlook. A better outlook is at the Breeze Observation Platform not far away. The view from the Observation Platform next to Zhongguang Yuanshan Microwave Station is also great. There is also a restroom here.

Climb up from the archway of Yuanshan Scenic Area on Zhongshan North Road and follow the stairs all the way up. It takes about 20 minutes to reach the viewing platform, and then about 5 minutes to reach the triangular point on the top of Jiantan Mountain. Afterwards, you can follow the signs to the popular old place to watch the aircraft, or you can even take the Wenjian Mountain Crossing and other mountain trails, which are very popular hiking and mountain climbing routes.

The trailhead is next to the bus stop Jiantan Station, and the toilets are at Jiantan Fuzheng Palace and the Central Broadcasting Station Yuanshan Microwave Station next to the trailhead. Cars can be parked in the underground parking lot of Bailing High School. The trailhead is at Jiantan Mountain ( Xiaobaiyue #009, 152 meters above sea level) takes about 1 hour to and from the triangular point. It is very friendly and suitable for the whole family to go together.

reviews.text: Among the 4 animals summits, Leopard is not that attractive because part of the trail is out of the jungle and it involves some ordinary road. But it still makes sense to pass by when hiking between the various summits, including peak 95 and MuShiShan.

One of the best little hikes around Taipei. Easier to get to than Elephant mountain, less people, and more beautiful (but if you go here instead of elephant mountain you do miss that picture spot everyone and their grandma has a picture of) . For a 30 minute hike, it's a gem.
The hike isn't that hard. There's a paved path. it's through a lot of trees. It can be quite humid. So there's too many mosquitoes. Use mosquito repellent.
A easy to access hiking trail among the Four Animal Mountain’s trails system.
A park with lake

It feels like a small secret place. I took my four-year-old child to climb it. He happened to be tired and reached the Leopard Mountain Peak.

The trail is a bit difficult. There are small steps all the way. The scenery along the way is not bad. It requires a little physical strength to go up the mountain... I met an older mountain friend on the way, who was very friendly and gave me directions and chat 🥰
Ecologically rich
The scenery is good and can be connected to Xiangshan Mountain and Shishan Mountain.

2023-01-21 Sat New Year’s Eve
It turns out there is a trailhead here

2024-02-08 Thu Little New Year’s Eve
About a year later, I realized my self-requirement of climbing Leopard Mountain.

reviews.text:
Small walking trail(~40 minutes), it takes about 20 minutes to reach the peak point. The view from the peak pavilion is quite Beautiful.

Hiking trail is located at about 200 metres from the Jingmei MRT station.

Good option if you want to have hiking moment for only short time. It's easy stairs to step and hike. There is buddhist temple to stop by and pray before continue the hiking into the end of uphill. Be mind that there is squirrel. It's good to take pictures here, but the other trails maybe offer the better side.

Near downtown, a good place to take a hike.

It occurred to me to go hiking this morning, and I was just randomly navigating the Internet. XienJiYen Trail just showed up on the screen.

Recommend you to come here if you don’t have much time, but still want to get close to the hill. The height is just 144m, so the hike would only take you around 1 hour.
It was easy to access. About 20-30mins. Good for family with children. You can see lots of wild squirrels along the trail.

A nice and easy trail to tackle. You don’t need to be an expert hiker. It has some steps but also lots of slopes and nothing is too steep. The views at the top are beautiful. I went in the morning and got a great sunny view of southern Taipei.

reviews.text:
A nice trail near the city of Taipei. Make sure to bring some gear and trail sticks as well. Be careful of snakes along the trail since we encountered a big cobra going into the hole near the trail rock/path - very scary one though. (Big meaning an almost arm size in diameter) After the cobra incident, we found two more mini size snakes which was not easy if you are not a fan of snakes. The trail can be pushed to a 6 hours trail, connecting this one to another trail. Great for a good morning exercise, with lots of steps going ups and downs.
Did not see the buffalo anyhow. Would definitely recommend this one for sure.

Great trail, somewhere muddy. Only a few benches to sit down.
If you are lucky you can see some buffaloes.
The pine forest is really beautiful.
The trail provides very good view, which is very rare in Taiwans mountain. But it also means it’s very exposed. Need to do a good job on sun protection to avoid from sunburn.
It is good to relax and feel a fresh new air and view that helps motivate to strive on.
Very nice place. But finding a clean toilet is a real trouble, specially for ladies.

reviews.text: Its a shame that you cant see the viee of tbe lake from top of the mountain. Great little hike after having a scenic view on the lake below.

It is a short but nice trail. There are more stairs if you come from Dahu park. If you come from the other side you can walk through the park and then reach other trails by walking 10 minutes  North to Dagouxi Park. Make a day out of it.
Not a great view from top because of tall trees , but good for a simple small trek from Dahu park. A breath of fresh air to take a break from city pollution. Easy access from brown line!
The mountain is suitable for ones who wants to do mild hiking tho. Not many scenery spots, just took me around 15 mins to reach the mountain’s peak.

Don't come for the scenery, because there really isn't any. The trail takes about 30 minutes. There were more people than I expected for a weekday afternoon. There were some slick spots even tho it hasn't rained for a couple days. It does connect up to Dahu Park which is decent.

details.vicinity: No. 2號, 南京東路三段, Zhongshan District

reviews.text: Its a shame that you cant see the viee of tbe lake from top of the mountain. Great little hike after having a scenic view on the lake below.

Don't come for the scenery, because there really isn't any. The trail takes about 30 minutes. There were more people than I expected for a weekday afternoon. There were some slick spots even tho it hasn't rained for a couple days. It does connect up to Dahu Park which is decent.
The stone trails and stairs along the way are not difficult and the outlook is limited.
Walking from Dahu Park to Bailushan Mountain is a great place for a walk
It’s gentle and easy to walk on, so it’s a good place for people who are afraid of stairs.

The popular parent-child hiking hill next to Dahu Park has two trailheads, Huigong Temple and Jinhu Road. The elevation of Bailu Mountain is 143m, and there is a foundation stone of the Land Survey Bureau map. The view from the top of the mountain is mostly blocked by the woods, and you can only vaguely overlook the lake view of Dahu Park. There are resting pavilions at the top of the mountain and even a wellness trail.

The trailhead of Laogong Temple is adjacent to Dahu Park. The distance to climb from here to the top of Bailushan Mountain is about 900m. It takes about 20-25 minutes to climb up and down. The slope of this section is steep, and the last 2/3 section is a continuous zigzag ladder climb. , suitable for training cardiopulmonary ability; but as long as you work hard, most people can still climb up.

The Jinhu Road trailhead is generally a gentle climb, making it easy to walk. If you have weak foot strength, it is recommended to go down from the Jinhu Road and the Husband Temple. There are complete public toilets available next to the entrance to the Laogong Temple.

details.name: Junjian Yan Hiking Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 4GF8+FV Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Junjianyan offers an impressive series of hiking trails tucked behind the University and Hospital, each revealing panoramic views of Taipei. You can opt for a long hike over an hour or choose a shorter 20-minute trail to a peak with stunning vistas. What makes these trails unique is their interconnectedness, linking peak to peak, and offering sweeping 360-degree views of Taipei. As a frequent visitor, I find myself hiking here every time I'm in the city.
It’s pretty close to the MRT station and there are quite some people on the weekends. Only less than half an hour of hike but the view is stunning! Totally recommend
Great walking trails intersection to Beitou’s walking paths but be careful of the slippery in some sections.

This is a short trail (20 mins up) to the famous Jungjiangyun (ie ‘battleship rock) to enjoy an amazing panorama of Taipei city. From the rock you can go west to Beitou (an hour) or turn east to Tianmu (30mins).
It's an easy trek, will not take you more than an hour yet when you reach the top, it's truly amazing to view some part of the city.

A very popular hiking route in the greater Taipei area, Warship Rock is only 186 meters above sea level, but it has a 360-degree view embracing the Taipei Basin, Guandu Plain, Xinbeitou Hot Spring Area, Datun Mountain, Guanyin Mountain, etc. In addition, the special landform of quartz sandstone makes the top of the mountain more unique.

Starting from the Yangming University trailhead, you can reach the top in about 20 minutes. The trail is easy to walk and suitable for all ages. It’s crowded on holidays and quite lively on weekdays. If you start from MRT Shipai Station, it takes about 25-30 minutes to walk to the trailhead. However, the section after entering the Yangming University gate is also uphill and there is no shade, so be careful about sun protection.
A great place for a walk

You can park your car inside Yang-Ming University and go up along the mountain trail. There are stairs but it is easy to walk. When coming down, take the trail on the left. The road condition is a little worse. After passing the tunnel, it just makes a circle.
The scenery after reaching the top is beautiful and the difficulty level is lower than the hiking trails.

reviews.text:
It was such a nice hike/walk. We started at Juan Si waterfall instead of the visitor center so that we will hike up to the top instead of just doing a small loop.

It’s the perfect place for a picnic, rmb to bring sandwiches and drinks up as there is only 1 convenience store that sells drinks and snacks.

There are 2 buses that goes back to Taipei. S15 gets you back to Jian Tan station which is where Shilin Night Market is, this bus will have a long queue and supposedly comes at a 20 mins frequency. My partner and I decided to take the other bus that was available and stopped at a building to take another bus to Bei Tou MRT which worked out better for us as we prefer to take the MRT which had a higher frequency.

Very pleasant stone trail with some reasonable uphill sections. I have only visited on rainy days but the view is still quite nice. I went on a Friday afternoon and was the only person on the trail and encountered some local wild dogs. They barked and snarled but didn't follow me too far, thankfully! Just be careful. Parking was plentiful on a rainy weekday but on weekends, even if rainy, you'll have to park elsewhere and take the round robin bus. I don't recommend walking the road to the trail if you can't park at the grassland parking lot. Too long and too many blind turns.

Relaxing place and nice view😍
One of the most amazing place and view of the mountain here in taiwan😍
You can try walking 500 meters to see the slope; then 2 km slow slope can go wild.

A huge and beautiful grassland, famous place on the Yanmin mountain of taipei, Taiwan. You might meet the wild Taiwan buffaloes when exploring as you own. There are also several natural and historical hiking trail around.
A truly fantastic and fun place for family visitors.

Came here on a beautiful day, the scenery here is very beautiful. Suitable for relaxing and taking beautiful photos with your loved one.

It's an easy walk and good for taking photos. Note that the cattle are safe and there is no shade. You can follow the circular trail to pick up Zhusong Mountain. Climb more than 100. It's easy. Pay attention to sun protection and strong wind.

This is the third time I have come here, but it is the first time I have encountered good weather. Although the sun is shining brightly today, the wind is strong and the temperature is cold. I will still sweat if I keep walking.
Away from the hustle and bustle, looking at the blue sky and white clouds, the green prairie, breathing the cool air on the mountains, and enjoying this moment of happiness!
If the weather is good, this is a very beautiful trail.

reviews.text: I loved the climb! It’s a very straight forward upwards climb with steeper steps towards the peak but it was very rewarding. The view of Taipei 101 and the city were really pretty. The climb is about 20 minutes but add 10 minutes for photo taking and waiting for people to take photos. There’s a totem indicating the peak but I walked a little more forward and found an even better view of Taipei 101. I recommend to walk another 20m to get an extra view. Climbing in January is great because of the cool weather.

It's unbelievable that there are so many forests and natural areas in the city. You can easily travel by bus or subway or by walking.

I came for the walk in January when the weather was moderately cold and slightly rainy, which was nice. The walkway is not difficult to walk, mostly stairs. The view from the top offers a great view of Taipei City and Taipei 101.

Feeling so fresh waking up early in the morning and walking the trail to the top of the mountain. You can spot the beautiful Taipei101 building from here too. I enjoyed the view along the way and feel rewarding when I reached the top. Surely recommend a morning walk for all the early birds.

Awesome trail. It's not easy but it's not hard. The elders on this path destroyed me lol. They're so fast. The stairs are steep in some areas. And they have good signage that tells you how long it takes to get to the next spot. It has excellent views of the city and plenty of photography spots.

Ten minutes walk from the MRT station and various starting points plus routes. Picked the paved version as didn’t have hiking shoes. Many spots to take photos and fill up with drinking water. Mind the insects if you tend to attract bites. Should plan to spend at least an hour to enjoy the hike.

It takes about an hour to go back and forth. The top of the mountain is beautiful and you can see the scenery of Xinyi District. It is also very close to the MRT station.
The 101 Scenic Stair Trail is located near MRT Xiangshan Station (you need to replenish water and pay attention to your condition when climbing the stairs)

Easy and satisfying walk to admire the Taipei skyline. From the metro station there are already signs indicating where to go to take the route. You can get on and off different streets, there is not just one. The route can however be completed in a loop. The only precaution is to be very careful if it is raining or wet, because the steps are very slippery and steep.
beautiful scenery

reviews.text: GOOD
It's a great hiking day.  ~Gary Kao
Good
Good

If you want to take the Liyu Mountain Trail, you can park your vehicle in the Bishanyan parking lot and walk down the Yuanjue Temple Trail (stairs). It will take about 10-20 minutes to reach the umbrella-shaped rest area depending on your personal journey. You can walk Take a short section to Yuanjue Waterfall. Continue to the right and walk along the stream bank. You can connect to the Liyu Mountain Lilliputian Trail. All the steps on the trail go straight up. It may be difficult for preschoolers or the elderly. Only when you reach the pavilion on the top of the mountain Going down, you can reach the Liyu Mountain Trailhead at the bottom of the mountain in about 10 minutes. It can become a circular trail, which is not bad!

[Reminder to pay attention to the physical condition of the elderly, because except for a small section on the creek bank, which is flat, the rest are stairs, which is more difficult for the elderly. There have been cases where the elderly fainted while resting😵]

There is a lot of shade along the Yuanjue Temple Trail, and the Liyu Mountain Trail is not bad. There are Lilliputian sculptures on both sides of the trail in the back section to see (the kids have been counting how many cars are glued to them😂), but they may be in disrepair and are in poor maintenance. Not very good.

Bishanyan has many tourists on weekends, and the parking lot is often full. People who want to hike can go out early.

A whole straight up staircase makes people breathless. The other Yuanjue Waterfall Trail is a staircase plus a gentle trail. It is easier to rest while walking than this one. There is a stream next to it that is very refreshing.
Mountain climbing for exercise, although there are stairs, can train your leg strength, but you must pay attention to safety when going down the mountain.

There are shade trees along the road and there are a lot of stairs.
The Lilliput sculptures on the roadside were made by an old man. I heard that it took fifteen years to slowly complete them.

reviews.text: Nice trail. It can be a very easy outing by walking from Bishan Temple to the top of Zhongyong. Lots of steps but it's only a matter of 15-20 minutes. There is a large statue of Chiang Kai Shek at the top. But the trail can be followed further, in particular, the walk from Bishan temple to Jiantan Station (or opposite direction) is one of the sections of the Taipei Grand Hike which is approximately 13 km. There are many signs along the route so you don't get lost.

There are three ways to get there. From the bronze statue next to the Bishanyan entrance to the top of the mountain, it should only take 20 minutes. There are not many stairs. It is a short walk, but if you go up from the Guanyin Buddha Cisheng Temple (motorcycles can be parked), it should be all stairs. It will take 30 to 40 minutes to make up for it when the other side has not passed.

Neihu Zhongyong Mountain Trail has complete facilities and is well maintained. The walkway is shaded by trees and is a good place for holiday sports. There is Bishanyan Temple at the foot of the mountain, and the panoramic view of Neihu can be seen from the square in front of the temple.

Awesome trail with steep stairs but worth the hike. We were lucky with sunny way up and ran into cloudy weather on our way down. It was definitely an unique experience. This is a must hike if you are in Jiufen.

It's cloudy at the moment so I can't see the city.

Keelung Mountain, which is not in Keelung, is ranked among the Small Hundred Mountains. The view from the top is impeccable, and the mountain and sea scenery seems to be within easy reach. The beautiful sea and sky in the northeastern corner of Keelung such as Bitoujiao and Yeliu are all in one color, while behind you are the settlement of Jiufen Mountain City. The beautiful scenery day and night is mesmerizing.

The trailhead is located near the rooftop parking lot. The trail is 900 meters long, but there are steep stone steps all the way up and there is no shade, so it requires some physical strength. However, since the distance is not long, you can reach the top in about 30-40 minutes. No matter how slowly you walk, you can definitely finish the climb within an hour. As long as you pay attention to the slipperiness after rain, it is still a suitable route for all ages.

The elevation of Keelung Mountain is 588m, and there is a third-order triangular point foundation stone on the top of the mountain. There is a Chinese-style pavilion next to the triangle point for resting. It is a good place for hiking and exercise when walking around the Jiufen area. For those who don’t like to climb stairs, there is a dirt road on the left about 200 meters along the trail. The whole trail goes up slowly and slowly. The slope is much gentler but the distance is longer.
It's good exercise. If you're not careful, you can get heatstroke, so don't forget to drink water!

It is a hiking route that has a commanding 360-degree view of the mountains and sea, and can also exercise cardiopulmonary function. The mountainous area is located within Yangmingshan National Park, but there are not too many people, but it is not inaccessible. In addition, almost all the trails are under the shade of trees and among bamboo forests, making it a quite comfortable route.

Zhongzheng Mountain has multiple trailheads. There are first and second trailheads from the direction of Zhuzi Lake to climb from high to "down"; or you can drive to the Zhongzheng Mountain parking lot and climb 500m to the top. The shortest route; as well as the Lingtou and Shibafen trailhead routes that start from the foot of the mountain and climb up step by step. It can even be expanded to the Postal Training Institute Trail, Fayu Temple Trail, etc., and extends all the way to Xinbeitou MRT Station. You can choose the difficulty and length.

Personally, I went up to the Shibafen Trailhead and off to the Lingtou Trailhead. Take bus No. 7 from Beitou MRT Station and get off at the Zhongzhengshan Trailhead Station. The trail next to the stop sign is the Shibafen Trailhead. There are grocery stores along the roadside for supplies. The total length of the Shibafen route to the top of Zhongzheng Mountain is about 1.5km. There are shaded stone steps along the trail. The first 0.6km goes up slowly, with butterflies flying from time to time, making the walk very pleasant; about 0.6km away there is a historical relic of a century-old charcoal kiln, which is worth a visit. But after 0.6km, the stairs climb unceremoniously all the way up, like a ladder to the sky. It is a time to test the endurance of the heart and lungs. At 1.2km, it slows down slightly to the top of the mountain. For those with normal leg strength, the one-way trip takes about 60 minutes, which is just right for training your physical fitness.

Zhongzheng Mountain, formerly known as Mituo Mountain, is also called Shibafen Mountain or Daganlin Mountain. It has an altitude of 646m and has two cornerstones, the Land Survey Bureau Tugen Point and the Beishi Triangle Point. The cornerstone of Beishi Triangle Point is hidden next to the observation deck, so it’s easy to miss it if you’re not paying attention. The name Zhongzheng Mountain must be in memory of the former president. In the past, the two characters "Zhongzheng" were cut out at the foot of the mountain on the side facing the city.

The eye-catching viewing platform on the top of the mountain is a three-story wooden platform with seats for mountaineers to rest. The view on the observation deck is so wide that it makes people exclaim, and they feel instantly relaxed. Directly behind are the ten consecutive peaks of Yangmingshan such as Datun Mountain and Qixing Mountain. To the left are the rounded Shamao Mountains and the Huagang area of ​​the Cultural University. To the front are the high-rise buildings and the Guandu Plain in the Taipei Basin. To the right are the scenery. You will have a clear view of Tamsui River Estuary and Guanyin Mountain.

The distance from the top of the mountain to the parking lot of Zhongzheng Mountain is 500m, which is also the shortest route to climb Zhongzheng Mountain. It takes 15 minutes to go down, and nearly 30 minutes to climb from the parking lot to the top. The Zhongzhengshan parking lot is wide and easy to park, and there is an observation deck next to it, so many people drive here to enjoy the night view.

There is still about 1km to go down the mountain from Zhongzhengshan parking lot in the direction of Lingtou. The trail intersects with zigzag industrial roads from time to time. It takes about 25 minutes to go down to the Lingtou trailhead on the mountain climbing road. There are Rubbing Pavilion and Zhongzheng Mountain. Shanqinshan Trail Monument. Walking further down for about 5 minutes, you can reach the Lingtou stop of the minibus 7. On the contrary, you can also start from the Lingtou trailhead, go all the way up through the Zhongzhengshan parking lot, and then climb to the top of Zhongzhengshan.

It really only took 15 minutes without taking a break.
Very sunny, but also very cool
What a beautiful view!
Go directly to the parking lot and then go up👍👍👍🫰🏻

There are a lot of mosquitoes, so it is recommended to wear long sleeves and long pants when hiking. It is about 500 meters from the parking lot to the observation deck. There are shade trees along the way, so you will not be exposed to the sun.
There is a Tudigong Temple next to the trailhead and a parking lot.
There is no restroom, which is a bit inconvenient.

The climb up to the Shibafen trailhead is steep, and there are so many mosquitoes that mosquito repellent is a must. After 1.5km to the top of the mountain, you will be surrounded by beautiful scenery. If you go around in a counterclockwise direction, you will encounter very special leaf insects (green wax cicadas), pine trees, and bamboo chickens. , dung-pushing turtle

reviews.text: Teapot Mountain offers an invigorating hiking experience with breathtaking vistas. The trail's twists and turns keep you engaged, and reaching the summit feels like a victorious pour of scenic beauty. The teapot-shaped rock formation is a unique reward for your efforts. Highly recommended for hikers seeking both challenge and charm!

Really amazing trail with beautiful views on the coast and the mountains around Jiufen. It’s a bit challenging, in some parts you need to climb with a ropes but still manageable for many people. When you are on top of the teapot there is a small kind of hidden path that continues to higher peaks, don’t miss it ! It’s really worth it.
Great hike! Only take into account that if you want to reach the last meters of the top you need to climb a Rock that has ropes but it is not mandatory
One of the best hiking place on good weather, you either just go up and down or you can go to a higher place from there to get it more exciting. The loop will end at the gold museum

Walked up the road from Jinguashi Gold Temple Museum on a hot summer's day. You can get an amazing view of the Yinyang Sea on this trail.

After climbing up many steps and using a rope to haul yourself up to the summit, enjoy a cool break in the shelter of the rock formation at the top. The rocks are curiously placed with many paths to cross the summit, following which you can go down towards Banpingshan.

I spent a good half an hour exploring the various rocks on the summit – it's like a giant playground – watch your step!

Regrettably I didn't have time to go on to Banpingshan this trip, so I took the path round the side of the mountain to get back to the trail down back to the foot of the mountain.

There are many loose rocks near the summit, so be careful especially in rainy weather. Wearing good hiking shoes will also help you avoid injuries!

Very beautiful hike – worth taking a night or two in Jiufen to see these mountains. On a clear day, you will be able to see Mt Keelung and the ridgeline from the summit.

reviews.text: Okay, so the people who say it's a thousand steps are wrong. It's 1562 steps to the top. Great hike. I now better understand the term "pashan". Very windy at the top in the winter. The temperature difference was noticeable. Also, caught some monkeys on the path. Great half day hike!
Great hike.  It’s easier then it seem!  Took us 40 minutes to go all the stairs up and down.

It's a hard at first (stairs and going height), but really rewarding when you realize how much height you gain to see the view! Reminds me why I love of Tianmu. Close to nature and appreciate water source.

Fantastic place to go came back to Taiwan cuz of covid , since last year neighborhood introduced this trail from the 1st time I tried till now fall in love with this place.
V good for hiking jogging excised can feel the fresh air n view of sunset it's wonderful place. Will bring friends from overseas friends here often.
Saw this old lady carry heavy bambooshuts way down, helps her bring it down but she need to sell it so easy way. I just bought them all save her harsel lol.

Tianmu old trail is a nice hiking place for Taipei people. It is from Tianmu to Chinese Culture University, about 3 km and taking 1.5 hours for the trip.
In the beginning, you need to climb about 1000-ish stairs to accomplish half trail and start to enjoy the flat trail and forest bathing.
Some history big tube builded by Japanese and Taiwan monkey will accompany you in this comfortable journey.

For a novice mountaineer, the one-way time is indeed about 90 minutes as indicated on the trailhead. There is a section of stairs in the middle that is steep, mainly because there are many stairs, and the downhill slope at the end of the return trip is also steep. Traveling friends said: If the level of flat land is 1, the difficulty level of Tianmu Ancient Trail is about 2, which is very suitable for beginners to practice mountaineering.

There will indeed be macaques along the way, so it is recommended to go together to avoid being scared. If you do encounter one, remember not to make eye contact with the monkeys, and be careful to pass safely and quickly.

The shortcoming is that there are really no toilets along the road. Remember to go to the toilet before entering the trailhead. I walked to Tianmu Circle to borrow the toilet from Mr. Boris, ha!

The transportation is convenient. The stairs at the beginning are difficult. After climbing the stairs, the gravel road is easy to walk and there are shade trees. You should be careful when you see monkeys occasionally.

reviews.text: A short, well constructed hiking trail in Yangmingshan suitable for all levels including children. I entered through the camping site area with some wooden posts and a few stone owls at the entrance and bathrooms on the left. Go straight up a ramp where you get to Valentine Lake and the Guizekeng Soil and Water Conservation Education Park. The trail entrance is accessible from the right hand side of the lake. This time I was hiking the trail as part of the first section of Taipei Grand Hike and continued on to Erziping after scaling to the end of the trail.

Excellent hiking trail with a lot of stone stairs. Before going to the trail, there are two recreation places; camping ground and environmental education, provide people for picnic or rest. You can go a round trip on the trail, or explore other trails on the peak to Gandou or Yangmingshan.

A small trail with two entrances that aren't too far from each other. There's some parking near the entrances, but you might have to park elsewhere and walk a little. Once you've reached the top of this trail, you can walk a bit further and continue to Qingtian temple, which is part of the Grand hike Taipei. There are a few rest pavilions on the trail, they're usually busy  with people cooking food on the weekend. The trail itself is relatively easy, stairs mostly. Steeper incline at the beginning but a nice level walk on the mountain ridge for 15 minutes or so.
Stairs for whole trip, you will sweat lots.
Quite a lot of steps in the beginning... ... not too bad.

reviews.text: The peak of Hushan is definitely one of the beautiful sunset points in Taipei. View of Taipei City from the pavilion of the peak is quite beautiful.
If you start here the stairs are steep and boring.. and the weeds are overgrown on both sides of the path. When you reach the top though to the well maintained part of the trail its quite enjoyable.
A well constructed mountain trail for you to teach the Tiger mountain.

The ridge of Tiger Mountain and the top of Tiger Mountain Mountain,
A sweeping view of most of Taipei City’s Xinyi District!
You can follow the Hushan Ridge Trail, walk a short flight of stairs, and climb the stairs for about 10 minutes, 250m, to reach the top of Hushan Mountain: there is an asphalt road up from the foot of the mountain! It's not hard to walk!
9/22/2021

There is also the Si Beast Mountain Mountain Trail around Yongchunpi Ecological Wetland Park. You can go up the stairs next to the park to the Hushan Trail. There is a series of stairs going up, and then you turn right and there is another series of stairs. There are a lot of them. On the way, you will pass through a tunnel where you can take a short rest, and then there will be a series of stairs. At the end, you can reach the Yaochi Palace. It takes about 40 minutes to an hour to walk to the park. You can take another trail down the mountain. There is a platform on the way where you can enjoy the scenery of the entire Taipei City. Taipei 101 is right in front of you. It is a good place to watch the New Year's Eve fireworks. If you want to get to the trailhead of the park parking lot when going down the mountain, you can first follow the Google map. After passing the fork shown on the map, continue walking. When you see a cement road on both sides, turn left. This road is relatively narrow and The road condition is not very good, so please walk carefully. You will reach the small temple where you turn right at the beginning of the climb. It takes about 2 hours to walk around slowly. There are a lot of shade trees on the trail and it feels quite cool, but the steps are all stone trails, so be careful on slippery days in the rain.

#letsguide
#zuozuohuang’s food and entertainment review
#zuozuohuang

details.name: 土地公嶺古道

plus_code.compound_code: 2H6C+GC Wenshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Walking Trail is short and easy for you to explore connecting Tiaomi historic trail. Several historic trails are located in the Nangang Mountains, close to downtown residential area. However, not very interested due to hidden in the largest cemetery area in Taipei City. Most of the trails have been missing or changed only fragments are left.

We went here for MTB ride. The off-road trail is short but it's good for beginners. Although, it's been raining for the past few weeks, so it's quite slippery on most parts. We had to carry our bikes before the road leading to the trail, when we come back we'll find the road XD.
All in all, it was a good ride.
Great view.
Chongde Street is an ancient road connecting Heping East Road and is currently the sixth section of the Taipei Zongtong Trail. . .

In fact, the house next to the road is my hometown. I don’t know if it’s because of the mountainous terrain or some other problem. When I re-measured using satellites, the land in front of me actually became state-owned. Therefore, many hikers will "go astray" and run into my yard.
There are a lot of mosquitoes here. If you are particularly attracted to mosquitoes, please remember to bring mosquito repellent. The walkway is sometimes very narrow, so people with limited mobility must be careful. It is recommended to bring a walking stick and wear shoes with strong grip on the muddy ground. Especially after rain, it is recommended not to go because the road is muddy and very narrow. If you accidentally slip, you may fall and fall down the hillside.
Here you can overlook the buildings in Bei City, but you can also find that the air pollution is getting worse, resulting in insufficient visibility.
Although I believe Taiwanese people are now very civilized, some people still leave garbage and toilet paper on the road. I will convince myself that it fell out accidentally, but please still pay attention to maintaining the cleanliness of the environment.

reviews.text: It’s look east but little challenging because of wooden steps but overall view is great you can also alter the route to trail 3 trail 5 for more challenging but make your you have enough water supplies.

Nice and well maintained. Can be a bit busy though as it starts at a park that is pretty well used. It's pretty steep at first. If you can get past the first 10 minutes of stairs, the rest is obtainable with resting spots along the way.

It's basically just a wooden stairway up a mountain, but it is challenging and offers a good view as your reward. :)

Just don't forget to bring plenty of water!
(Also, I didn't see any monkeys, so don't count on it if you are going mainly for that.)

Shaded most of the path, not that tough if you are regularly active, gloves definitely not needed! Arrived by taxi, hiked across trail 5 at the top, down trail 2 (1 and 3 also work) and caught the#66 bus back into the da Keng bus area to transfer back to taichung

Such a great hike! My husband and I arrived at 4:15p and hiked til 5:30 (making it about halfway of the total 1.9 km), then turned around because sun was setting. We arrived back at the trailhead just as it got dark. Walking the 10 minutes from the trailhead back to the parking lot in the dark was a bit unsettling with monkey sightings and noises around us! 🤭
This would be a very tough trail with kids since the majority is logs walkways/stairways with big gaps between each log. But it was a wonderful adventure for my husband and I, who both seldom hike but exercise regularly. Watching the sunset from this ridge was ideal! Next time we plan to arrive earlier and enjoy both trail 4 and trail 5.

Nice trail. You will see wonderful views of Taichung city during your hiking, and at the end of the trail, you can peer at a part of central mountain range of Taiwan. I would suggest bringing gloves with you, in order to prevent from some sharp pieces of the woods and ropes. There are also pavilions to take a rest.

details.adr_address: 226, Taiwan, New Taipei City, Pingxi District, 石底里石底街24號
details.formatted_address: 226, Taiwan, New Taipei City, Pingxi District, 石底街24號
details.name: Xiaozishan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 2PFQ+6Q Taiwan, 新北市平溪區石底里

reviews.text:
Xiaozishan trail is located a short walk away from the Pingxi train station and old street, so it is pretty convenient.  Just cross the road and you will find the trailhead near the small waterfall. It is a pretty short trail, but the peak shows you a 360 view of the other peaks in the area too.

It is steep, but the steps are well cut out and maintained purposely, with sturdy handles if you need.

Try to go during off peak periods if you can, so you don't have to queue in line to get up and down the peak.

Best hiking experience and adventurous trail. The trail to the mountains (XiaoZi, Cimu, PuTuo, Cien) is steep, and it is little bit difficult to climb, but experience was very enthralling. The view from top of these mountains is very beautiful. It is advisable to go there when there is no rain, the steps can be slippery to climb if they are wet.
Nice view , a thrilling experience climbing these 3 peaks !👍👍👍

I like this mountain for hiking actually, very fun and thrilling sometimes! I had hiked for around 5 hours, very nice views of nature! All green colors with fresh air smells!!
Probably again next time!

I recommend for people who like or enjoy hiking usually! 😉

Wow!  This was one of the best hikes I’ve ever done… in the world. First, you get to go through a cool little town called Pingxi. Then you get to climb a well maintained path up to the good stuff.

Once you get to the first climb (I went counterclockwise), you find the first set of steps carved into the rock with ropes. That is the top of Mt Xiao. This one probably has the greatest vertical exposure with the ladders and pitch but it’s safe if you take your time and don’t freak out about the exposure. AmAzing views!

Then we went back down and took stairs to the south. That one is almost straight up with great views.

You can continue over it to the west but once down, the path isn’t clear. You have to bushwhack your get back to the paved path and I was concerned about snakes so we circled around and back up. Then went over the north side and down to the paved path.

Then back to Pingxi for lunch!!

It is steep, but the steps are well cut out and maintained purposely, with sturdy handles if you need.

Try to go during off peak periods if you can, so you don't have to queue in line to get up and down the peak.

Great place worth visiting

The journey is not far... but there is a lot of moss along the way... The final steps to the top of Xiaozi Mountain are very steep... It is recommended to wear non-slip shoes... From the top, you can see Putuo Mountain, the Cimu Peak next to it. . .

2024/03/12 Follow Grandma Shui’s hiking and hiking fun on the safe journey
Itinerary: Three mountains in Pingxi, New Taipei City (Putuo Mountain + Cimu Peak + Xiaozi Mountain) + Pingxi Old Street
Recommended route: Trailhead➡️Putuo Mountain (elevation 450m)↩️Cimu Peak (elevation 410m)➡️Xiaozi Mountain (elevation 360m)🔄Trailer entrance➡️Pingxi Old Street.
✴️Three mountains are adjacent and the road is not wide (about one person wide) and there will be traffic jams when there are many people. Please be polite when taking photos and don't take up too much time. Each one does not take too much time, so it is recommended to complete it together (it takes about 2 hours to complete the entire journey).
✴️There is a small car parking lot in front of the trailhead and a mobile toilet is available.
[To keep the mountain forest clean and tidy; things that do not belong on the mountain should be taken down the mountain by yourself].

Except for the top of the mountain, most of the rest are tree-shaded paths, which are not very sunny, but they are not suitable after rain or after continuous rain. The iron ladder part of Xiaozi Mountain is not suitable for pets to climb, but the rest are suitable.

This hiking trail:

15:00 Pingxi Railway Station trailhead (about 5 minutes after exiting the station, there is a restroom outside the trailhead, very clean) >>
Xiaozi Mountain + Cimu Peak + Putuo Mountain (the three main peaks; easy, can be completed in about one and a half hours) >>
17:00 Cien Ling (nearly vertical, requires rope climbing, just passed by this time, but there is a cliff path on the way to Cien Ling, the atmosphere is quiet) >>
17:30 Walk back to Pingxi Railway Station from the trailhead of Pingxi Junior High School

202312

editorial_summary.overview: Views of Sanxia & Taipei City from a hilly trail passing through forest & dotted with monuments.

details.name: Yuan Shan Hiking Trail

plus_code.compound_code: W9J3+3M Sanxia District, New Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
It was very good trail. You can just go up by car or motorbike. We have very big parking space. And just start walking to the trail. Everywhere you have signs. On weekends many old people are there and they are so nice. When you go up there there is one small restaurant and they serve tea, coffee and cookies. Please if you can bring some extra tea and coffee or cookies and put it there so next hikers can also enjoy. Bring more water if you can. It takes 3 hours with all enjoyment.
I like Taiwan 🇹🇼
A very nice spot to go hiking, it is quite safe as there are many road markings and lots of safety fences. It took around 1 and a half hour to reach the top.

The way from the Big Bell of 鳶山 to the peak is short, but you can carry on to the 福德坑山東峰 and 鳶尾山 which will take around 2 hours  though there's no view for the latter two peaks. The trail is quite original with a  lot of tree roots and some wooden path.
Young adventurers will enjoy this wilderness hiking trail. Wear sturdy hiking shoes and enjoy an adventurous day on the trail

Google will lead u to a very narrow road which is very difficult to meet the cars from another side. I personally think it’s quite dangerous to drive there if u r not familiar with. The parking slots on the entrance are only 6. So I don’t recommend to drive to here. Maybe it is better to just walk up. The walking trial is not very easy. So I recommend to wear a suitable shoes when u r here.

So I recommend to wear a suitable shoes when u r here.

Starting from the entrance of Laojie End, take the Yuanshan Trail. After passing the Liberation Memorial Bell, most of the trails are built on the ridges. Almost all of the mountain ridge trails are original earth and stone trails. The mountains are beautifully forested and shaded from the sun. The cool breeze blows and walking on the trails is refreshing.
Yuan Mountain, also known as Fudekeng Mountain, belongs to the Xueshan Mountains and is one of the small mountains in Taiwan. It is 321 meters above sea level. The top platform is equipped with a third-class triangular point. It has a good view and a good view, overlooking the Three Gorges and Yingying Mountain. Song, woods, mountains, and big streams are beautiful. When the weather is good, you can overlook the Taoyuan and Linkou terraces.

It connects Yuanshan Bell, Yuanshan Rock, Changchun Ridge, Fudekeng Mountain, Yuanshan Colorful Wall, Wufen Mountain and other scenic spots to form a popular mountaineering and hiking route, with good prospects along the way.

You can start from the trailhead opposite Aizen Park on Sanxia Old Street and walk up for 30 to 40 minutes to reach the Kite Mountain Bell. There are mostly industrial roads along the way, making it a good hiking place for people of all ages.
You can also drive directly to Dazhong via Yuanfeng Road. However, there are few parking spaces and it is difficult to pass a car. Driving is definitely not recommended during holidays. Motorcycles are quite convenient and highly maneuverable.

Starting from the Yuanshan Dazhong Trailhead, it takes about 5 minutes to reach Yuanshan Rock, 20 minutes to Changchun Ridge, 45 minutes to Fudekeng Mountain (Yuanshan), 1 hour to Yuanshan Colorful Wall, 90 minutes to 50 minutes Mountain.
The mountain trails along the way have some ups and downs, but most of them are easy to walk on the ridge. There is a short steep route before reaching the top of Fifty-Fen Mountain. As long as you pay attention to your steps, it is not very difficult.

You can drive to the big clock and walk up the trail. The night view is beautiful, but it is very dark at night. The trail is said to be not long, but there are several sections that require pulling ropes, making it difficult to climb at night.

details.formatted_address: Section 2, Zhongshe Rd, Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
details.name: Cuishan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 4H5C+5G Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: A serene trail allowing you to see Guanyin Shan and Yangmingshan.  The trail leads to many other trails. We started from the entrance and ended up in Neihu Bishanyan
A very good and short hiking trail within Taipei City. Good for a weekend leisurely walk.
Fresh air, less crowded than the main Yangming mountain trails
It's one good place for a hiking holiday to kids and elder people.
No difficulty at all. Costs you 1hr round trip.
A serene trail allowing you to see Guanyin Shan and Yangmingshan.  The trail leads to many other trails. We started from the entrance and ended up in Neihu Bishanyan

Fresh air, less crowded than the main Yangming mountain trails

No difficulty at all. Costs you 1hr round trip.
The best summer walking spot in the suburbs of Taipei, with tree shade along the way, beautiful scenery and fresh air
It is a good trail, but there are many branches and it is not a loop and requires you to retrace your steps.

Take bus 255 (district) to the terminal "Dalunwei Mountain". Walk along the road to the trailhead. There is a toilet in front of the trailhead. Not long after walking, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of Keelung River and Tamsui River, and then Cuishan Plaza. , like the former artillery position, it took less than ten minutes to arrive at the signpost where the Cuishan Trail connects to the Bixi Trail. Before that, the trail was flat and paved with stone bricks. After that, there were gravel roads or plank roads and climbing stairs. It's relaxing in the shade in the forest. When you reach Changshou Slope, go up to Dalunwei Mountain on your right hand. Continue walking down Bixi Trail and you will reach Bixi Industrial Road. Before reaching the industrial road, the trail bifurcates to the left and right, and the left path goes along the stream. You can reach the end of the Bixi Trail. Then go down through the Neishangxi Nature Center Medicinal Botanical Garden and return to Zhishan Road. I took the right path and walked up, coming out of the Dalunwei Mountain Industrial Road trailhead. Stop and go the whole way. We stopped and ate our own light meal, which took about 90 minutes. There are vendors selling food and drinks near the trailhead on holidays, and there are also mobile toilets. In order to see the "Dalun Lake" and the "Secret Bamboo Forest" introduced on the map, we continued to Baishi Lake. Go ahead and take bus 2 from Baishi Lake to Neihu MRT Station.

reviews.text: A 3.5km round trip 30 to 40 minutes to get up at an easy pace. Quite a few steps but not too difficult until the last part with the ropes which may be a little difficult for older climbers. But it’s well worth it beautiful view.

驚鴻一瞥A glimpse of the beautiful scenery

A little bit of sunshine, a little bit of smile,
a little bit of care, a little bit of happiness,
put aside the shadow of life and
walk out of the valley.

Very beautifull scenery! But the staircases are horrible, very bad for your knees! Don't do it if you have bad knees that's for sure! The trek is quite intense since it's never quite flat, always very steep climb most of the time! You should count three days to complete the basic trekking and you just need to arrange a permit which is for free and you can do online. I provide a lot if information in the photo's to make it easy to plan your trekking and the transport to Wulling farm, which we did from Luodong(Yilan)!

One of the most beautiful parks in Taiwan and a great place for hiking lovers.
A thousand cherry trees will blossom in spring makes this place as heaven.
Let go to enjoy the fresh air.
Went there during sakura season but sadly only a few sakura trees were blossoming in Wuling farm. Took about 4hours ride up hill and down hill...can get very sick and tired.

reviews.text: This hiking trail is nearby my house. It's easy to climb. We can able to see the city from the top of the hill. I will definitely recommend this trail. By the way, we can also fly the drone 💕🤪❤️✈️🛫🥏

There are many trails to choose in the mountains, my Golden and I had a great time exploring them. Our favorite is 六福步道(Lou-fu Trail), some others are 知性，環山，營磐，海山和穿山甲。We are lucky to live close to such a natural area where we can enjoy its greenness and clean air.

A good place for an afternoon hike. Been a little while not visiting the mountains, and good to meet WuTongJiouShan (五桶酒山）this time.

If you don’t want to go too far or don’t have much time, but you still want a little escape from the city, here is a good place to come, and easy to arrive.

Last but not least, please take all the things with you while leaving. Littering is not a wise choice. Let’s protect the nature all together.

plus_code.compound_code: XG4M+FX Taiwan, 新北市新店區美城里

reviews.text: A trail for a short hiking, not difficult to walk through, but the view was blocked by trees while walking through the riverside trail.

Mt.Hemei trail is an easy 3km+ walking and hiking trail. Spectacular view of Xindian on top of Mt. Hemei. Just cross Bitan suspension bridge from Xindian MRT station(green line) and you will see signage leading to the start of the trail. There's a small market in Xindian where you can buy some local delicacies. You can also enjoy other tourist attractions nearby after hiking👍👌
Some stairs but not too tough. Lots of place to take a short break and I consider it easy for beginners.
There are 2 pathways here. Bile one is along the river, and green one is in mountains. It usually takes about an hour for a path. It’s easy for the beginner.

It is a short hike that reward you a beautiful sky on a clear day🤩You can start the hike across the Bitan suspension bridge and exit in Plank Road Trail and ride a slow boat in ferry station 225m away from Happiness Plaza.20nt per person.I love the experienced.
A trail for a short hiking, not difficult to walk through, but the view was blocked by trees while walking through the riverside trail.

Many trails to choose from
There are 2 types of routes: mountains and seas
Stunning cityscapes to breathtaking spring scenery

After crossing the Bitan Bridge, you can walk for 5 minutes to reach the trailhead. The trail is generally primitive and has many shades of trees. There are many cute wild cats along the way. You can overlook the scenery of Bitan from the top of the mountain. On the return trip, you can take the branch line at Xindian Ferry Port, and then take the ferry across the river back to the other side. Overall, it is a very interesting experience.

details.adr_address: No. 556號, Fuxing 3rd Rd, 大屯里 Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan 112

reviews.text: That place is labeled "Taipei Grand Hike Section 1" (in short TGH), and this spot is indeed on the TGH trail. But at that spot, it's just the trail (from ZhongYiShan) joining a road. Nothing special even if the elevation starts to give a good view on Taipei. The road leads to a village with the QingTian temple (at roughly 700 m) which is the next landmark on the TGH trail.
To experience quite different aspects of the Taipei City. From urban to those mountain trails just take you half hour. Wonderful views make it worth the sweat.

easy walking trail
Overall not difficult
Simply long distance
Almost all people walk on concrete floors or stairs.
As long as it doesn't rain, it won't be slippery.

You can find toilets at the temple in the middle
You can also take buses to and from various points to go up and down the mountain.
It’s a very convenient hiking trail.
If you are interested, you can take a look
Just to kill time

Longitudinal walk in Taipei. It was a rare opportunity to take a ride on the Small 15. We started from the visitor center and passed through green grass, overlooking the mountains, rivers and sea. The beautiful scenery along the way really made it difficult to stop until my feet were so sore that I couldn't walk any further. It feels worth it. Finally, it is wonderful to have a cup of fragrant coffee in Neihu☕️.

The first section of the Taipei Zongtong Walk is from Guandu Station to Erziping. Personally, I think this section is the most difficult. If you walk from the foot of the mountain to the mountain, the height rises about 950 meters. The walking time is about 4-6 hours. Depart from Guandu Station along the road. It will pass by Beiyi Dazhongyishan Guohua Golf Course Guizikeng Qingtian Temple Datunping Erziping Erziping Parking Lot. Please note that the last bus from Erziping is at 5:30 pm. Along the way, you can see the northwest corner of the Taipei Basin and the mouth of the Tamsui River. Comfortable

reviews.text:
Great trail, took us 1h from the main road to the top.
Left early in the morning to enjoy the sunrise and it was totally worth it.
Took us around 40 min to go back, and we saw a lot (around 30) of monkeys, jumping from trees to trees over our head.
Totally worth it to start the day !
Absolutely worth visiting, the trail is pretty flat and quite easy to take, and the view at top (meteorological observatory) is beyond amazing. Encourage to come!
Fairly easy trail. Great views of mountains and the lake. You will also get to see how tea trees grow - cultured and wild ones. View from the meteo station  is amazing.

I enjoyed the misty, in-the -cloud experience at about 3/4 to the peak. Do slow down to observe many shapes of intricately woven spider webs along the trail. The route was well maintained. Need to take a flight of stairs to continue the trail.
Great view of the lake and tea farm nearby. Also a great spot to see the sunrise. It's an relatively easy trail around 1.5km long.

Comfortable😌Suitable for those who are afraid of the sun🈴️You can look into the distance
Easy walking trail with great views
Dogs can walk! Not many people and very comfortable~

Starting from the tea reform field, you go uphill all the way. There is a different scenery at every corner. Climb 200 meters to the weather station. On the way back, go downhill to exercise your knee joints.

It's a nice trail to walk. There are many olive trees next to the trail at the beginning, and the fragrance is refreshing. The end point is a weather station with restrooms. If you go back and forth at a fast pace, it will take one hour. If you walk slowly and take a break, you can finish it in two hours.

details.adr_address: No. 73, 仙岩路16巷文山區台北市 Taiwan 116
details.formatted_address: No. 73, 仙岩路16巷文山區台北市 Taiwan 116
details.name: Xianjiyan Maitian Trailhead

plus_code.compound_code: XHW2+PC Wenshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: I love to go hiking here and have great memories. I do recommend people take a trip around the hill.
Nice trail with some good climbs
Nice
Highly recommend

The trailhead on the Wheatfield branch of the Xianjiyan Trail is relatively remote. You have to ride up a steep slope to reach it. There are roadside parking spaces for cars and motorcycles in the surrounding area. There are many parking spaces for motorcycles, but parking spaces for cars seem difficult to find.

The trailhead is obvious. This branch is mainly made up of stairs. The stairs are gentle at the beginning, and after the middle section there is a long staircase that seems to be endless. Elderly people with weak knees are not suitable to enter from this trailhead.

According to the route on the explanation board, it takes about half an hour from the wheat field branch trailhead to Xianji Rock. After deducting the long steps in front, it is quite easy to walk after reaching the observation deck. There are also many seats or pavilions to rest.

Overall, the trail is well maintained, smooth and easy to walk. It is almost all under the shade of trees and there are no mosquitoes. It is suitable for parents and children. After arriving at Xianji Rock, there are wash basins, drinking fountains and toilets that you can use, and there are also tables and chairs where you can relax for a while. Take a break and eat something you brought (there are no trash cans, so you have to take your garbage down the mountain). In addition to the gods on the first floor, you can also go upstairs to the main hall to worship and pray for peace.

You need to pay more attention to your steps when returning to the long staircase section, especially on rainy days or after rain (the stone steps may be slippery).

reviews.text:
Nice place for a weekend hike. The trail was all stairs, and some were a bit steep. It was a quick hike, we got to the temple after about 15-20 minutes. There was a waterfall at the end of the trail and you can walk behind it too.
Overall a nice experience.
Great hike. Beautiful tea farms, views. Gets more challenging as you go on. Some steep steps, but has railings. Make sure wear shoes you don’t mind getting dirty

Very beautiful hike leading up to the waterfall. Trail is well maintained. The temple built into the cliff is really cool to see in person. The hike is fairly easy, the main challenge being a few sections of very steep stone stairway. You can continue all the way to Maokong Gondola station and beyond.
Pretty short hike with a nice waterfall you can walk behind. I usually start from Maokong and walk down from there. I hike this trail about once a year.
What a superb trail where you can immerse yourself in the feeling of deep subtropical forest in no more than 30 minutes of casual hiking of well-maintained stairs. So very cool.

Go back left and right. Viewing platform. Koshimada. Nakashimada. Oshimada.
Go back to the lower waist bypass road and go up Shimada Mountain. Go back to the lower waist bypass road and go straight to the first trailhead. The distance is 14.48km and the total climb is 1400m.

reviews.text: Spectacular view from the top! But these never-ending stairways almost had me broken down in tears… due to exhaustion of course 😂 DO NOT attempt to try unless you are determined to lose some weight… well I’m obviously exaggerating, but I’m not kidding. No I’m not. 😁

Very nice trail and well paved stairs, with sheltered resting areas. Ample signs to remind you to watch your step! Large open area at the top. Excellent view of Tamsui river mouth and markets opposite.
Nice trail. Not the easiest but only takes around 30 minutes each way. Great views of the city from the top. Can get pretty busy on the weekends.

A great trail! There are some small paths that go off the main stairs which I highly recommend for some more natural dirt paths and rope climbing. There aren’t many signs, but rest assured all the paths converge to the top.

I would recommend starting at 尖山步道 which then connects to this trail if you want a challenging hike!
Great hike most stairs, really busy on the weekend, free parking on the side of the road, or bus is reachable too

reviews.text: This historic trail starts at Der-hsin coal miner was a trail in the Chin dynasty for farmers carrying rice from San Chang Li to Mu Cha or Nan Gang. Around 500 stairs along the trails for 30 minutes climbing.
It's the sort of trail you could hike until your boots come off, which is highly inconvenient as you have to put them back on and re-tie the pair
nice and easy hike

if you kindly in love with mountains and trails but within city center limits you can trial this absolutely amazing trail. it's about history of how Taipei basin developed and Rice was grown in Wuxing Area which was further carried by simple people on their shoulders over other present Taipei area.it was back 19th century. Same as in 20th century it was coal mines all around here.
It's a small place to explore beside this there is a temple and a small hiking trail of 250mts. Once you climb you have a view of Taipei zoo  and Maokong Gondola.
