reviews.text:
Very well managed, and the view worth every sweat.

As a beginner hiker the route can be a little bit challenging.

I suggest you apply for the permit to hike from the trailhead to Paiyun lodge on the first day and stay overnight to hike to the peak and make your way back down on the next day.

Overall i would highly recommended. 🩵✨

Well worth the hike. Especially making it up top to the peak. The views from the trail are beautiful all along the hike! Of course the views from the top are some of the most magnificent. The lodge stay is okay, good for its circumstances. But don’t expect much from it. There is all sorts of beautiful scenes that I would love to come back during different times and do more than just the summit hike. Beautiful!

Top summit of Taiwan, no need to add anything more !. Yushan climb is really great, from start to finish. Many climbers consider that booking the entrance in the park is a bottleneck, but if you do not book one night at Paiyun lodge and do the climb in one day, it's easier to get the permit. That "one day climb" is for sure, a long day (like 26 km trail, with 1400 altitude elevation), but it's really doable for any trained hiker (and good weather conditions !).

Amazing hike to the highest mountain of Taiwan and the whole Western Pacific region. It took us 14 hours in total both ways during the one day trip but we had lots of stops and the weather was changing a lot as well, in better conditions you can do it under 12 hours I guess. Good hiking shoes recommended, the track is quite long for one day but totally doable if you are a bit fit. Only last 500 m is technical otherwise standard hiking trail.
A great sight for mountain lovers!! Definitely worth the long hike and chilling cold. Truly an awesome adventure. Such a beauty!

plus_code.compound_code: 5J67+W8 Taiwan, 花蓮縣秀林鄉富世村

reviews.text: The trail has so many beautiful views of the national park. The river is blue and green and the patterns of rocks are special. It has some cabins in the middle of the trail and you can have food there.

Absolutely fantastic trail. Amazing how far you can go into the gorge. The trail is relatively flat and easy to walk along. You should take some cash as there was a couple of stalls selling food and drinks. I only had a card 😒. It is a dog friendly trail.

Wonderful trail accessible to pretty much anyone as it's a very easy walk! This is an out-and-back trail meaning you walk straight till the end and walk back the same way. There isn't anything particular at the end of the trail so you can return whenever you feel like it. It does get much quieter and wild at the end of the trail, perfect for birdwatchers. It took me 4 hours but taking it slowly and allowing time for birdwatching. Come in early if you want to skip the crowds though, from 10am onwards, you will have a hard time enjoying the hike as buses start coming in.

Nice view in the beginning of the trail but kind of gets old after a while. No need to go to the end of the trail. Once you arrive at the coffee shop, according to google maps, you can turn back. Overall it's about a 3 hour round trip of the entire trail. If you go back after the supposed coffee shop it's more 2 hours. Can be done quicker if you are a fast walker. Better scenery at swallow grotto and tunnel of 9 tails

Easy trail, mostly paved. Lots of tourists start to come in at around 10am, but walk further into the trail and it gets quiet again. The water is so blue! I actually spent the entire day here, walking slowly and enjoying the view. Saw some cool birds and spiders, lots of gobies in the water.

The trail has so many beautiful views of the national park. The river is blue and green and the patterns of rocks are special. It has some cabins in the middle of the trail and you can have food there.

Absolutely fantastic trail. Amazing how far you can go into the gorge. The trail is relatively flat and easy to walk along. You should take some cash as there was a couple of stalls selling food and drinks. I only had a card 😒. It is a dog friendly trail.

There is a parking space and a toilet. It is very convenient. The entire trail is open in 20240314. It takes about 4 hours to go back and forth. It is suitable for travelers who want to travel in depth to Taroko.
I have never seen such a turquise water in a forrest. This was a beautiful walk in a peaceful environment.

One of the most beautiful places at Taroko gorge. Near the middle of the trail has indigenous people selling food, drinks, and souvenirs in their stalls so that's a plus. Right after that is a hiking permit only entrance to the next part of the trail. Make sure to get a permit if you decide to keep on going.

details.adr_address: 556, Taiwan, 南投縣信義鄉同富村
details.formatted_address: 556, Taiwan, 南投縣信義鄉同富村
details.name: Yushan Trailhead

plus_code.compound_code: FWG2+72 Taiwan, 南投縣信義鄉同富村

reviews.text: It's the starting of the normal trail to YuShan peak (but north or east peak can be joined too). The trail will also bring to Paiyun Lodge. So, this place is a landmark stop on the route to Yushan, and it is also a good place for souvenir pictures. Curiously, the road is restricted and regular cars or scooters can not go to this point. It means you will need to walk or take one of the appointed cars that can drive you there (for 100 TWD, one way). If you walk from the closest "allowed road" (close to Dongpu lodge), it is like 2.7 km away.
Wow amazing place, so pristine, beautiful. Enjoyed every step and every angle of this park. Be mindful not to over pack you will feel ever Kg in your body!

Some fantastic views in the area, a choice of mountains to climb and various trails to choose from. There is a taxi service for the trail heads so write the number down. That last couple of miles to your car can sometimes be the hardest.
Well worth the trek.

1. To summit at 13,000 feet, if at all possible spend a day or two above 9,000-10,000 before you make the attempt.
2. If you stay at Paiyun Lodge, on the trail just 2km from Yushan main peak, almost everyone gets up at 2am to noisily rearrange their packs next to your bunk. DongPu lodge is farther away, out near the main road, but early risers go to another room and are much quieter. And their bunk beds are MUCH cozier - fluffy comforters are included.
3. DongPu Lodge vans can take you 3km from the main road to Yushan trailhead for 100 NT$ (about $3.50 US). But you can easily walk.
4. There are other trails besides the one to Yushan, no permits required. We did a fun out and back all the way to "real" Deer Toe mountain, past the national observatory. (Look for an obscure hole in the underbrush to the left of the park boundary sign at coords 23.468482,120.873358.)

The round concourse where tracks meet is a good meeting point for hikers!  A stele stands here showing the path  to Mountain Jade. It is the stop where shuttle bus pick up passengers to the parking lot downhills, and hence it is the end of pitch road.

Well maintained. The jade management department is very attentive.
Feeling comfortable

details.adr_address: No. 51, Dabu Rd, 金圳里 Sanxia District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 237

editorial_summary.overview: Expansive mountain with 5 rugged peaks, offering hiking, rock climbing & river valley views.

details.formatted_address: No. 51, Dabu Rd, Sanxia District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 237
details.name: 五寮尖山

plus_code.compound_code: V9G8+P7 Taiwan, 新北市三峽區金圳里

reviews.text: This is Wuliao Peak, which is part of several trails around. The view from the top is nice but not breathtaking because it is still a low altitude summit (639 m). But all the fun comes from the trail itself, including ropes, sometimes ladders and steep rocks to climb. It is possible to do a loop hike (to return to the Yuli store) but the downhill way is deep in the forest, and I was surprised to find it wet and therefore slippery, even though I made this hike on a very sunny and hot day. And actually, it looks like hikers avoid it, because there were a lot of people on the uphill trail, but I only saw one person on that route.
Heed my word, bring sunscreen and gloves. Prepare for climbing using ropes 70% of the time. Walk slowly, take notes of the wind and wet stones.
Gorgeous place, prepare your gloves and get ready for a strenuous hike.
Fun hike, a lot more interesting than most other plain walking trails in Taiwan
I highly recommend this hike, just be careful if you're afraid of heights.

I highly recommend this hike, just be careful if you're afraid of heights.
I met several divine men along the way and was driven back by an enthusiastic brother. Thank you!

An urban girl fell down three times during her first challenge, spraining her ankle and requiring acupuncture.
After exercise training, the second challenge was easy😏🤣

Wuliaojian Rock Climbing:
Wuliaojian is a famous rock field in the north and a popular climbing route. Starting from the Yuli Store trailhead, you have to climb up the rope steeply from the beginning, which is not polite at all. There are many routes that require the use of hands and feet along the way. The highlight is climbing up Niubei Rock, then rappelling down the 30-meter "Cliff Magnificent Wind". You can also go around the independent rock to take beautiful photos online. The last section is not easy either, with ups and downs, and finally climbs steeply to the top of Wuliaojian Mountain. On the return trip, we chose another route to avoid the traffic jam on the cliffs, which took a total of 4.5 hours.

details.adr_address: 300, Taiwan, Hsinchu City, East District, 東山里寶山路145巷38號

editorial_summary.overview: Paved walkways & stairs on forested hillsides, with flowers & views from observation decks.

details.formatted_address: 300, Taiwan, Hsinchu City, East District, 寶山路145巷38號
details.name: Shibajianshan

plus_code.compound_code: QXRP+M6 Taiwan, 新竹市東區東山里

reviews.text: I had a few hours in the afternoon to check out the sites and decided to go for a hike at eighteen peaks.  It was a really worthwhile experience.  I love being in places with super lush greenery and this place didn't disappoint.  The forest was thick and green.  The hiking is pretty easy, so if you are going to look for a hard workout, this isn't the place for you, but if you want a nice walk, this is definitely worth visiting.
It's not actually hiking at all. Just a nice walk through the park that if you go to the right pavilions you can get a good view of Hsinchu

Huge place to "hike". You will be walking on a concrete. I don't consider this a hike because I think it is better to call it as walking. Great place to exercise though as there were a lot of pull up bars. Nice place to relax. There were a lot of water dispenser also so better bring your water bottle with you. I love this place and there's a lot of shade to hide you from the sun.

Great place to go for a morning run while in Hsinchu city. Quiet, safe place with many rest points and also a rest room at the start.

Easy to get there by taxi, bus or bike (can use the bike sharing ones) and there are lots of parking available too.

A very good park. Very close to the Chinchu City. A lots of free parking lots. Covering with a variety of trees 🌳 🌲, letting one can walk on the trails with no confusing with sunshine. Many R.O. water machines are freely provided on the roadside, so one can easily get a drink all the time when one walking or sporting here. The views are good to see the whole Chinchu City. Several toilets inside the park. Many historic bomb shelters exit in the park. Overall speaking, this is a very good city park, just like the Central Park in New York City.

新竹市民非常重要的自然遊憩場域，也能夠找到幾處蓊鬱的角落。很可惜很多老一輩居民把這裡當成自己家的卡拉OK場，也種了很多園藝的外來植物，糟糕的是，還有很多民眾在這裡亂丟過期加工食品不當掌餵食野生動物和流浪動物，使這裡的森林生態嚴重失衡，然而大家習以為常，官方單位也毫無作為。
Great for an afternoon walk
Although there are not many leisure facilities, the distance and height are just right for those who like hiking.
It is a simple and easy trail with many routes to choose from.
Great place for sports and leisure

details.adr_address: No. 157, Alley 342, Lane 150, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, 三犁里 Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110
details.formatted_address: No. 157, Alley 342, Lane 150, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110
details.name: Elephant Mountain trailhead

plus_code.compound_code: 2HGC+W8 Taiwan, 台北市信義區三犁里

reviews.text:
You can't miss this location as part of your itinerary. Take the red line train towrds 101 and stop at the last station. Folow google maps and it will lead you to this spot. It will take you 20-40 minutes walk up the hill. How fast you can reach the point? depend on your fitness.
The view definitely worth the hike ☺👍🏻

As someone who is only moderately fit, this was hard. Only steps. But I took my time, paused frequently, and had lots of water. I would say I needed about 45-60 min to go up. The views are really great and I am happy I pushed myself to do it. For a Monday afternoon, I thought it was busy. I would not do this on a weekend or hot summer day. Bring water, snacks, and a sweat towel. It's very easy to find the beginning of the steps from MRT Xiangshan Station. Enjoy!

If you were wondering if you should do this while visiting Taipei, stop here. You absolutely should. This is not a hike. It is a 25 min walk up some stairs. It is not very hard if you take your time. Some of the stairs can be steep but only in short section.  Bring a bottle of water. Views of Taipei 101 from the top are stunning. Whole activity took about 1 hour.

There is a water fountain at one of the lookouts half way up. I also believe there is a bathroom at the top, but I could be mistaken.

🚶‍♂️ As far as stairs go these beat the ones at the Chiang Kai Shek memorial. Varied heights, unexpected turns, surrounded by nature, 10/10 kind of stairs leading to a 10/10 kind of view, even on a gloomy rainy day.

Takes maybe 20 min to walk up, and walking down can be a choose your own adventure kind of event, as there are multiple paths leading down the other side(s) of the mountain.

It being Taipei, everything is clearly marked, so you can leave your "omg it's a jungle" fear at home and just wing it, collecting sights of temples as you go.👌

There is a whole seemingly abandoned monk complex on one bottom end of the path, a perfect set for a horror film. You'll get a bonus piece of stinky tofu from me if you find it.

With trailhead access just blocks away from Taipei 101, Xiangshan (Elephant Mountain) is a must-do sunset hike if spending time in the city! The views of the city with the sun setting in the background are spectacular. It's a quick hike, where you gain elevation quickly, perfect for an evening workout. Pending the weather, ankle-biting mosquitos can be a bit of a nuisance.

For a quick (less than 1-min) video summary of the hike, check out the YouTube video at the link below!

https://youtu.be/2hicugRLkuQ?si=Rcbk-3wlGqWbILVD

Great hike. Totally worth the trek to see a great view of Taipei 101 and the city.

The trailhead is easily accessible via public transportation. The trail is very well maintained and safe and the views of the city are stunning. Unfortunately, there are a lot of other people out and about too

The way up is not considered very steep. It's a clear staircase.
If you come in the evening - evening You will see the lights at night.
City view, view of Taipei 101 building, very beautiful
Whoever comes to Taipei, I recommend it.

plus_code.compound_code: RPXP+73 Jiaoxi Township, Yilan County, Taiwan

reviews.text: Beautiful trail with amazing view on top. 5.6km on way, the first 4km is just purely going up in the shade while the last 1.6km is purely stairs. Quite windy but hot on the top. Long hike also (it took us 5.5h in total for 2 ways), so bring food, snacks and lots of water (you can get more water at the church)
Also known as Marian Trail this place is good for retreat. You may need a good endurance to reach the top and strong legs for descending the mountain.

May take 5hours or more to climb round way, the weather is cool in January and has not rained fortunately. The landscape is extremely amazing, fascinating destination. Green world and catholic attractions. Highly recommended to visit. Bring water and warm clothes ~
Easy to climbed, need 3-4hours oneway, beautiful scenery 😘 u need bring more water

Was raining when we got here.
It's a long trail, elevation picks up a little more after 3km. Be prepared for this section.
We didn't get to see the awesome view, was misty up there.
Restrooms are available mid way.

details.adr_address: No. 31, Alley 401, Lane 150, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, 三犁里 Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110

editorial_summary.overview: Popular hiking trail with walking paths & stairs offering a panoramic view of Taipei from its peak.

details.formatted_address: No. 31, Alley 401, Lane 150, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110
details.name: Xiangshan

plus_code.compound_code: 2HGF+V7 Taiwan, 台北市信義區三犁里

reviews.text:
Nicest place I’ve visited so far in Taipei.

The weather was perfect. The long stairs may seem a bit daunting at first, but they were worth climbing.
The different platforms give you a view of Taipei, with the overseeing Taipei 101.
There are different trails you can walk on, which lead to small pavillons or temple.
I would definitely recommend.

A scenic day hike at Elephant Mountain, also known as the Nangang District Hiking Trail was a nice green escape.

This easily accessible trail offers stunning panoramic views of Taipei, perfect for capturing breathtaking photos or simply soaking in the city's vibrant atmosphere.

The moderate climb provides a refreshing workout, and the well-maintained trail makes it suitable for hikers of most fitness levels.

After conquering the hike and enjoying the stunning cityscape, treat yourself to a well-deserved reward on your way back down. Look for the red elephant sign and indulge in a refreshing lime touch ice cold dessert, the perfect way to cool down and conclude your evening adventure.

One of the easier place where you can have beautiful views of Taipei. The climb is quite steep, there are few paths to get to the highest viewpoint but regardless of which one you choose, all require some physical effort. The total ascent is about 140m but because it is quite short, it is pretty strenuous. Good news is that all paths are stone stairs, more convenient even if there is some rain.
There are multiple viewpoints along the way.
Bring water and a small sweat towel.
Even though easier on the way down, be careful as your legs will use different muscles and you will feel it for sure unless you are very fit.
Well worth it the effort.

Good place to slot some hiking into your travels. Located in the city, it promises a great view of Taipei city and Taipei 101. A lot of stairs are involved, so it might not be suitable for some people. Otherwise, it took me around 1 to 1.5 hr. If you want to do more hiking, you can continue the trail for other areas aka Tiger, Lion, Leopard Mountain

Great place for trail. Take note lots of stairs but the view is worth it. Can link to other trails also. Less than an hour to reach peak. Can prepare hot coffee or tea and chill there also. Enjoy the scenery and fresh air. Help lift up spirit and get away from city life.

editorial_summary.overview: Hiking trails along a gentle slope to a summit with panoramic views over surrounding mountains.

details.formatted_address: Ren’ai Township, Nantou County, Taiwan 546
details.name: Hehuanshan Main Peak Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 47MC+FM Ren’ai Township, Nantou County, Taiwan

reviews.text:
From its base to its summit, the mountain is blanketed in a dense, emerald cloak of evergreen forests. Towering pine and fir trees cling to its slopes, creating a rich tapestry of green that seems to stretch on forever. Even during the height of summer, when many mountain landscapes turn brown and arid, Verdant Peak remains a testament to the power of nature to thrive and flourish. a majestic mountain rising into the sky, is a sight to behold. Standing tall and proud, it is a symbol of nature's grandeur and unspoiled beauty. As you approach this towering giant, you'll be greeted by an awe-inspiring panorama that takes your breath away.
For adventurers and hikers, the hehuan mountain offers a range of trails that wind their way through this natural paradise. The trails vary in difficulty, from easy walks that provide a leisurely experience for families to challenging ascents that reward hikers with breathtaking vistas from the summit. Regardless of the trail you choose, you'll be treated to a sensory feast of sights, sounds, and scents, all thanks to the lush greenery that envelops the mountain.

Amazing hiking trails to get breathtaking landscape, super cool fresh air and get your body some exercises in the nature. Hiking trails are not really challenging and tough, so it is suitable for a family hike. But bear in mind to prepare some snacks, water in advance as there’s hardly convenience store nor food stalls at the neighborhood, as I observed. The weather’s unpredictable too, so it is wise to have yourself an umbrella or rain coat and of course, wind jacker with you even in the summer.

This must be the easiest top 100 peak in Taiwan.  3400m peak is so accessible that makes this place so special. The Taiwan government built this amazing road that takes you very close to the peak. The views are absolutely magnificent. Big mountain, big sky. It’s almost a religious experience. We love it!!!!

You will surely enjoy this majestic place and one of memorable experienced here in Taiwan. A lot of visitors/tourist both locals and foreigners  and my suggested time if you want visit this place is 6am up to 12pm so that you can witness the sea of clouds.

Definitely one of the best family friendly places to go. Hiking trails are pretty easy, but you can take the foot trails for increased difficulty. Great experience for both adults and kids. The beauty is just unmatched.

Come... come and see the sea of ​​clouds... come and see our Hehuan Mountain in Taiwan... the most beautiful and magical magic show of the sea of ​​clouds & the special program of the sunset~ I always miss the beauty of sunny days in the ticking sound of rainy days~

Parking is not convenient. The closest parking lot is Wuling parking lot, followed by Kunyang parking lot. The overall difficulty is not high, and it can be used as the beginning of the Hehuan Mountains. However, you may still experience some altitude sickness due to the altitude, so you must be careful.

Round trip duration: 1 hour and 45 minutes
Round trip distance: 3.8 kilometers
Climb height: 200 meters

reviews.text: 💯It is wonderful！🤳🎊
Great views

Depart from Paiyun at 3:45
Arrive at the main peak at 5:45
Takes about two hours

The sunrise time of the day is 06:15
Turns out we arrived too early
The cold wind blowing up there is unbearable
As soon as the clouds and fog came up, they dispersed and revealed a great view

The whole road is not too difficult
It feels like the snowy version of Wuliaojian
Be sure to wear crampons when you reach the iron cage in front of the main North Fork.
Otherwise it's super slippery

Among the three peaks of East Asia
The main peak of Yushan is really the best to climb

September 112~
Paiyun Villa at 2:00 in the middle of the night~get up and have breakfast
Login from 3:00 am
Arrive at the triangle point of the main peak of Yushan at 5:25 in the morning
Walked back to Paiyun from Triangle Point at 6:35 in the morning
Return to Paiyun Villa at 9:00 in the morning
11:30am Paiyun lunch
Return at 12:00 noon
Return to Tattaga Trail at 4:10 pm
7:20pm celebration banquet

There is still 2.4 kilometers to go from Paiyun Villa to the main peak of Yushan Mountain, and you must climb 600 meters.
This seemingly short mileage is an upward journey, so breathtaking! There are also collapsed walls along the road, making it difficult to walk step by step. You have to be very focused. If I accidentally stumbled, I fell down the valley.

I have been on the main peak for a long time, and the weather today is very good, not very cold. Let's enjoy taking pictures.
We were super lucky this time. We won the first draw of Pai Yun and it was a great scene.

However, at 6 o'clock in the morning on November 12th, the group members who climbed Yushan with me in September set foot on Yushan again. However, the weather was good at the trailhead, but the wind was extremely strong at the triangle point, so they chose to descend. . However, on the same day, other mountaineers who arrived at Triangle Point at 7 o'clock encountered great scenery because the weather improved.

Therefore, the mountains are ever-changing and unpredictable. No one dares to know whether the triangle point is a big view or a white wall. We can only take it as it comes and do a good job of ensuring it. Don’t omit the clothes, medicines, food, water, etc. that should be carried up the mountain.

The first feeling, the first attempt, the first completion~
Yushan single attack
Departing in the afternoon on December 5, 2023, we stayed overnight in the Tatajia parking lot. The cold wind was strong and we woke up at one o'clock in the middle of the night to prepare for departure at 2 o'clock ~ The journey into darkness at the Yushan trailhead at 3.10 ~
Yushan is not difficult to walk, but I am afraid that the high mountain pressure will cause altitude sickness. I move forward slowly with everything stable. I wonder when it will be dawn and when I will arrive at Paiyun Villa... Arrive at 7:20
Looking at the top of the mountain, touching my heart, everything is ready ~ Part 1
Cold wind, drifting mist and rain, strong wind, sleet and ice beads. Things are changing. Do you want to move forward? Let’s fight.
The strong wind at the air outlet doubled, and the iron chain pillars were covered with a layer of frost. No, it was snowing😂👍🏻
No matter, Yushan, here we come
The first snowfall this year in Yushan
We were greeted just after the two of us reserved the venue~ It’s snowing, it’s snowing
S So excited...💖
Completion of weak women's record
Yushan solo attack 14 hours S
💯It is wonderful！🤳🎊
Great views

Arrive at the main peak at 5:45
Takes about two hours

Yushan solo attack 14 hours S
Like, like, like

It is recommended to put on warm clothes at the small wind outlet before going up to the main peak or go to the North Peak first and then go up to the main peak. The wind will be very strong after the small wind outlet. After 3:30, you can see the entire starry sky and the Milky Way. The weather is really bad. Okay, after passing the main north branch road, I kept pulling on the iron chain and climbed to the main peak. This section is considered the most dangerous part. If you are not careful, you may fall directly into the valley. Before going up to the main peak, you must check the sunrise time. It is too high above. It's cold and windy, so please take measures to keep warm.

plus_code.compound_code: 47WM+FM Xiulin Township, Hualien County, Taiwan

reviews.text: quite an easy hike up and the sunrise was amazing JUST LOOK AT MY PHOTOS  😍😍 trail is well maintained and was not crowded on a weekday morning to see sunrise
Challenging trail in the rain. Beautiful views which I bet are even better without the fog and rain. Look forward to visiting again one day. 19C temperature in Taiwan is a pleasure.

Our hike was not on the map, it’s from main peak to bottom of this trail. We hike down from the main peak, along with cable line on the ground, pass through 合歡溪， finally get to the bottom of this trail head. It took us about 3 hours, absolutely stunning. Not recommend in bad weather or afternoon though, as you can easily get lost and it could be dangerous.

The trail is easily walkable, however it may seem more challenging than usual due the high altitude, which is well above 3000m here. People who tend to have altitude sickness can alleviate their symptoms with the extract of „xiangfengcao” (香蜂草) or similar herbs. It's better to arrive as early as possible, since the weather is quite unstable, so the clear weather may become extremely cloudy or even rainy in a matter of minutes by the afternoon.

A short trail, but don't let that deter you from doing this trail. The views are amazing. I went during November (Fall season, as the leaves are slightly turning brown).
It does get really cold before sunrise so be prepared (about 8 degrees, so bring your layers).
Some of the trail paths have eroded, using trekking shoes or anything with extra grip helps a lot.
quite an easy hike up and the sunrise was amazing JUST LOOK AT MY PHOTOS  😍😍 trail is well maintained and was not crowded on a weekday morning to see sunrise

It is probably the easiest Baiyue to acquire, with a total length of more than 700 meters and no difficult terrain.

Shimen Mountain, with an altitude of 3237 meters, has a third-class triangular point. It is the easiest mountain to climb. The trail is about 0.7 kilometers long and can be easily reached in about 10 minutes. The outlook is also very good along the way, and it can be reached from the north to the North Peak of Shimen Mountain.

reviews.text: Love the view on top, breathtaking, but the hike is quite dangerous in my opinion. I thought going up was tough until I saw the way down. Came down safely but dropped my balls on this trail multiple times 😂. Pay extra attention and be careful on this trail people. It's all fun until you skydiving down from 2200 meters.

Yuanzui Mountain in Taichung is not for the faint hearted as you are faced with 90° drops with sharp rocks and ropes as the only support. At certain points you have nothing below you and it's best if you didn't look down.
A round trip travel time of maybe 4 hours without foot traffic, this trail should be done only on weekdays or at hours where there are less hikers blocking the paths. I unfortunately was stuck on the top of the mountain for about an hour because lots of kids didn't know how to grapple down the steep rocks.
it's my 4th time to comeback to this mountain with different group of friends because i always told them that Yuanzui have the best view,sea of clouds and sunset/sunrise 🤩😍🥰

Very fun hike and not too difficult if you're a decent hiker. Plenty of ropes and things to hold onto

If you're more experienced, you can ignore the ropes and just use the rocks
one of the best challenging hike for me here in Taichung, Taiwan. Best weather in favor of me that day.

Love the view on top, breathtaking, but the hike is quite dangerous in my opinion. I thought going up was tough until I saw the way down. Came down safely but dropped my balls on this trail multiple times 😂. Pay extra attention and be careful on this trail people. It's all fun until you skydiving down from 2200 meters.

The 1,700 to 2,000-meter-high mountain forest, semi-rock climbing, and towering woods allow you to prepare for the first part of Yuanzui Mountain. It feels good.
Difficult but beautiful scenery

It is located at the trailhead at 27k. There is a toilet next to it. You can climb up again after going up. You need to wear gloves and non-slip shoes here, and choose a good weather!

The scenery is beautiful when climbing the Yuanzui Mountain Triangle Point, and then you can choose to continue walking up the mountain, or cut off the Snowy Mountain Road at 1.5k! The scenery is beautiful, the CP value is high, a bit challenging, but fun!
great! An intermediate mountain that often offers great views and is worth climbing again and again.

reviews.text:
We went with a group of friends and very much enjoyed it. We did it ourself without any outside organisation but it worked nice.

Needed to get the permits. For foreigners it was possible to get them early. For Taiwanese it was 2 months before the day of hiking. The application needs quite some data and passport scan, but works out nicely.

The first part of the track is quite a climb. Not for the ones who are not physically fit. The last part of the track next to the cliff must be a great view. On the day we were there it was very cloudy. But it was still very much worth it. I believe on a clear day would be even more amazing views.

Very much enjoyed the walk and would suggest it to others also.

A highlight of our Taiwan Trip!

We had Island Life Taiwan arrange our transportation and permits for this hike. Definitely follow the park and your tour company’s instructions, including getting a permit ahead of time, showing your passport at the entrance, and starting early in the day! It’s worth the trouble!

This is currently an out-and-back trail. According to our guide, the initial routing may change in late 2024 or 2025 as improvements are made. Currently the first 1.5k is quite strenuous with almost continuous steps up, then it becomes less strenuous but not flat. There are bathrooms at the 1k mark (and therefore the last 1k on the return).

The narrow cliff section lasts about 600m and has great views. I didn’t think it was “scary,” but one definitely shouldn't mess around on this section! There is a rope attached to the cliff to hold on to, as there are few railings and the drop is over 500m. Passing people here is a little tricky.

Our Chungwa Telecom phones worked well at the trailhead and for at least the first 1.5k, so communicating with our driver for pickup was easy. There's really no parking at the trailhead.

We went really slow and took about six hours, much slower than most, but one of us had blisters.

The first bit is quite steep with many steps, then it gets a bit easier. At roughly the 2.4k mark the most stunning part starts with amazing views of the gorge, which is however quite narrow and can be challenging for those afraid of heights.
I recommend to start the trail at 8-8:30 the latest to avoid the big groups coming with buses. It can get quite inconvenient if you meet a big group at a max. 1m wide path next to a cliff.
All in all, stunning hike, a fair elevation gain, beautiful views at the end, try to avoid bad weather and big crowds for maximum enjoyment.

Great trail, mostly shade, 3,1 k one-way. some steep portions and plenty of stairs, the last part offers awesome views! Took us 3,5-4 hours in total. At 1k in, there are toilets.
Definitely worth going truth the permit application process. You only need the permit and your passports ( no police permit). We had some trouble finding the trailhead. Park your car/taxi at swallow grotto parking, then walk 500m back to the official hut to show both documents and pay 200 for a park ticket. Trail starts right there at the hut. Need to enter between 7-10 am! Not too many parking spaces

What a nice, peaceful trail! I did this on a rainy day so unfortunately did not get many views. I was worried the trail would be dangerous in the rain but it was completely safe (you just have to watch your footing!)

I recommend arriving early to do the trail, as it’s much nicer without crowds. I started at 7am and it seemed like most people started after 9:30am. It took me just under 2.5 hours to complete.

Finally, it’s quite tricky to get to the trailhead if you use public transport. The 310 bus does not go to swallow grotto (google maps is inaccurate). I ended up taking 1141 departing from Hualien at 5:10am as it was basically the only option that would get me there before 10am. If you want to use public transport, I would recommend that you check with the Hualien bus station info center/ whatever info center is near you to determine how to get there.

Very much enjoyed the walk and would suggest it to others also.

If you want to use public transport, I would recommend that you check with the Hualien bus station info center/ whatever info center is near you to determine how to get there.

Intensive cardio workout with amazing views and a bit of adrenaline 😅 We feel very blessed to be able to experience this old trail. We made it back to the starting point in 3 hours and we have met such a lovely local people at the end of the road.
花蓮錐麓古道，門票200元，只開放早上10點前-下午3點，單程3點1公里，經過2座吊橋，第1公里處，石頭+階梯，有廁所，注意第2、5公里，最危險，最後面，500尺處，斷崖處，請使用小背包，路面狹窄，雙向通行時，請禮讓山友通過，拉緊繩索，爬升800公尺20240324

Will definitely want to come again! It takes about five hours and requires a lot of cardio on the way out. It will be much easier if you have hiking poles on the way back.
The cliff section is very spectacular and you can see the folds of the rocks up close🪨

reviews.text: it's a pleasant walk up here from the nearby village with several stops to take in the views!

Easy way to the top where you can see Taiwan central weather station. Before that you can see some tea farms. The view at the top is really awesome as you can see the whole view of sun moon lake (both sun and moon, no kidding)
Went there at 6am to enjoy the sunrise and it was worth it

It's an easy and pretty rewarding home up to the weather station (summit). You'll be walking on asphalt most of the time. The views from the top are nice and worth the effort. There are toilet facilities up top too.

reviews.text: It's not easy to get to the mountain top. But it's worth taking more than 2 days to climb.

Incredible hike! Definitely a must in the southern parts of Taiwan.
To me it's one of the most beautiful trails thanks to the amazing trees.
Camping is also solid, tents are big and worth the rental price, which also saves you some weight carrying.

I suggest two day one night trek. Don't let the rain in the middle part discourage you! It usually disappears at the top :)
The most high mountain in the Southern Taiwan with its 3092 meters high, the Saint Mountain in the heart of aboriginal Paiwen, named officially “Kavulungan”!
Excellent for a 2 day hike. The accommodation run by the aboriginals is great and the food delicious. Be sure to get to the clearing near the lodge to watch the sun set over the sea of clouds.
What an amazing experience! Well maintained trail. Clean hut. Definitely recommend this challenge.

reviews.text: I appreciate the environment in this place because when I reached on top of a hill everything was fresh to me, it's a good place for hiking even though they close the way uphill because of an epidemic. It's was a good moment and experience, l will come again next time.

This is a good trail for new hikers. It's not too easy and not too hard. If you had tried elephant mountain before, you should try this one. The elapsed time for a round trip is about 1.5 hrs. The view at the top is so great. You can see Tamshui, Beitou, and Bali at the top. There are three trails to the top. This one is the tough one but not the toughest.
Pretty easy hike to the top, with a beautiful view of the Tamsui river and city. Just make sure you plan ahead for transport to/from there as it's not served super regularly.

Rather easy and short hike up a new and shaded trail. It's mostly stairs, nicely lighted all along. The view of Taipei and New Taipei is great, perhaps the best of all spots. Haven't seen the night view yet, but I'm sure it's pretty, plus the hike would be even more pleasant.
Gorgeous hiking trails you have to travel once in your lifetime.

reviews.text: Great hike and good workout for people who really loves hiking and working out. There are some spots along the trail where you will see some view, however, there is no view on top as it is surrounded by plants and trees. Wear comfortable shoes and sports leggings (to avoid getting scratched by some grass) and bring at least a liter of water per person. A small bottle won’t do if you plan to hike all the way to the top.

Great hike, but I highly recommend getting to the trail head by some kind of motorised vehicle. We did not, which meant we spent 3 hours (6 km, 540 more elevation gain) just walking from the Durham Fish Reserve bus stop along the small road to the trail head (could probably have done it in 2.5 hours if not carrying a toddler), which meant we then didn't have time or enerfy to hike the whole trail. The views from the road are pretty, so if I was to do it again, I'd take a taxi to the trailhead, do the hike, and then walk _down_ the road to the bus on the main road.
Be weary of the info panel at the trailhead. While the location of the scenic area has been corrected on the map, the location marked on the graph is wrong, which left to some confusion when we got to 1.7 km where we expected a scenic spot.
The Forrest is beautiful. There was constant bird song, and we saw many butterflies. We even saw some monkeys in the trees :)

Great hike.. if you start from the bottom of the road like me bravo, it was not easy. I recommend wearing shoes adequate for hiking and bringing hiking poles… you are in the clouds so the ground is rarely dry. I would recommend to start before 10 and at the latest noon. Enjoy the hike and be safe
Nice hike, beautiful views, I recommend to wear good shoes and go on a dry day. Go in the morning, so you’re done before dark. Trail is +- 8km in total

5 star adventure for sure! My friend and I were in Taitung bored with nothing to do so we looked up for some hiking in the area and found this trail. Really simple to find from the highway. We rode our bikes uphill to the trailhead (recommended) and then we were off! Unique hike with monkeys, rope assists and a view worth a million dollars. We came off the hill around dusk and the lights from the city were lighting up with sweeping panoramic views of the coast at the same time. Truly a gem of a hike/bike!

You can complete the journey at a run in 2 hours (no stops and at a fairly brisk pace).

It's very beautiful. You can overlook Green Island and Taitung City. But it's difficult to avoid traffic on the way to the trailhead.

details.adr_address: Qionglin, Hsinchu County, Taiwan 307

details.name: Feifengshan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: Q475+Q4 Taiwan, 新竹縣芎林鄉新鳳村

reviews.text: What a wonderful place for a morning hike! There are lots of stairs so be sure to wear the right shoes! The scenery is absolutely stunning and the other hikers on the trail are very friendly. There are many places to take great pictures and once you reach 中坑山 you can keep going onto another trail that will eventually loop around. It will add about 2 hours into your hike but it's well worth it! Even if you just stop at 中坑山 it's still a semi-challenging hike up the mountain and the views from the top are really something!

One of the best trails in greater Hsinchu area, which takes you about an hour or two to complete the whole route. You can easily enjoy the view of Hsinchu area and even Taiwan Strait when the weather is good. Taipei 1-101 can sometimes be visible at the pavilion around the mountain top. Parking is easily accessed and situated not far from the entry of the trail.
Great spot to view the Hsinchu city. Not too difficult for hiking.

Quite popular trail on weekends but it is deserved. The trail is mainly in the shade, not too long. It's also very clear to follow and has good maintenance. It's a bit steep, but like many trails in Taiwan. Well, we enjoyed it.
It is a popular place for hiking with family and friends because it is just located nearby Hsinchu city around 25 minutes by car.

reviews.text: Relatively easy hike, no view from the summit.
One of the trails in Taipei that is not too crowded on the weekends, but the view isn’t so pretty, but if you are just looking for nature and peaceful atmosphere, this place is perfect

If it is difficult to park your car from Maokong, you can instead enter from the Xindian trailhead via Tenglong Yuying. Yourenshengu to Maokong. The mountain trail is not too undulating and easy to walk! If you have better physical strength, you can take the MRT from Xindian Xiaoshishan to the Maokonglai section and climb the "Lion-Cat Walk"

2022/07/03 (Sunday)
Take the MRT and get off at Xindian Qizhang Station, then walk (about 5 minutes) to Beixin Guoxiao Lv9 Gengxin and get off at the main station (Daxiangshan).

Go straight to the road and take the trail - Tenglong Yuying - Youren Shengu Mountain Theater - Steeply up Dailaokeng Mountain - Maokong Cable Car.

Take it easy and never look back⋯⋯ (about 1 and a half hours)
On the way up to Mount Tailaokeng to Mount Erge, the mountain cherry blossoms are all over the place.

reviews.text: Very, very good. Views are better than when hiking Yushan. We did it in 2h20m return (we hike fast). Large parking (and restrooms and snacks) nearby so parking was just hard and not impossible. Can potentially extend the hike to other peaks, but that's apparently 5+ more hours.

Beautiful hike, easy to access, extremely windy at the last km so make sure that you have enough warm clothes. It is at least 4h hike without shades so bring enough water and make sure you are well-coved to avoid sunburnt. We didn’t have much time to submit this time so we will definitely come back.

Wonderful hike! Easy access. If you are in the area near cingjing farm, you can catch a shuttle bus (6658) from the nearby bus stops to the hehuanshan service station. Walk down the street and access the north point trail off the road. It's about a 30 minute hike with spectacular views! A must try if you are in the area. It is best to go during mid day or early afternoon to get the clearest views. Remember to leave footprints not trash! Enjoy!!!

The last time I was here is Nov 2019… before pandemic wreck havoc. Now, Nov 2022 finally am back to my favourite hiking trail.
As usual I went off for long walk after joining the sunrise viewing group.
Nothing beat walking early morning at high altitude and breathing fresh cold air 🥶
And the prize …. Awesome view of surrounding area, it’s breathtaking. I never get bored with the scenery.
I’m definitely will come back again ….. year 2023 😅

Awesome trail with spectacular views. The trail is well kept and about 0.5K from the service center. I suggest allowing about 3-4 hours round trip. The ascent is steep, however, you will want to stop and take pictures to allow you some rest breaks. I highly recommend this hike, the views are beautiful. This hike is not for persons that are not in good physical shape.

Leopard Peak is the easiest to reach among the Four Beast Mountains!
It is less than 500 meters away from the asphalt road to reach the top of the mountain. The road is paved with stone and there are not many ups and downs ~ it is quite easy to reach.
There is a small viewing platform on the top of the peak, and there is a triangular point (the only two hills with foundation stones in Si Beast Mountain). There are woods and other hills around the platform, so the outlook is not wide, but you can still see Xinyi District ~ so it is also across the mountain. Nice place to watch fireworks

2024-02-08 Thu Little New Year’s Eve
Leopard Peak is the same place as the observation deck, and the landscape is roughly similar to Tiger Peak. This trip is to connect the Tiger and Leopard Peaks for a relaxing walk

reviews.text:
Seven stars mountain peak is the highest mountain in taipei
We start out hike at lengshuikeng information center; most of the hike are uneven stairs, feels like we did the squat for 3 hours!!
It was raining in the morning so it was very foggy and windy at the start of our hike
The signs are pretty clear, we took 3 hrs and a
Half hiking plus taking photos
After reaching the top, the sky became clear and the fog went away
Walking down towards xiaoyoukeng visitor center is beautiful! The views are so beautiful with a volcanic smoke
There is no restrooms during the hike
Note: Bring a bottle of drinking water
Don’t go during late November as weather is bad. Suggest go during summer though weather could be very hot but better view

Love that this place is easily accessible by the public transportation. Overall an amazing hike! It took me about 1:30 hour to reach to the Qixingshan Main Peak, starting from Xiang you keng visitor center and another 1 hour to Lengshukeng parking lot where I caught the bus back to the city. Breathtaking views at the top. Pet friendly.
One of the best mountain climbing routes in Taipei.

Absolutely stunning. To go there and visit both peaks take a minibus (S15) to Lengshuikeng Hot Springs. From there on there is a trail that leads to a pond and heads towards the peaks. It can get quite windy at times. Head west / northwest after ascending both peaks and you’ll end up at the Xiaoyoukeng Visitor Center after passing a small volcanic nostril. Last bus from there to Taipei leaves at 17:20 so make sure you plan ahead. If you are fit you can do the whole trail from Lengshuikeng to Xiaoyoujeng in less than 2:00 hours but plan more time as there are nice viewpoints on the way up and down.

北投七星山位於台灣台北市北投區，是一個享譽盛名的登山勝地。我有幸前往七星山遠足，深深被它壯麗的自然風光和迷人的登山體驗所打動。

首先，七星山以其絕佳的登山步道而聞名。從山腳下開始，步道蜿蜒而上，沿途穿越茂密的樹林和綠意盎然的山間，一路上風景優美，空氣清新。登山過程中，可以欣賞到不同角度的城市景觀和山間美景，讓人心曠神怡，感受大自然的魅力。

其次，七星山擁有壯觀的山頂景觀。當登上山頂，可以俯瞰整個台北市的景色，包括高樓大廈、碧海藍天和遠處的山巒，景色壯麗迷人。尤其是在清晨或黃昏時分，觀賞日出或夕陽，更是令人心馳神往，留下難忘的回憶。

除了登山和欣賞景色，七星山還擁有豐富的生態資源。山上有許多野生植物和動物，如松鼠、山鳥等，生態豐富多樣。登山途中，可以欣賞到不同季節的植物景觀，感受大自然的生命力和美妙之處。

總的來說，北投七星山是一個值得一訪的自然勝地。它以其壯麗的登山步道、絕佳的山頂景觀和豐富的生態資源而聞名，吸引了許多遊客前來登山遠足。來到這裡，遊客不僅可以享受到登山的樂趣和挑戰，還可以感受到大自然的神奇和美麗，成為一次難忘的登山體驗。
上山很累、下山腳很痛，但爬得很開心

The highest peak in Taipei City is indeed extraordinary. When the sky is clear, you can have an unparalleled view of the Taipei skyline and other mountain and sea cityscapes. You can see the north coast and Keelung Island; when it is covered in heavy fog, it looks like a fairy mountain in the sky or an out-of-this-world floating mountain. The weather here changes very quickly, from sunny days at the foot of the mountain to white walls at the top of the mountain, but there are different styles when you visit in different seasons and climates. Since there are always a lot of people climbing there, mountaineers jokingly call it the Qixing Mountain Vegetable Market.

There are three routes to climb Qixing Mountain. You can go in and out from A or B or turn back the same way: the trailheads are located at Xiaoyoukeng Service Station, Lengshuikeng Service Station and Nursery respectively. Among them, the starting route from Xiaoyoukeng is the shortest and slowest, with a total distance of about 1.6km. It takes 40-60 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain, and another 10-15 minutes to reach the east peak of Qixing Mountain. The total length of the Lengshuikeng route is about 1.8km. It takes 60-80 minutes to reach the East Peak and then 10-15 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain. The last 600m of the trail requires some physical strength.

The nursery route is the longest, about 2.3km. The first 1.3km is gentle and easy to walk, while the last 1km is steep and tests your physical fitness. The trail ends at the saddle between the main peak and the east peak. You can reach the top of the two peaks by climbing another 150m each. Although this section requires the most physical strength, it is protected from exposure to the sun under the beautiful woods throughout.

The main peak of Qixing Mountain is 1120m above sea level. It is not only the highest peak in Taipei City, but also one of the smallest mountains in Taiwan. There is a first-class triangular point on the top of the mountain. The east peak of Qixing Mountain is 1107m above sea level and has a third-order triangular point foundation stone. The two famous mountains have great views, and there are several large platforms for resting on the top of the main peak.
Smoke curls up

Parking in Qixing Mountain is convenient. There are multiple parking lots and multiple climbing entrances. You can use Easy Card or Dole Card to pay. On that day, we started from Lengshuikeng. We first went to the east peak of Qixing Mountain, then to the main peak of Qixing Mountain, and then descended from Xiaoyoukeng. , I parked my car and soaked my feet in a cold puddle, and returned home happily. I happened to encounter the sea of ​​clouds. I was very lucky. It is recommended to wear non-slip shoes and bring trekking poles. The weather on the mountain is changeable, because there are almost stone steps, and it will be foggy or rainy. The rain can be very slippery. There are restrooms and water dispensers in the service center. It is recommended to fill up with hot water before setting off. It is cold at the top of the mountain.

reviews.text: Extraordinary view. The wind is strong, make sure you bring a windbreaker.

The entrance to the South Peak Trail of Qixing Mountain is located about 1.3K on the climbing route starting from Xiaoyoukeng of Qixing Mountain (the total length of this line is 1.6 kilometers). There is an explanation sign next to the "Northern Descent Phenomenon and Kunlan Tree". It takes about 7 minutes to enter. After about 100 meters, you can reach the south peak of Qixing Mountain with an altitude of 1088 meters.

After entering the trail, the arrow bamboo forest is taller than a person, and you have to "walk under the forest" for a certain distance. Therefore, friends who want to explore the South Peak are recommended to wear long sleeves/trousers/hat to protect their head, hands and feet from being scratched. . There is a fork about 10 meters after the entrance. It is recommended to take the right (the grass is taller than people at this time); when you are about to reach the south peak, you will encounter another fork (the grass is about as high as the shoulder); suddenly there is a small area without any grass. The small platform, about 4-5 square meters, is where you have arrived at the South Peak. If you take a few steps forward, you will see the triangular point and the elevation sign.

This section of the road cannot be considered a popular route, because most of the road has to pass through the arrow bamboo forest that surrounds us on the left, right and above, and there is an ordinary mountain trail at the foot. Mud, fallen leaves and large and small stones are scattered randomly, and there is no trace of it at all. The well-paved steps and even stone steps have a very high drop, more than 80 centimeters high, which is very unsuitable for older friends who are new to mountain climbing. But for young people, it is an interesting little adventure. Drilling into a tree hole is quite interesting and it is not difficult to walk! However, if it rains, this road will easily accumulate water. It is not recommended to visit on rainy days or after heavy rain.

From the south peak, you can clearly see the 1,120-meter main peak to the north, the 1,107-meter east peak, and Datun Mountain and Xiaoguanyin Mountain to the west.
Especially looking at the main peak (including the trail), it is very beautiful.

Don’t look away and wave to fellow mountaineers on the main peak. Enthusiastic mountaineers may interact with us!

reviews.text:
There are many different trails to the top of the mountain peak. I came up from the parking lot of MengHuan Lake Wetland. The distance is about 2.2 km, climbing about 125 floors hight according to my iPhone app. For people walking moderate speed, it takes about 2 hours round trips.
This place is usually cloudy during winter time. Parking can be difficult on the weekends.
Nice Trekking to the highest peak in Taipei at 1120m. Very beautiful scenery. 1 hour 25 mins up and 1 hour down.

Nice trail! Started from Xiaoyoukou and hiked to Qixin peak and East peak then went down to Lenshuiken. My feet enjoyed hot spring water there. You can also get free hot spring! I also took a detour to see Menglian lake. It’s a wonderful day trip in Taipei.
The trail has no trees though. You have to walk under sun. It’ll be hot hot hot. Bring more water and snack. There is no food to sell.
High enough up that a trip can turn out to be great even if the weather looks extremely foggy in Taipei. We barely made it above the clouds for the peak, and what a sight.

The highest place in Taipei.
There are two main entrances to reach the peak in 1 or 2 hours depending on your physical condition.
If wanna enjoy your time peacefully with less people, better to come here at early working days. Normally, the peak is perpetually in cloud after 9AM.

It is very easy to climb the highest peak in Taipei. Anyone with a little physical strength can challenge this crowded place commonly known as the wet market! Even 92 Abei can come up with the tea-serving team, how can you not?

The highest peak in Taipei City is indeed extraordinary. When the sky is clear, you can have an unparalleled view of the Taipei skyline and other mountain and sea cityscapes. You can see the north coast and Keelung Island; when it is covered in heavy fog, it looks like a fairy mountain in the sky or an out-of-this-world floating mountain. The weather here changes very quickly, from sunny days at the foot of the mountain to white walls at the top of the mountain, but there are different styles when you visit in different seasons and climates. Since there are always a lot of people climbing there, mountaineers jokingly call it the Qixing Mountain Vegetable Market.

There are three routes to climb Qixing Mountain. You can connect them from A to B, or turn back the same way:
1. Depart from Xiaoyoukeng Service Station: This trail is the shortest and gentlest. There are various volcanic landscapes such as sulfur fumaroles to enjoy along the way, and you will feel a sense of change as you climb up. The whole journey is about 1.6km, and it takes 40-60 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain, and another 10-15 minutes to reach the east peak of Qixing Mountain.

2. Depart from Lengshuikeng Service Station: The whole journey is about 1.8km. It takes 60-80 minutes to reach the East Peak first, and then 10-15 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain. The last 600m of the trail requires some physical strength, but you can reach the top with more effort. . Along the way, you have a good view of Lengshuikeng and Qingtiangang mountains. You can also see the Taipei city skyline halfway. You can also turn to Dream Lake, Qixing Park and other scenic spots halfway.
*The above two routes have almost no shade, so be sure to wear sunscreen and prepare drinking water.

3. Departing from Miaopu Trailhead: This route is the longest, about 2.3km. The first 1.3km is easy to walk on a gentle climb, while the next 1km is steep and tests your physical fitness. The trail ends at the saddle between the main peak and the east peak. You can reach the top of the two peaks by climbing another 150m each. Although this section requires the most physical strength, the whole process is protected from exposure to the sun under beautiful woods, and the forest ecology is rich.
The Miaopu trailhead is located behind the National Park Visitor Center. You can follow the pedestrian-vehicle separation trail from Yangmingshan Bus Terminal. This section of the road is gentle and easy to walk and can be reached in about 15 minutes. Alternatively, you can transfer to the 108 park bus from the terminal to the Tongshan Get off at the military station and arrive at the trailhead.

There is a first-class triangular point on the top of the mountain. The east peak of Qixing Mountain is 1107m above sea level and has a third-order triangular point foundation stone. The two famous mountains have great views, and there are several large platforms for resting on the top of the main peak.

reviews.text: Worth it to climb just be careful stepping the rock stone 💛💛💛
Not far from park entrance, quite steep, most of the hike is through rock field. Could be quite problematic during rain. We arrived to the top during mist, so we didn't see anything.
beautiful and comfortable
Yushan front peak

According to regulations, you must apply to enter the mountain and the park. The Tatagayu Mountain Trail with an altitude of 3239m has a pleasant scenery. It passes through Menglu Pavilion and goes to the Qianfeng trailhead. The biggest challenge is the stone waterfall area, which will make people deeply appreciate the spicy and fun of mountain climbing.
Along the way, there are plants such as rhododendron, arrow bamboo, spruce, hemlock, fir, Yushan juniper, and Taiwan red maple, as well as animals such as mountain deer, sambar, golden-winged white eyebrow, and emperor pheasant. Arriving at the triangular point, the north and south slopes of the East and West Horizontal Ridge are steep and there are good views to the north, west and south.
For this mountaineering, you must bring your original ID card, apply for an approved mountain and park entry permit, and pay attention to the park registration and time. In addition, you must arrive at a certain place within a certain time, and if you reach the designated landmark at the end, please be sure to hurry up for safety reasons. Turn back.
This trail is classified as "intermediate" in difficulty and is not suitable for all ages. It requires self-measurement. In addition to bringing enough boiled water, high-calorie food, and cold-proof clothing, you must prepare yourself.
Know the mountain, respect the mountain, and love to climb the mountain; please take the garbage you make down the mountain with you. Also, after you leave the park after climbing, you must fill out the exit report online.

It takes about 1 hour from the Qianfeng fork to the summit. You can place heavy equipment, trekking poles and other equipment at the fork, and just bring your climbing bag or water climbing. Some sections of the stone waterfall require the use of both hands and feet, so remember to bring work gloves!

reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Badaoer Mountain is a hidden gem in Taipei! Our 2-hour hike from Baoqing Temple offered a thrilling jungle adventure with monkeys and snakes along the way. Starting from the temple, take the right path for a picturesque journey. The views at the end are breathtaking, especially when you have the trail to yourself. The path is well-marked with balises, making navigation a breeze. Some parts are challenging, but manageable with a basic fitness level. Abundant vegetation adds to the charm. We hiked from Wulai in 3 hours one way – a rewarding trek for nature enthusiasts. Highly recommend this incredible experience!
Several trails lead to the 拔刀爾山 summit, but the 保慶宮 and 紅河谷 trailheads are the most common places to start.
We had a great hike there. Follow the ribbons on the trees left behind local hiking groups.
Wild nature. Comfortable there.

Navigating to Wulai Baoqing Palace, there are parking spaces and toilet facilities. Start by climbing the trail next to the south peak of Melu Mountain, which is 850M above sea level. They are all original paths and continue to Melu Mountain, which is 870M above sea level. There are banners along the way to Badu'er Mountain. There are signs and signs. The path is clear. If it rained yesterday and it will be slippery, be sure to bring hiking poles. It is an up and down hiking route. The altitude of Battol Mountain is 1117M, you can overlook the mountains in the distance, and then walk to Gaoyao Mountain with an altitude of 980M. The view is wide. Go down the mountain and take another slope path (there are signs indicating that the road conditions ahead are not clear, please do not enter rashly to avoid danger). The road conditions are good, but there are slopes for a certain distance, so be careful. It takes seven hours to go back to Baoqing Palace. Walk.

Very well-maintained trail, but also be prepared for very steep steps along the way. Caution to those who are beginner-level for high altitude hiking, you could find yourself short of breath. The views are fantastic though, and worth every bit of it.

Mt Hehuan which is located in Nantou is one of the most popular and scenic mountain in Taiwan. During the period from April to June, wild flowers bloom in abundance and it's a sight to behold. It attracts many locals and tourists. The climb up and down will take anything between 3 to 5 hrs.  You need to be physically prepared for it. At the eastern the height is 3421m.
On the hiking trail behind Songxuelou, you need to be especially careful when the weather is bad and the wind is strong.

Park the car in the parking lot opposite Songxue Tower and walk towards Songxue Tower. The entrance is behind Songxue Tower. It takes about 2 hours to walk out and about 1 hour to walk back. The scenery on the mountain is amazing😎
beautiful ice

Fortunately, you can park your car in the parking lot opposite Songxue Tower. In addition to Hehuan East Peak, Hehuanjian Mountain, and Shimen Mountain, you can complete it in one morning. In the afternoon, you can drive back to the Wuling parking lot and climb the main peak of Hehuan. The whole day of climbing is completed in the second grade of junior high school.

details.adr_address: 972, Taiwan, Hualien County, Xiulin Township, 合歡山東峰步道
details.formatted_address: 972, Taiwan, Hualien County, Xiulin Township, 合歡山東峰步道
details.name: Hehuanshan East Peak

plus_code.compound_code: 47PJ+7C Xiulin Township, Hualien County, Taiwan

reviews.text:
Astonishing Mountain View 😊
It’s better to start your hiking by noon to avoid the smog covering mist of view.
Foggy today (๑•́ ₃ •̀๑)
Hiking days

When you embark on the journey to the east peak of Hehuan Mountain, every step is like walking in a vivid picture. On the mountain road, whether climbing or descending, you will find yourself deeply attracted by the beautiful scenery around you, and you can't help but want to capture every moment with your camera. Although the path here is only one kilometer, most of it is composed of wooden steps, giving people a pure feeling of returning to nature. However, this journey is not only a physical challenge, but also a spiritual baptism. When climbing, you need to adjust your pace and breathing and feel the rhythm of nature. In this high-altitude environment, every deep breath reminds you to respect the power of nature and be careful about possible mountain symptoms. Hehuan Shandong Peak is not only a journey, but also an experience of harmonious resonance between the soul and nature.

There are almost all wooden stairs along the trail. If you don’t regulate your breathing well, you will soon be out of breath. There is a cable car ruins at 500m, and the outlook is good along the way.

details.adr_address: Ren’ai Township, Nantou County, Taiwan 546
details.formatted_address: Ren’ai Township, Nantou County, Taiwan 546
details.name: Qilaizhushan South Peak

plus_code.compound_code: 376J+82 Ren’ai Township, Nantou County, Taiwan

reviews.text: The name "Qilai Nanhua" in the mountain world refers to the Qilai South Peak and Nanhua Mountain. Although they have the name of Qilai, they are completely different from the sinister Qilai in the common impression. The Qilai South Peak has no cliffs or cliffs. It is round and wide and flat; Nanhua Mountain is also one of  a 100 mount  with low difficulty
Incomparable scenery and beautiful prairie, worth visiting!

The sunrise at the south peak of Qilai Mountain is known as Golden Qilai. At sunrise, the golden sun shines on the Dwarf Bamboo Forest Grassland, and golden wavelets are continuous. Golden Qilai is by no means unworthy of its reputation...

Looking at Hehuan Mountain from a distance, the Hehuan Mountain Highway is right in front of you. I used to look at the Qilai peaks from Hehuan Mountain. Now I stand at the south peak of Qilai and look at Hehuan Mountain from a distance. It's very touching!

It is a relatively user-friendly route among Baiyue. Even if you don’t have accommodation at Tianchi Villa, you can go back and forth in one day. It is 13KM from the trailhead to Tianchi Villa, and then about 2.4KM up from Tianchi. The scenery at the top of the mountain is superb, and you can overlook Hehuan, Hehuan, and Hehuan. You can admire the sea of ​​clouds from the snow-capped mountain peaks in the east and west. Even the weakest can reach it with a little effort. It is highly recommended as a challenging place to get started after climbing the Hehuan peaks.

The route to Qilai South Peak is not difficult, but you still need to have basic physical fitness. If your physical fitness is not good, don’t worry about taking three steps and resting for five seconds. You can reach it even if you take your time.

details.formatted_address: Qiyan Rd, Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan 112
details.name: Junjianyan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 4GJ7+PR Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
You can park your vehicle in National Yang-Ming University which is only a few steps away from the entrance of the trial.

It takes no more than 30 minutes to reach the top of the mountain.

You can never resist the breathtaking view if you dare to climb to the highest rock on the mountain which is always crowded with people.

But be careful that you might confuse your trail to go back to parking lot.

Because there’re more than four trials to go down the mountain.

It’s easy but definitely worth take you a beautiful afternoon to visit it.

Recommend entering the trail through National Yang Ming University if your main aim is to the rocks, easier access compared through the Zhouming temple. Otherwise just follow the arrows, it will lead up to the trail

Fairly easy well established hike conveniently in Beitou. Recommend you take the bus from the MRT, otherwise you may be quite tired by the time you reach the trailhead. The hike is entirely composed of stairs, but was not impossible for my current out of shape self, 12 year old, or the countless elderly folk running circles around us. Views are amazing- well worth it if you have an hour to kill!

It was one of the best easy hike experiences I had. Took me around 25 minutes on 500m-long mostly stone stairs to the peak of Mt. Junjianyan a.k.a Battleship Rock. Bring/put sun protection as some parts of the trail is exposed to direct sunlight or choose a time where it's not too hot to hike like early morning or late afternoon but if you love the sun while hiking, then this trail would be great. Alight at Qilian MRT Station Red Line and walk approximately 1km. in the direction of Yang Ming University for the trailhead entrance.
An easy trail for you to climb up and have a nice panoramic Taipei city view.

You can park your vehicle in National Yang-Ming University which is only a few steps away from the entrance of the trial.

It takes no more than 30 minutes to reach the top of the mountain.

An easy trail for you to climb up and have a nice panoramic Taipei city view.

A very popular hiking route in the greater Taipei area, Warship Rock is only 186 meters above sea level, but it has a 360-degree view embracing the Taipei Basin, Guandu Plain, Xinbeitou Hot Spring Area, Datun Mountain, Guanyin Mountain, etc. In addition, the special landform of quartz sandstone makes the top of the mountain more unique.

Starting from the Yangming University trailhead, you can reach the top in about 20 minutes. The trail is easy to walk and suitable for all ages. It’s crowded on holidays and quite lively on weekdays. If you start from MRT Shipai Station, it takes about 25-30 minutes to walk to the Yangming University trailhead. However, the section after entering the Yangming University gate is also uphill and there is no shade, so be careful about sun protection.

This route can also be combined with the Warship Rock Zongtong Route, commonly known as the Wujian Ten Peaks. Starting from Donghua Park next to the MRT Juli'an Station, you can visit Donghua Mountain, Qiyan Mountain West Peak, Qiyan Mountain, Quali'an Mountain, Warship Rock, 260 Peak, Batou Mountain, Tang Shouyan, Hongfa Master Rock, Dan Fengshan and other hills.

The vertical walking route is not difficult, just be careful that it becomes slippery after rain. The whole journey can be completed in about 3-4 hours.
This trail is really easy to walk. You can take children to exercise together. The scenery is beautiful.

reviews.text: A really quick trail but a bit tough if you're moving fast since it's all stairs. It's nice that it is so easily accessible and it comes with a great view and a connecting trail to further mountains and temples. The connecting trails on the maps are not completely accurate though so if you're looking to explore the waterfalls afterward I would recommend descending the mountain and taking the road up.

It is an easy hiking trail but there are many stairs, from time to time it is not that easy to climb.
At the beginning of the trail there is a water station so you can fill up your water bottle. It is better to have a water when you hiking.
Once you will reach the top of the mountain you will see a beautiful view on Xizhi.
From there  you can see Taipei 101 and Keelung, Ruifang as well.
You can continue hiking to another mountain or you can go down.
There is also some local equipments for training.
This hiking trail is a good morning workout.
Nice sunset and night view , I went every Sunday evening when I feel alone
An easy mountain trail and you can choose different entrances to get start time ranging from 30-60 mins. The view on the top is worth visiting.
In 30 mins you’ll get to the top with panoramic views! Well paved stone steps but quite steep!

It’s great to go to the Tung Blossom Trail and wait for the Tung Blossoms to bloom to see the Tung Blossoms.
From my back garden, you can reach the top of the mountain in half an hour. The scenery is also very beautiful. It is a good place to relax during the holidays.

details.adr_address: No. 底, Lane 136, Section 1, Huanshan Rd, 西安里 Neihu District, Taipei City, Taiwan 114

editorial_summary.overview: Rugged trail across forested hills, boulders & stony peaks overlooking the skyline & countryside.

details.formatted_address: No. 底, Lane 136, Section 1, Huanshan Rd, Neihu District, Taipei City, Taiwan 114
details.name: Jinmianshan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 3HQ9+F5 Taiwan, 台北市內湖區西安里

reviews.text: This is a great edge-of-the-city walk with many interlinking paths to choose from. It has expansive views over Taipei and is a good place to catch both sunset and sunrise. On weekends, you’ll usually find it quite busy, and there’s usually someone here regardless of when you visit. Some scrambling is required and some of the paths have fixed ropes to assist hikers, but overall, the trail isn’t exceptionally challenging. There’s no on-trail lighting, so if you do visit at night, you’ll need to bring own torch.

Rocky trail with stunning view of Taipei!
The hike takes around 40 minutes to complete and you are rewarded with a stunning view of Taipei.
There are 2 paths leading up to Scissors Rock at the top. Recommend taking one up and then the other one down so you can see both of the paths.

Straight up and straight down with an up and down in the middle. The top had a lot of boulder hopping so if you have bad knees or vertigo, not the trail for you. Took about 1 hr 10 min, 737 ft elevation gain over about 1.3 miles. Nice views of Taipei

Had lots of stairs in the beginning, rocks with built in foot holes and rope, normal I paved paths, and later on rocks you have to kinda climb over, so nice variety. Came on a cloudy day so not the best views sometimes. Too many spiders…

About one hour round trip at a reasonable pace with several short breaks.  Anyone in reasonably good cardio shape with strong/confident knees and ankles can do this hike, but note you’re constantly ascending between a 30 and 60 degree grade with several short sections of rope-assisted bouldering.  The views are stunning - turn around frequently on the way up.  Chinese-only signage is a bit confusing with   several turnoffs from the loop trail so save the map in advance on Google maps.  Bring water, no services.  Only about a dozen people on the trail from 8:30-9:30am on the Wednesday of New Year’s week, though more started arriving as I was leaving.  Delicious breakfast restaurant 頂好美而美早餐店 at the bottom of the trail on the main road!

**大面積違建**破壞山林景觀與水土保持，囂張開山闢地沒有單位管，等出事再來就則。
**沒有廁所**需自行找地方解放，水肥回饋大自然！
雖然山254公尺不高，但登山道多為60度坡以上，很是考驗體力，但可眺望風景很直得的。
環山路一段134巷登山道共3條，路口兩條，面山右手是土階接攀岩道，左邊是石階接大石道，這兩條路半山腰有道相通，指標（竹月寺）互通,白臼樹石地坪有一條隱藏道，這條道安全沒有陡坡，其中有小道可接回石階道。
A good place for children to use up their energy
The path can be connected to Jiantan-Bishanyan-Fengguizui.

reviews.text:
It is a bit difficult, you need to wear sunscreen and sunglasses. If the weather is good, the sun will be very strong. Wearing hiking shoes is better for trying to walk on ridges, because there are many gravels and it is easy to slip.

Of course, the scenery is very magnificent and it is worth walking up the mountain slowly. As if I was asthmatic, I walked slower than a primary school student and slower than a white-haired old man, but I still climbed the mountain!

It’s not too difficult to climb, the view is beautiful, and you can even encounter a golden-winged white-browed bird that snatches food and snatches the potato slices from a child’s hand in an instant.
The Hehuan Main Peak and Tomb Route is the most user-friendly route in Taiwan’s high mountains. At dusk and sunset, the sea of ​​clouds is ever-changing and breathtakingly beautiful.

On the afternoon of the second day of the second grade, the car parked in the Wuling parking lot and walked the 1.8k Hehuan Main Peak.
It’s fairly easy to go up a gentle slope along the road.
There are almost all cement trails along the way, which is easy to walk. You can overlook the Qilai Mountain Peak, the main peak of the Snow Mountain, Nanhu Mountain and Central Jianshan.

這裡風景視野一級棒。
