details.adr_address: 基隆山(雞籠山), Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

editorial_summary.overview: Waterfront peak offering hiking routes & a long, steep staircase with sea & mountain views.

details.formatted_address: 基隆山(雞籠山), Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224
details.name: 基隆山(雞籠山)

plus_code.compound_code: 4R9X+JM Taiwan, 新北市瑞芳區海濱里

reviews.text: If you wanna climb in summer, be prepared for the scorching sun all the way to the top. The view is pretty awesome
Definitely world class views!

Do you wish to climb some peak? Let's do it here then! It is quite small, yet pretty steep. We did not have a nice view from the top, but if you are in an area is definitely worth to climb and maybe spend sometime there as well. You can have a picnic and just chill.
Good

You can park in the parking lot near the trailhead. Because it is close to Jiufen Old Street, parking fees are quite expensive. There are toilets in the parking lot, so you need to bring your own toilet paper. To start the climb, you can retrace your steps or start from the Shanjian Road trailhead. Starting from Shanjian Road, you will first walk up a gentle slope and then start to climb steeply. You can experience rock climbing and rope pulling. Go up to the east peak of Keelung Mountain and then take the golden edge to reach the main peak of Keelung Mountain. The golden edge requires rock climbing and rope-roping, which is even more challenging. If you don’t have rock climbing experience, you should be careful.
If you wanna climb in summer, be prepared for the scorching sun all the way to the top. The view is pretty awesome
Definitely world class views!

Do you wish to climb some peak? Let's do it here then! It is quite small, yet pretty steep. We did not have a nice view from the top, but if you are in an area is definitely worth to climb and maybe spend sometime there as well. You can have a picnic and just chill.
Good

You can park in the parking lot near the trailhead. Because it is close to Jiufen Old Street, parking fees are quite expensive. There are toilets in the parking lot, so you need to bring your own toilet paper. To start the climb, you can retrace your steps or start from the Shanjian Road trailhead. Starting from Shanjian Road, you will first walk up a gentle slope and then start to climb steeply. You can experience rock climbing and rope pulling. Go up to the east peak of Keelung Mountain and then take the golden edge to reach the main peak of Keelung Mountain. The golden edge requires rock climbing and rope-roping, which is even more challenging. If you don’t have rock climbing experience, you should be careful.

Keelung Mountain, which is not in Keelung, is ranked among the Small Hundred Mountains. The view from the top is impeccable, and the mountain and sea scenery seems to be within easy reach. The beautiful sea and sky in the northeastern corner of Keelung such as Bitoujiao and Yeliu are all in one color, while behind you are the settlement of Jiufen Mountain City. The beautiful scenery day and night is mesmerizing.

The trailhead is located near the rooftop parking lot. The trail is 900 meters long, but there are steep stone steps all the way up and there is no shade, so it requires some physical strength. However, since the distance is not long, you can reach the top in about 30-40 minutes. No matter how slowly you walk, you can definitely finish the climb within an hour. As long as you pay attention to the slipperiness after rain, it is still a suitable route for all ages.

The elevation of Keelung Mountain is 588m, and there is a third-order triangular point foundation stone on the top of the mountain. There is a Chinese-style pavilion next to the triangle point for resting. It is a good place for hiking and exercise when walking around the Jiufen area. For those who don’t like to climb stairs, there is a dirt road on the left about 200 meters along the trail. The whole trail goes up slowly and slowly. The slope is much gentler but the distance is longer.

Maybe I have weak feet and find it quite tiring to climb up.
But for those who often climb mountains, it may be an easy route.
The stairs at the top are steeper and the height of the stairs is also greater.
But don’t give up, the scenery on the top of the mountain is very, very beautiful
When I went downhill, I turned a little because my legs were weak.
It is not suitable to bring elders with limited mobility here. In addition, do not climb on rainy days (going downhill will be very dangerous). There are still some places where the stairs are crooked or damaged, and there are no ropes to hold on to in some places...
Having climbed some small Baiyue mountains, I think you should pay attention to safety when climbing Keelung Mountain.
You can watch the night view of Jiufen at night

There is no trail and no shelter, so it is suitable to climb in the evening and watch the night view before going down the mountain.
If you go down the mountain after watching the night view, it will be very dark, so be careful on the stairs.

reviews.text: If the usual lookout of elephant mountain is too easy for you, continue your hike up to thumb. Really nice, less crowded, and a beautiful 360 views of taipei. Kind of hard to find the entrance though. Highly recommend.
Worth hiking here! We got a beautiful moment of the Taipei view!
360 degrees view here! But be cautious of the narrow spaces in the weekends people flooding in.
Second best view of Elephant Mountain Trail! During the week is really quiet
One of my favorite hiking spot in Taipei!  Great view :)

If the usual lookout of elephant mountain is too easy for you, continue your hike up to thumb. Really nice, less crowded, and a beautiful 360 views of taipei. Kind of hard to find the entrance though. Highly recommend.
Worth hiking here! We got a beautiful moment of the Taipei view!
360 degrees view here! But be cautious of the narrow spaces in the weekends people flooding in.
Second best view of Elephant Mountain Trail! During the week is really quiet
One of my favorite hiking spot in Taipei!  Great view :)

It was like a long boulder flying from the sky, landing on the Si Beast Mountain Trail, with a height of dozens of meters!
The viewing platform is located just below Thumb Mountain. There are several rows and dozens of statues of gods and Buddhas on the side facing the mountain wall, which is quite special! The view on the other side is invincible and the view is completely unobstructed, looking towards the Xinyi District of Taipei City. Like it👍!
For those who are brave and adventurous, I recommend going to the top of Thumb Mountain (the trailhead is nearby), it’s great!

details.adr_address: 110, Taiwan, Taipei City, Xinyi District, 松隆里110
details.formatted_address: 110, Taiwan, Taipei City, Xinyi District, 110
details.name: Lion Mountain Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 2HHH+PW Taiwan, 台北市信義區松隆里

reviews.text:
Crossing from Leopard Mountain to Shishan, I asked the local residents and found out that very few people use Shishan. Follow the signs and pass through an industrial road, or see the signs for Lingyin Temple. Then walk a short distance up and you will reach Shishan. .

This route is not as user-friendly as other Three Beast Mountains. Part of the road requires pulling ropes. It is recommended to climb it when the weather is good.

1. The entrance to the foot of the Shishan Trail is on the right side of the large building of Tianbao Shengdao Palace and Tongming Temple (your left hand direction when facing the temple), which is directly opposite the newly built public toilet in the corner of the parking lot in front of the temple.
2. There is an old sign at the entrance of the trail, a small millstone inscribed with the words "Nangang Mountain Zhongshan Trail, entrance to Tianbao Shengdao Palace...". There is also an image project newly built around the 110th year of the Republic of China. The monument imitates a broken tree trunk and is inscribed with the words "Four Beast Mountain€¥Shishan" (note: "€£" is actually a fern emblem).
3. The trail was significantly renovated a few years ago, and now most of it is a 1.5-meter-wide imitation wood grain non-slip brick step, all the way to the "Statue of the Most Holy Master Confucius" located above the temple belonging to Tianbao Shengdao Palace. , the trail was shortened and divided into two paths (one on the left side of the Confucius statue, and one on the right side connected to Tuigong Temple). This trail finally connects to the Songshan Road above, and can be connected to the "Beixing Palace" at the end of Songshan Road, and can be connected to the Si Beast Mountain Trail and the Elephant Mountain Trail.
4. Compared with the old Shishan Trail (a trail that seems to have been opened by the temple and has many Arhat statues along the way. There is also another easy way to overcome difficulties from Shishan Mountain), its location, starting point and end point have been greatly different. Maybe the name of the new trail is worried that it will be as controversial as the original trail, so it has never been named "Shishan Trail".
5. There are also street lights at night, passing by the citizen farm. The length of the trail is only about half of the Baoshan Creek Trail, but there is still an asphalt road between the entrance and exit at the foot of the mountain and the Yongchun High School bus stop. Personally, I find this trail to be relatively short and easy to walk.

I found Sajabong alone. It was a cloudy day, but the rain had stopped, so fortunately it wasn't slippery, so I climbed the steep stairs.
You can see the wonderful city of Taipei and there is another road.
I want to look back next time.
Taking advantage of the "Spring Festival Travel", I collected all the uncollected items from Taipei's "Four Beasts Mountain"~ Lion Mountain together~ I'm happy💗

reviews.text: Great short hike next to the parking lot.  There are some spots that are a little steep but they have ropes to hold on to. Was able to hike up to the top and back to the parking lot in 25 minutes.
Great start for the following hikes. Beautiful scene.
Love this place, wide and beautiful mountain in Taiwan.
It's quite a steep hillside, but it's not too difficult to get there. The round trip can be completed in an hour. If you are physically able, you must go up and have a look. The view is very broad.

Hehuanjian Mountain is 3,217 meters above sea level and the trail is about 400 meters long. The top of the mountain has a good outlook, with a panoramic view of the Hehuan peaks and the main north of Qilai. It is a high-CP value parent-child route.

details.adr_address: Xizhi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 221
details.formatted_address: Xizhi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 221
details.name: Dajianshan

plus_code.compound_code: 3M29+F6 Xizhi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Stairs, endless stairs! 1132 steps to be exact - my 6 y/o daughter counted every one of them to keep herself motivated on the hike. There are many butterflies and caterpillars along the way and the view on the top is spectacular - you can see all the way from Taipei 101 to the ocean beyond Keelung. It’s a very taxing hike (especially on a hot summer day) but very good exercise if you want to fire up those leg muscles!

It's easy to access because  of only 12 minutes walking distance to the entrence from XiJi rail station.

Trials to the top of mt.DAJAN are no complicate and safe although endless stairs bother everyone.
Not hard to get to this area. We took TRA to Xizhi and then bus F911 outside of the station. Lots of trails and waterfalls. Awesome view.

Super tiring and it's really just stairs, so if you don't like hikes that are basically stairs I'd suggest you skip this one.

However, It is easy to get to and once you know what to expect it's really not too bad. Would recommend it at least once.
Stairs, and more stairs.

Stairs, and more stairs.

The sunset scenery on Dajianshan is impressive day and night, and it is close to Xizhi Street, so it is a popular place for locals to exercise and relax. There is a pavilion on the top of the mountain for rest. The top of the mountain has an excellent outlook and a broad view, offering a close-up view of Xizhi and the Taipei Basin cityscape, as well as the Datun mountains and Keelung coastline.

The elevation of Dajianshan is 460m. It is one of the Small Hundred Mountains and has the foundation stone of the Land Survey Bureau Tugen Point. The trailhead is located next to Tianxiu Palace. The journey is not long, but you have to climb 1,147 steps straight up. You will also be short of breath, and you can reach the top in about 20-30 minutes.

In addition, you can also climb Dajianshan from Tiandao Qingxiu Monastery. This route is much gentler and takes about 10 minutes to reach the top, which is relaxing and comfortable.

Most of them are stone stairs. You can rest while walking, train your heart and lungs, and train your thighs. There is a pavilion at the top where you can look into the distance and have a wide field of vision. You can walk forward to Tiandao Qingshu Monastery. It takes about 15 minutes. There are cherry blossoms and azaleas in bloom. , then extend the asphalt road down the mountain!
First time here, the scenery on the mountain is great!

details.name: Qixing Park

plus_code.compound_code: 5H74+HQ Taiwan, 台北市北投區湖田里

reviews.text: Short (~30 mins) hike up a shaded trail to this large open area. Very spacious and provides some scenic vantage points. Bathrooms available, no drinking water. Be aware of snakes.
very beautiful but you should climb early and go back before 3-4pm because there are a lot of trees so you cant see the light.

Very doable hike. Go to Qixing Park along the way (0.2km from the fork) to meet some doggos. Take the route down the fumaroles (steamy sulfur boys) and bus back. Caution if you have a functioning nose, though.
Nice park with stellar city views and friendly mountain dogs looked after by some locals :)
Highest and easy to reach the magnificent view in Taipei

超讚，台北最棒的公園之一💪

Seven Star Park has unparalleled views, but it is not easy to get close to.
The least difficult route to Seven Star Park is recommended to start from Dream Lake, which has the least climb.

Qixing Park is located southeast of the east peak of Qixing Mountain, about 850 meters above sea level. It has a large lawn, some pavilions, stone tables and chairs and other facilities, and a toilet. It is an ideal rest stop for mountain hikers.

Here you can enjoy spectacular views of Shamao Mountain, the Greater Taipei Basin, and even the Snowy Mountains in the distance.

The trail connects Lengshuikeng and Dream Lake, with diverse scenery such as green shade, grasslands, lakes, and mountains along the way. It is an excellent choice for getting close to nature, leisure, and small travel.

1. First of all! The photo on the cover was taken at the top of the main peak, not here, don’t be fooled!
2. In terms of field of view, since the north is surrounded by mountains, the field of view is of course only to the south!
3. The important thing is that this is the only remaining mountain public toilet in Qixing Mountain, so it is recommended that mountain friends who walk slowly must pass by it, so as not to find bushes on the mountain.
4. There are a certain number of stray dogs here (see photo 2), and we hope relevant units can deal with them.

The difficulty is very low but the scenery is very beautiful
You can bring some food to eat on the mountain, but there is no shelter in Qixingshan Park, so be careful about sun protection⚠️

reviews.text: Lots of steps to this peak. But scenery is worthy of the efforts to climb up. I started from elephant mountain and links trail by trail to here. Just enjoy the route and be part of the nature.

Definitely worth pushing to Jiuwu peak if you’re already doing the Elephant Mountain hike. The path is well maintained and very pleasant.

After you reached the peak, you can go down toward the Songhan Cihui Temple and grab a metro around there if you don’t feel like walking back to Elephant Mountain.
Enjoable hiking trail, which is not too easy and not too difficult, and several great points for pictures
Thoug walk . But enjoyeble.  Take drik and food.

details.adr_address: Yuchi Township, Nantou County, Taiwan 555
details.formatted_address: Yuchi Township, Nantou County, Taiwan 555
details.name: Shuishe Great Mountain Nature Trail

plus_code.compound_code: VW2W+CQ Yuchi Township, Nantou County, Taiwan

reviews.text: Great hike! It took me, a reasonably experienced hiker, 6 hours to complete the trail (4 hours climb, 2 hours descent). Both startpoints (the Youth Activity Center and the town) are serviced by buses. The first 1.6km is only stairs, but since it's right in the forest with birdsong and squirrels all around, it is still enjoyable. The path then becomes more natural as it goes through wonderful bamboo and normal forests. The viewpoints in between are beautiful, but be aware that there's no view at the top. It can get chilly and cloudy quite fast so don't forget to bring a jacket. Definitely recommend the trail!

I was staying at a mingsu nearby. I decided to take on this hike after reading the reviews. Started around 630am, took about 6 hrs to complete. Beautiful trail. The trail is tougher towards the end. Watch your steps (especially going down after you have summited)!

The view points are lovely, and the trail is mostly in the shade. There are a few sections that require help from a rope but overall nothing too technical. There is cell service for the majority of the hike, including at the top. I completed this hike in about 4.5 hours.

Climb is quite steep initially with some fallen bamboo along the hiking route which is quite clearly marked.  You will reach at a 1.6km point after 1 hr into the hike where there is a fork with one way leading up and another to to the youth activity center 1.6km away. You can climb up further to reach the peak with a further 3km climb.  I just climb another 15min to reach a first peak of the bamboo forest.  Going further with go down and should go up  to the peak.  I turned back after crossing the first peak.  Good for those who could climb at least 3 hours to reach the peak.

I would have given this hike 5 stars if it weren't for the rock and rope climbing at the top. The hike is about 5km to the top. The first quarter is an uphill walk on nicely maintained wooden and brick steps; the incline is not too steep, but it's a good workout. Then you enter a bamboo forest, and the path is typical of a forest floor with roots and leaves and so on, and and the incline is more flat, so you can walk at a leisurely pace. There are no views but it's very serene. However, once you get to the final 2km of the hike, the rope-and-rock climbing begins. It's not hiking, it's rock climbing. It's extremely tiring, and potentially dangerous. I didn't go all the way to the top because I didn't want to climb any more rocks. I was about 500m from the top when I turned around. The hike took me a little over 4 hours in total. There's free parking near the trail entrance, but no bathroom. There were very few people, which was nice, and, until the last quarter, it was very safe and well maintained. There are a few rest areas along the way. There were quite a few flies, but not much else in terms of wildlife.

There are no views but it's very serene. However, once you get to the final 2km of the hike, the rope-and-rock climbing begins. It's not hiking, it's rock climbing. It's extremely tiring, and potentially dangerous. I didn't go all the way to the top because I didn't want to climb any more rocks. I was about 500m from the top when I turned around. The hike took me a little over 4 hours in total. There's free parking near the trail entrance, but no bathroom. There were very few people, which was nice, and, until the last quarter, it was very safe and well maintained. There are a few rest areas along the way. There were quite a few flies, but not much else in terms of wildlife.

As for the scenery, of course I recommend it.
Infinite uphill + infinite downhill (downhill scares me more)

Infinite stairs at the beginning
Come to the infinite bamboo forest again
Finally, infinite shaking
….
There are only a few viewpoints along the way
Will only come once in a lifetime😆

It’s a great place to exercise!

Departing from Ida Shao on 2/17, the whole journey is 8-9hrs, mostly shaded by trees. There are many fallen trees and bamboos in 0.5-1K along the way. You need to cross the entire detour or bend down to avoid it. The last part after 3.8K needs to be avoided. Climb by rope, and there are clear markings along the way with straps from the mountain team.
If you want to walk completely to the triangular point of Shuishe Mountain, it is recommended to start early. It is easy to get foggy in the afternoon, and the observation deck after 4K is foggy.
Tired, worthy of being kicked out.

details.adr_address: Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 226
details.formatted_address: Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 226
details.name: 孝子山 (Mt. Xiaozi)

plus_code.compound_code: 2PCQ+2V Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
Short climb to the peak. Wear sturdy shoes. Try not to go during wet weather. Having said that, the steps are well cut out, well maintained and the handles and ropes are sturdy.

A fun climb and worth-it scenery of the mountains at the peak. Do continue to the other 2 peaks which are only a short distance away.

Moderately easy hiking with some nice views. Ladders and ropes combined with elevation can make your heart skip a beat, but everything is safe and well maintained. I would avoid peak hours 11:00-16:00, because queue can be quite long and time consuming. Also definitely a trail to be hiking in good weather as trail can be quite slippery especially after some heavy rain. Takes about one or two hours to complete if you want to reach all of the three peaks.
Great hiking trail. But you should wear sturdy shoes and should not have vertigo. You will be rewarded with great view.

Absolutely gorgeous place, there are three easely accessible peaks near each other.
Stunning views from the peaks. You have to climb many steps but definitely worth the effort. It was quiet on Wednesday afternoon.

The place is good and nice for people who like hiking,  it's not too big maybe need 2 hours to finish all of it, it has 3 summit,  you have to be careful because there are a lot of announcements there say that going to the top is your responsibility so you need to be careful,  also wear a suitable clothes especially the shoes because some stairs are slippery.

The height is not high, but it allows you to enjoy the exciting and thrilling fun of vertical rock climbing.

The journey is not far... but there is a lot of moss along the way... The final steps to the top of Xiaozi Mountain are very steep... It is recommended to wear non-slip shoes... From the top, you can see Putuo Mountain, the Cimu Peak next to it. . .
Nice quick hike and super accessible from the station. I would recommend taking to slow or avoiding the hike when it is raining or had rained heavily
The weather is good and you are in good health. If you are in a bad mood, you can come and crawl and shout.

In fact, I don’t know why so many people come to climb this. The entire trail is single-track. If no one is around, it will take about 2 minutes to reach the top of the mountain. It’s so funny.
After walking along the Xiaozi Mountain Trail, there will be an arrow pointing in the direction of Xiaozi Mountain.
There is a platform in the middle with chairs and a place to rest. Going forward and down is the way to Cimu Peak or back. If you go to the right, you will take some roads next to the rock peak. A pile of ropes is too safe. Walk for a while. We will reach the trailhead
Ah, but I took the wrong route at first and came to a place where there was only a rope. I was dumbfounded when I saw it. A rope was used to climb a rock wall without holes. Later I realized that I was going the wrong way.
There is only a platform and a ladder at the trailhead. Since it is a one-way trip, everyone is probably waiting for someone else. If there is a person in the middle who climbs slowly, he is about to get stuck.
I was the only one when I climbed. I climbed up in 2 minutes and came down in about the same time. It was not difficult at all. I was a little disappointed. Even elementary school students can climb it.
Next time I will probably find a more difficult rock peak to climb. This one is really too easy.

reviews.text: This is a short trail to Junjiangyun (ie battleship rock) to enjoy amazing panoramic view of Taipei city.
A short hike to have a panoramic view of the Beitou area. Signs are spray painted onto walls/metal platings, so keep a look out. Can be done in less than half an hour.

You will see a big rock and a temple within the rock. You can climb on top of rock with the help of rope. Going up there is a great viewpoint to see whole Beitou. Then going up a little more, you can see the peak. Quite a fun and short detour from the main trail
GOOD
Good!
This is a short trail to Junjiangyun (ie battleship rock) to enjoy amazing panoramic view of Taipei city.
A short hike to have a panoramic view of the Beitou area. Signs are spray painted onto walls/metal platings, so keep a look out. Can be done in less than half an hour.

You will see a big rock and a temple within the rock. You can climb on top of rock with the help of rope. Going up there is a great viewpoint to see whole Beitou. Then going up a little more, you can see the peak. Quite a fun and short detour from the main trail
GOOD
Good!
Beitou's landmark, suitable for short-distance hiking.
Close to the MRT station, accessible hiking route, great scenery

details.adr_address: 336, Taiwan, 桃園市復興區霞雲里
details.formatted_address: 336, Taiwan, 桃園市復興區霞雲里
details.name: Qinzifeng Trail

plus_code.compound_code: RCC6+36 Taiwan, 桃園市復興區霞雲里

reviews.text:
This is my second visit to Dongyan Mountain. This time I want to take the Parent-child Peak Trail, which is the second highest elevation in Dongyan Mountain (1049m above sea level). After passing the ticket station, drive to the parking lot behind the restaurant, look for the signs and follow the directions. Entering from the forest intellectual trail, this trail is quite flat and spacious. It is laid up and down along the mountain with almost no slope, making it effortless to walk. There are several places on the trail that retain the logging and lumbering facilities used by our ancestors in the forest farms. They are accompanied by explanation boards, allowing visitors to understand a little about the hard work of early logging operations.

When you turn into the parent-child peak trail, you will first pass through a flat land with staggered tree roots, and then the slope of the trail gradually increases as you go forward. After seeing an installation art, the trail started climbing all the way up. At a glance, you can see large artificial forests on both sides of the trail, which is like walking in a forest. The fresh air full of negative ions makes it very pleasant to breathe. The end of the trail is a large platform. There is only an indicator marking the top of the parent-child peak trail, and there is an explanation board next to it. However, we did not see the parent-child peak, so we took a short break and then went down the mountain. This section of the downhill trail is narrow and steep, so you need to be more careful and watch your steps. The exit just connects to the forest road and continues towards the fossil area.

The forest road is quite wide and should have been a convenient road for transporting wood in the early days. There are some fossils on display in the fossil area, which show that Dongyan Mountain, which is more than 1,000 meters above sea level, sank to the bottom of the sea tens of millions of years ago. It is really unimaginable. After walking a little further, we finally saw Parent-Child Peak, which can be admired from the forest road. The end of the forest road is the starting point of the Dongman Hiking Trail. After finding the afforestation memorial stone, we are done and we return to the restaurant for lunch!

The trail is flat and easy to walk.
There are lush trees along the way,
Summer is still cool,
The restroom is also convenient.
The Parent-Child Peak Trail is steeper, and compared to Dongyan Mountain, the Triangle Point is less promising, so please consider at your own discretion.
There are beautiful scenery and the trails are very convenient to walk, suitable for both adults and children.

From the Dongman Trail, you can clearly see the shape of the two peaks of Parent and Child Peak. The end of the Parent and Child Peak Trail is an explanatory board marking the end of the trail. In fact, you can go further in and turn left to enter the more primitive mountain trail (non-trail). There are no foundation stones at the parent and child peaks of Parent-Child Peak, but the rhododendron forest on the top is beautiful, and the path to the top is unclear. It is recommended to download the track and offline map.

details.adr_address: Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan 112
details.formatted_address: Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan 112
details.name: Datunshan Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 5GHC+9V Beitou District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Lots of stairs to start with. Well maintained and once you get to the top and view is quite breathtaking. A bit windy up top so be sure to bring a beanie/jacket especially if you're staying for the city night lights.  🌃
Not a such a difficult trail and the view is absolutely stunning. Be prepared to walk up and down the rocky staircase. Beautiful spot to view the sunset and take beautiful pictures of the hills.

Continued from Mt Qixing so this was challenging afterwards taking on the multi-peak trail. GOOD fun and recommend you do all three peaks — Main, South, and West Datun. The terrain varies— even on a hot and sunny day the stone path can be slippery so wear shoes with good grip. Around West Peak there are areas with rope climbing installed and many people had brought their own gloves. Walking sticks are popular on this trail. It’s well signposted and maintained as are all the trails in YMS park :) this was a fun one! Beautiful views, plenty of steps, and viewpoints to rest. Make sure you have plenty of water and snacks as you can choose to veer off to other trails and continue to connect them. Otherwise Erziping Visitor Centre is still 2 hours away at least.
One of the best trails in Yangmingshan!
Beautiful trail

details.adr_address: 2HGG+M6, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110
details.formatted_address: 2HGG+M6, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan 110
details.name: Elephant Peak

reviews.text: Beautiful panoramic views all the way up the climb. It's around 20 minutes of just stairs which can be quite intense but I promise the views, day or night, are worth it and incredible. There weren't too many people when I went so it was relatively easy to get good photos. There are at least four different good photo spots all with Taipei 101 in the background so you've got plenty of choice!

Never experience the view at night but will surely try next time!   3/09/2024 Our journey started from Jiuzhuang and passed HU shih park to find this starting route to JIU WU PEAK!  It was 14 degrees and average but we all made it to Elephant( Xiangshan Mountain)

Worth the climb. You will definitely perspire but you will enjoy the views of the city. It has different tracks and a few long trails if you want to do trekking. However, you can just stop at the Elephant's peak and enjoy the views during the day or even better during sunset. It has good spots that give nice views of Taipei with the Taipei 101.

A place to visit to have a good view of Taipei 101. Many viewpoints are available. It is quite an intensive climb, but the views up here are worth the effort. Lots of stairs along the route, so it is not suitable for those who are unable to climb too many stairs. It is quite crowded during the weekend.

Elephant Peak provides an enchanting escape for nature enthusiasts. The hike is accessible, but be ready to sweat and fight mosquitos!
The journey will be pleasant anyway, especially before sunset. From the summit, the city's splendor unfolds in a mesmerizing display, leaving you in awe of Taipei's beauty. An absolute must-do in Taipei, for anyone seeking a serene hike with stunning views. Highly recommended. 🐘

Short 20 minute walk. Lots of stairs. But totally worth it. Take your time pause on your way up. There are many places to view the scenery not just at the peak.
It is one of the best points from where you can watch Taipei city from above. Although the climb is long and tiring, sitting against the view makes you forget your tiredness.

details.adr_address: Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
details.formatted_address: Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
details.name: Juansi Falls Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 5H26+MV Taiwan, 台北市士林區菁山里

reviews.text: Moderate mountain trail with a nice environment and some decent views. Easy access to the trail entrance with bus and have connections to other points of interest in Yangmingshan national park. Though watch out during humid weather as the stone tiles can get very slippery.

Easy trail, quiet and very calm. I do understand they are trying to keep the place safe for everyone. Hence, you can only see the waterfall at Taipei from a certain distance only. But I'm expecting a clearer view. Anyway, it is still mesmerising to visit.
Easy, quiet, green and peaceful hike. Bring some snacks and watch the waterfall for hours to find your inner peace
Don't miss the actual one. The first one you see is a small fall. You have to continue the trail till you see the real one, which is higher.
Beautiful hike, perfect for beginners too. I started from Juansi Waterfall trailhead all the way to Qingtiangang. Downside : Steps are slippery.

Moderate mountain trail with a nice environment and some decent views. Easy access to the trail entrance with bus and have connections to other points of interest in Yangmingshan national park. Though watch out during humid weather as the stone tiles can get very slippery.

Easy trail, quiet and very calm. I do understand they are trying to keep the place safe for everyone. Hence, you can only see the waterfall at Taipei from a certain distance only. But I'm expecting a clearer view. Anyway, it is still mesmerising to visit.
Easy, quiet, green and peaceful hike. Bring some snacks and watch the waterfall for hours to find your inner peace
Don't miss the actual one. The first one you see is a small fall. You have to continue the trail till you see the real one, which is higher.
Beautiful hike, perfect for beginners too. I started from Juansi Waterfall trailhead all the way to Qingtiangang. Downside : Steps are slippery.
You can get there by taking the bus No. 15 from Jiantan MRT Station.

Take bus 15 from Jiantan MRT Station to the entrance of the Silk Waterfall Trail located in Lane 101, Jingshan Road. The total distance from the Juansi Waterfall Trail to the Qingtiangang Service Station is about 2.7km, of which the 1.1km from the entrance to the Juisi Waterfall is quite gentle and easy to walk, making it a pleasant walk. The entire trail is mostly walked under the shade of trees, and the slope is gentle. It only takes 20-30 minutes to reach the waterfall.

The Silk Silk Waterfall is as its name suggests. The water is not as powerful as a majestic wind, but is as delicate as silk and jasper. The atmosphere is cool and it is a good place to absorb negative ions. It is accompanied by the sound of water from Shanzhu Lake and Zhusong River.

After passing the Juansi Waterfall, there will be a short steep climb up the stone steps. You can take a breather but the distance is not long. Afterwards, it is also uphill all the way to Qingtiangang Prairie, but it is not too steep. It is a hiking route suitable for all ages. , but be aware that it will be slippery after rain. You can also take the Lengqing Trail and turn towards Lengshui Keng.
Great place to hike

Take the No. 15 bus near Jiantan MRT Station to go up the mountain. It takes about 35-40 minutes and get off at "Juansi Waterfall Station". It is only a few steps away from the entrance of the trail. There is shade along the way, making it a good summer escape trail. ,All ages. You can add a section of Lengshuikeng to enjoy the lake and then to Qingtiangang.

details.adr_address: Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
details.formatted_address: Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
details.name: Tianmu Historic Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 4GJP+P6 Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Nice hiking trail in Tianmu, Shihlin District where you can take a walk and enjoy the scenic view of north Taipei City. Note that you have to take the up stairs for about 40 to 50 minutes.

Beautiful trail famous for monkeys even though we didn’t really see any. There’s also a hidden trail reaching 翠峰瀑布 Cuifeng waterfall. Recommend entry from the Culture university 文化大學 side to avoid all the stairs.
A peaceful and easily hikeable trail which leads to a surprisingly vibrant waterfall. An amazing spot to visit in Tianmu.
Once you enter the trail from Tianmu it is all the way up on stairs. Make a left turn when you finally reach the top of the stairs for a really nice trail and you may bump into Formosa macaque.

A nice place for hiking. The status of path is great and the view is good too. If you want to have fun here, please bring enough supplies with u. It is not easy for a person to go through the whole path who doesn't exercise regularly.
Nice hiking trail in Tianmu, Shihlin District where you can take a walk and enjoy the scenic view of north Taipei City. Note that you have to take the up stairs for about 40 to 50 minutes.

A comfortable yet challenging mountain trail! 👍

On weekdays, many people come for a walk. At the trailhead at the top of Section 7 of Zhongshan North Road, there are roadside parking spaces for cars and motorcycles.
The ancient trail can be roughly divided into two sections: the stairs and the Heping Road. If you climb the stairs slowly without taking a break, you can reach the pavilion in about half an hour. There is a drinking platform with excellent water quality.
After arriving at the pavilion, walk forward to the driveway and about 20 meters to the right. There are two portable toilets with water and toilet paper!
The flat road is made of gravel. If it has rained before and the ground is relatively wet, there is a faucet to clean the soles of your shoes on your return trip.
The water source protection area at the end of Ping Road is the Sapphire Water Source Area, which has only been opened for registration in recent years. Every year on January, April, July, and early October, go to the water department website to register. Be prepared to start the ticket grabbing mode to have a chance to get a spot in the flash sale. Win.
After going up a short flight of stairs from the water source area, you will reach Jingshan Road leading to the Cultural University. Although it is a short distance, there are wild bamboo chickens in the bamboo forest beside the road. They are slightly larger than turtle doves and usually appear in pairs. , remember to buy a lottery ticket when you see it.
If you want to eat nearby, you can walk near McDonald's on Yangde Avenue. There are many restaurants and cafes to choose from. Of course, you can also take a bus down the mountain.
Attractions that are also great to visit on weekends
The afterglow of the setting sun slants over the mountain trails, and the lights of thousands of houses look like the starry sky in Taipei

details.adr_address: Jinshan District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 208

editorial_summary.overview: Revived trail formerly used by Qing Dynasty merchants, passing creeks, forests & terraced fields.

details.formatted_address: Jinshan District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 208
details.name: Jinbaoli Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 5HCM+73 Taiwan, 新北市金山區重和里

reviews.text: A picturesque trail along small rivers that come together to a quite big river on the bottom. The upper part of the trail is quite steep and without shade. There is also a little longer trail that avoids some of the stairs. Up and down takes about 2 to 2.5 hours.
Beautiful, easy and well maintained hiking trail. The signs were pretty clear and the routes were easy to take, no much ups and down. It is safe and relaxing to complete the trail.

A nice way to spend a morning. As it's always the case with Taiwan's National Parks, one never knows what is open and what isn't, until they get to the trailhead. In my case, the Jinbaoli trail was only open until the bridge and the grasslands where closed because of some recent incident between humans and the water buffaloes. Instead, I spend some time exploring another trail that branches out at Jinbaoli gate and runs east and passes through a few pleasant peaks and ravines. All in all, it was a good excuse to leave Taipei for a few hours.

Away form the hustling and bustling of city life. This is the go to place for trekking or a refreshing walk on the weekends. However, it is not advised to go on a hot summer day since there is not much cover. 前段步道平緩，老少咸宜，是週休二日出遊的好去處。行間的山澗清涼、有遮蔭，是歇腳的好地方

Jinbaoli trail is an ancient way between Jinshan to Taipei, I hiked and feel the way between Qingtiangang and Bayan. The trail is all the way uphill from Bayan to Qingtiangang, so opposite direction is relatively easy. On both endpoints of the trail there is a bus line.

From Qingtiangang toward Bayan you start with a bright and windy grassland similarly to Qixingshan. The altitude decreases fast so many stone steps look almost as cliff. About half the trail you would enter into the woods with comparatively flat.

The woods is darker, the trail is along the Shanghuangxi banks, so creek water and birds sound is always with you. If you go there after a few days of raining, the stream forms a rushing waterfall.

There are some ancient names in the trail making you feel an imaginary of return to the past time and space. The end point at Bayan side is Shanghuangxi valley, clear and cheerful after going out of the woods, accompanied by a smell of sulfur.

A picturesque trail along small rivers that come together to a quite big river on the bottom. The upper part of the trail is quite steep and without shade. There is also a little longer trail that avoids some of the stairs. Up and down takes about 2 to 2.5 hours.
Beautiful, easy and well maintained hiking trail. The signs were pretty clear and the routes were easy to take, no much ups and down. It is safe and relaxing to complete the trail.

All in all, it was a good excuse to leave Taipei for a few hours.

Good place to relax

Take a four-star trail, see many historical sites, learn many historical stories, listen to the chirping of insects and birds, the gurgling sound of water, settle your floating heart, and enjoy the tranquility of the moment. This trail is not long, but there are many scenic spots and relics, such as Xuyan Bridge, Han Bing Cuo Di, Tu Tu Gong Temple, boundary stone, Lion Wangyuan Mountain, abandoned sulfur quarry, and even the trail, Jinbaoli Road, Also known as Japanese Road.

For my first visit, I chose to drive up the mountain from Jinshan and park at Shangsuangxi parking lot. There is no charge in the parking lot, there are many parking spaces, and the toilets are clean and convenient. As you walk towards the Yulu Ancient Road, you will be greeted by a large colorful mountain wall. As you enter, what you can see is a grand scene of miscanthus flowers, streams and valleys intertwined. It is a very unique landscape. There are occasional relics left by ancestors along the way. The forest is very rich, and sulfur ores can be seen everywhere, including vermilion, In orange and milky white colors, there are maple red fallen leaves floating in the ditch, and also covering the ancient stepping stones. There are stacked stone bridges, ancient stone arch bridges, stone pillars for tying horses, and circular surrounds with stones piled up by ancestors. The resting seats are hidden in the dense shade of trees. On the way, you will be surprised to find waterfalls with strong water flow, and there are also small streams and waterfalls leaning on the stone steps, accompanying travelers. The sunlight penetrates the dense vines and scatters in the air. On the stone slab during the journey, it was no longer gentle and romantic. The stone steps went up all the way, like a stepped wall. The surrounding scenery was replaced by awns. The way up was endless, but every climb brought surprises to strangers. , there are the rising smoke from the hot springs, the mountains are covered with miscanthus flowers swaying in the wind, sometimes the sun is dyed gold, and sometimes the fog is white, just like this, I am gasping, sighing, surprised and happy, boarding the Jinbaoli Dalu Castle. There was a sign on the door. It turned out that I was taking the "Jinbaoli Road" which was straight and steep. I saw that everyone was coming from Qingtiangang! It turns out that everyone chooses to walk down from high places, but I became Ashin among travelers. On the way back, I didn’t dare to go straight down the stairs, so I took the winding and flat path instead, which is the "Japanese Road" going downwards. On the way, there were another Different scenery, and these...leave it to yourself to savor

In the early days, the ancient fish road was used to transport fish from Jinshan to Taipei. In autumn, the mountains are covered with miso flowers swaying in the wind~beautiful~
Take the Riren Road from the Shangsuangxi parking lot to Qingtiangang and Zhupeng Mountain, then take the Qingtiangang Circular Trail to Jinbaoli Road and return to the Shangsuangxi parking lot, about 8.7 kilometers

details.adr_address: Lane 195, Wolong St, Da’an District, Taipei City, Taiwan 116

editorial_summary.overview: Verdant trails lead to the summit of this quiet park, offering views of the Taipei 101 skyscraper.

details.formatted_address: Lane 195, Wolong St, Da’an District, Taipei City, Taiwan 116
details.name: Fuzhou Shan Park

plus_code.compound_code: 2H83+CW Da’an District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
Beautiful and serene place admist the noisy city. The view of Taipei city is quite delightful.

Visited the place during weekday, it isn't much crowded.

Huge national park! It was like walking into a jungle in the middle of the city. There are 3 paths you can take, though they all connect at some point, and 3 view points where you can see the entire city (and where you'll have a great view of 101!)

An easy hiking trail with short track. They have 3 observation deck to see the Taipei 101 tower.  Great place to spend with the kiddos..even you can bring the babies too 😚😘

I'm here again for the third time, this time with our new member who is only 5 months old.  the path is very family and kids friendly.  cool place to do nature walk or study

There are both long (if you start from the the eco park entrance) and Short trails (if you go directly to just the end of park) lots of jungle looking plants. Nice and shaded trails. Multiple entrances :)
Only downside is the view of 101 is very distant and lots of trees obstruct the view. However it is worth the trade off of a quiet, peaceful hike if that is what you are looking for. Way better than elephant mountain!!

There is a YouBike station near the entrance of Fuzhoushan Park, and you also need 10 minutes to finish around 1 km trail to Fuyang Eco-park. It's effortless and fit for beginner hikers because there are a lot of stairs over there. At the top of the hill, you can see 101 Tower. I usually come here in the morning because they also have road lamps along the way ~

Visited the place during weekday, it isn't much crowded.

Only downside is the view of 101 is very distant and lots of trees obstruct the view. However it is worth the trade off of a quiet, peaceful hike if that is what you are looking for. Way better than elephant mountain!!

There is a YouBike station near the entrance of Fuzhoushan Park, and you also need 10 minutes to finish around 1 km trail to Fuyang Eco-park. It's effortless and fit for beginner hikers because there are a lot of stairs over there. At the top of the hill, you can see 101 Tower. I usually come here in the morning because they also have road lamps along the way ~
Hiking trails with beautiful scenery and pleasant scenery
How dare you pretend to be busy R
公館附近休閒健行運動的好地方
With convenient transportation and complete path planning, it is a good place for mountain climbing and sweating.

reviews.text: Perfect trail if you like some wilderness and challenge. The view is amazing. Some parts are more climbing than hiking, so good shoes are important. Luckily there are many ropes along the steep parts which is very helpful.

Quite a tricky hike even though short so be prepared. Lots of steep sections which require holding on to ropes and being careful not to fall to one's end. The view at the top is beautiful though! Even on a cloudy day like I had.

This trail is near Maokong Gondola Station. You have to use both hands when hiking along some route of the trails.
When we walked through the trail, we came down back to the road around Maokong area. Restaurants near the entrance of the trails are very good.
The end is really difficult, take your time, and don't forget water. A bit disappointed about the top, we can not see anything as vegetation is everywhere. Still you feel proud to get on top.
If you desire a challenge follow this path, watch where you place your foot, might be the last time

There is a clear path from the fork of the Zhangshu Trail to the dirt road. Before climbing to the top, the slope is steeper and you need to pull the rope.

details.adr_address: 111, Taiwan, Taipei City, Shilin District, 台北市士林區

plus_code.compound_code: 4H7J+C9 Taiwan, 台北市士林區溪山里

reviews.text: Good
Nice place to relax

Bixi Trail, hidden in Yangmingshan National Park in Shilin District, Taipei City, is a trail full of natural charm. With a total length of only 1.2 kilometers and an altitude of about 300 meters, this family-friendly trail is gentle and has rich natural landscapes and native ecology. Along the trail, there are four viewing platforms in the shapes of spades ♠️, clubs ♣️, red hearts ♥️, and diamonds ♦️, as well as giant wood observation decks and Penghua Observation Deck, allowing visitors to enjoy the magnificent scenery of the dense forest. Bixi Trail is not only a walking trail that allows people to get close to nature, but also a place suitable for ecological observation and rest. Playing card-shaped platforms along the way add interest to the trail, making it a popular spot for families and nature lovers
A good place for leisure sports and hiking, the air is fresh and the trees provide shade.
It is a very comfortable trail, suitable for the whole family. If it is rainy and not suitable for going, the trail will be a little slippery!

reviews.text:
Banling trail, few mins away from Shamao race bus stop. Good for family trip. Free restroom is available at the Mingshuan temple.

Pleas be noted parking is not allowed at the bus top from April 23, 2023. Public transportation is suggested if you would to visit the trail.

An easy trail, a walk along the water canals. Relaxing sounds of water running down.

A few short flights of steep stairs otherwise very flat and straight forward.
The trail end at the CuiFeng Waterfalls but you can't get near the falls.
To get to the waterfalls you have to climb from the Tianmu trail.

We took the 230 shuttle bus from Xinbeitou. So many people and the shuttle is 30 mins wait.
The entrance is next to the temple, watch out for the dogs.
The best place I've ever been. Attention! Suspension bridge can handle only eight people.
An easy pathway in the mountains and local vegetable gardens. Don’t be afraid of the dogs of the garden. They barks but well-chained.

Cycling or driving along Shamao Road towards Yangmingshan. When you see the small sign for Yuxuan Palace, turn right and go down the path. After seeing Yuxuan Palace, turn left again (turn right to reach the city viewing platform). The section of the trail is a new trail that was just completed in 2023. It is very good. There are shade trees and water pools on both sides of the flat trail. The water in the water pool is also very clear and clean, making people want to reach out and experience it!
The trail is very flat. It takes about 20 minutes to walk from Yuxuan Palace to the waterfall. It is very convenient to reach the waterfall. For those who travel in summer, this section of the trail is really great. Not only is there shade from trees, but the ecology is also quite rich along the way. , you can go up to Shamao Mountain, go down to Hell Valley, and go back to Tianmu Water Pipeline, which is really great! And when you pass farmland on the way, the farmers will ask you if you want freshly picked vegetables, so you can purchase vegetables picked right on the spot from them!
Highly recommended to go for a walk!

details.adr_address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

editorial_summary.overview: Popular short trail with steps to a hilltop offering views of the coastline & nearby peaks.

details.name: Nanzilin Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 4VCQ+32 Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
What a hike. Was not our first choice but another one was closed. Nice climbs up and steps down. You
Can take step routes with ropes and there is waterfall you can swim in

Definitely a great trail embraced by greenery and offering great spots along overlooking the oceans! Takes about 40 minutes to get to the top with wooden staircase for about 300 meters and afterwards there are stone steps leading up to the top. Totally 990 meters in length at the altitude of about 200 meters. Mostly under the shade of trees! At the top you will be able to enjoy the 360 degree panoramic views of the Keelung mountains and more and the ocean. The rock formations in the near distance are in the sight! There’s a well maintained toilet down the hill near the temple, so be sure you use it before you hit the road. It can be hot in summer so bring enough water with you.

Nanzilin Trail is 990m with 360° super view (ocean & mountain), only to walk with some wooden stairs at the very beginning & rocky stairs after 300+ wooden steps in the Northeast & Yilan Coast National Scenic Area.

A very easy, relaxing trail with outstanding 360-degree view of ocean, mountain, island and villages. The only troublesome is too many bees around especially at the peak which you cannot stay long enough to enjoy the light change of the sunset. Overall it's definitely worth a visit.
Get to have a 900m walk to the viewing point which is just right for me. View was amazing, the coastline and the sea on the front and mountains on the back.

Take 791 (Nanya Nanxin Palace) from (Fulong) and get off, walk (Nanzichen Trail) (Nanya Qishishi Trail), a relaxing trip to enjoy the scenery both physically and mentally.

很棒的一條步道，步道距離約900公尺，要爬升196公尺高，對於一般沒在運動的人而言，略有挑戰性。登高望遠，出了海岸線外，九份方向的山巒也一覽無遺。
入口處是一間廟，並設有公廁，停車可在馬路對面海邊空地。廟旁有麵攤，下山肚子餓可充飢，或前往深澳漁港用餐。

details.adr_address: Lane 60, Section 3, Neihu Rd, Neihu District, Taipei City, Taiwan 114

editorial_summary.overview: Trail of stone footpaths & stairways through scenic Bihu Park, with interpretive nature signs.

details.formatted_address: Lane 60, Section 3, Neihu Rd, Neihu District, Taipei City, Taiwan 114
details.name: Bihu Trail

plus_code.compound_code: 3HQV+Q5 Neihu District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text: Pretty quick and easy trail.  Can get chilly if you can’t handle the cold.  But what a view.

The scenery here is so beautiful. It is a nice, peaceful trail that is perfect for morning walks or to clear your head and get out of the city for a while. Yet it's only a few minutes walk from Neihu station. My dog and I love to come here in the mornings and just enjoy nature. It is not a difficult trek, so it is suitable for anyone.

No tourists on this trail just the locals. We loved the fact that it connects to other trails at the end. It was tricky to find the trailer from the MRT station, but once et found it, it was very well marked. They're is signage in English about the fauna and flora. A lot of the trail is in the shade. Initially, you walk along old apartment buildings which to us was interesting as it is so different from what we're used to. We used mosquito repellent, which I recommend. It's a fairly short trail but then you can start other trails at the end. We did one leading up to a waterfall and then to s temple at the top of a mountain where the view was worth the many, many steps we had climbed.

This is a place ideal for a short day trip, but you may need an entire day to explore the entire trail. The trail leads to some pick-your-own farms where you can pick strawberries and other vegetables. There is also a temple on the way but it is not for tourists.
Nice trail that leads to interesting places. Trail is well maintained and lots of greenery. I see many people hiking here during weekends and public holidays.

Suitable for all ages. A good place for a walk. Low difficulty.

It is a trail suitable for the whole family. It is recommended to take the MRT from Neihu Station to Dahu Park Station. From the end of the trail, Ye's Ancestral Temple, you can connect to the Yuanjue Waterfall Trail. On the way back, take the Dagouxi Trail to Dahu Park. If time allows to visit Dahu Park, you can arrange a half-day trip.

details.adr_address: Fuxing District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 336
details.formatted_address: Fuxing District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan 336
details.name: Chatianshan

plus_code.compound_code: QC66+7V Fuxing District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan

reviews.text: To travel north to Tianshan Mountain, you need to apply in advance and abide by various regulations. On the same day, you will start from Lin Qingmei Organic Farm. You will pass through a zigzag industrial road for about one kilometer and enter from the second mountain entrance. If you don’t go around to see He Weishen walked straight to the Tianshan Mountains in Beituan, a one-way trip of 6 kilometers, climbing from 890 to 1727 meters, with a total climb of about 1000. It took about 4 hours to walk like this, stopping and taking photos, and the first 3 kilometers of the entire section was relatively smooth. Slowly, the slope slowly rises. After 3 kilometers, the slope begins to rise sharply at 3-4, 4-5 kilometers. There are crumbling loess on the slopes and uphill rocky areas like river beds. The climate is very humid. When walking, it is recommended to wear high-top hiking shoes with good anti-slip effect. After climbing too many cliffs, you have to cut several meters down. The rock wall there is almost vertical and is full of mud. It is very slippery and difficult to get off the rope. You need to keep your feet firmly planted, as the few meters leading to the top of the mountain are full of mud pits. The hinterland of the top of the mountain is so large that you can take a break. The descent lasted about three hours from 1:50 pm to 5:15 pm. Bring a flashlight to prevent getting caught in the dark.

The Lala Mountain Giant Tree Trail will be connected to the Fuba Crossing Trail

You will enter the Tianshan Nature Reserve

We are not regular walkers, so we were surprised to see the signboard for Tianshan Mountain.

Of course, take a photo immediately and leave a record
Primitive forest, slippery mountain trails, complex mountain roads

The sacred tree is spectacular!

Lu Peishan Beech praises!
After crossing the suspension bridge, the trail has been closed...making it a real nature reserve.

reviews.text: A small hill on the Taipei Crossing Trail, section 5th. The view is normal.
A mountain with many mystery stories.
Quick hike with a view!
Beautiful view

You can climb Jiantan Mountain from the entrance of Yuanshan Scenic Area to Wenjian Mountain. The one-way trip is about 4 kilometers and takes about 1.5 hours. The car can be parked in the underground parking lot of Bailing High School. The toilet is at Jiantanfu next to the entrance of Yuanshan Scenic Area. There are two locations, the main palace and the Central Broadcasting Station Yuanshan Microwave Station. You can go back and forth along the same route, there are also branch lines to other exits, and there is a trail to Soochow University.
A small hill on the Taipei Crossing Trail, section 5th. The view is normal.
A mountain with many mystery stories.
Quick hike with a view!
Beautiful view

You can climb Jiantan Mountain from the entrance of Yuanshan Scenic Area to Wenjian Mountain. The one-way trip is about 4 kilometers and takes about 1.5 hours. The car can be parked in the underground parking lot of Bailing High School. The toilet is at Jiantanfu next to the entrance of Yuanshan Scenic Area. There are two locations, the main palace and the Central Broadcasting Station Yuanshan Microwave Station. You can go back and forth along the same route, there are also branch lines to other exits, and there is a trail to Soochow University.

Starting from the trailhead opposite the Tongxin Mifenliao Rest Stop on Jiannan Road, it only takes 5 minutes to reach the top of Wenjian Mountain. The elevation of Wenjian Mountain is 184m. There is a root point on the top of the mountain. The outlook embracing Greater Taipei is partially blocked by trees. There is another observation point nearby with a better view, which can provide a panoramic view of the National Palace Museum, Soochow University and other Shuangxi scenery.

Most of the trails in Wenjian Mountain are dirt roads, and some sections can get slippery and muddy after rain, but the overall path is clear and easy to walk. It can also be connected with Jiantan Mountain, Zheng Chenggong Temple Trail, Jinmian Mountain, Dalunwei Mountain and other mountain trails.

Wenjian Mountain Trail, the only original trail in this section, overlooks the Palace Museum, Datun Mountains, Qixing Mountains and Guanyin Mountain...

The Temple of Kaitai Saint King Zheng Chenggong on Jiannan Mountain in the distance... Datun Mountains, Qixing Mountains, Waishuangxi Palace Museum...

Wenjian Mountain Viewing Platform: The place where Brother Daren and Sister Youqing had an ambiguous heart-to-heart talk in "I May Not Love You". Zhan Wang is so nice. It means that you can enjoy the sun during the day when the weather is good... Maybe the night is super beautiful. I have never visited at night...I can't feel its romance yet...

reviews.text:
It’s great, I picked up a beautiful dusk!
Because the Maokong Cable Car 🚡 is suspended for changing the cable car line, there are very few tourists, and the path is not as clean as the popular paths. It feels a little unbalanced and out of favor. The first section should be a cross-ridge route through Yinhe Cave, which is a staircase. After the bifurcation point, there is an earth and gravel road. There are a few dead trees on the mountain path that cross the road. It is a step over or a hole drilled. Although it is not as difficult as the 500 obstacles, it also adds some fun to the trip and can be easily exercised.
However, the pavilion at the bifurcation point was moved to flat ground after the path renovation project, which is quite a pity!
After all, this mountain is only a little shorter than Maokongjian Mountain. So why doesn’t it even have a brand? The one on Simiantou Mountain is more formal.

Coming from the direction of Ejiaoge Mountain and Sanxuangong Mountain, on the road around the mountainside, you have to go up a steep slope, pull ropes and step on trees. After reaching the triangular point, you have to go back down to the mountainside. This is not a path that ordinary tourists will take.
The road conditions on the mountainside road are acceptable, and it takes about 18 minutes to get from the resting platform where the original Degao Pavilion is to the top of the mountain.
There is no outlook, you can go back and forth in an O-shaped circle from Galaxy Cave or Maokong

reviews.text: A beautiful crater of Yangming volcano range. After surpassing a mountain and got yourselves through the jungles, your sight will suddenly nbe broaden. To explore it, you need to obtain the permission on the website of Yangming national park.
Lovely hike away from the crowds leading to an ancient crater.  Don't forget to apply for the permit beforehand.

The protected area that needs to be applied for is original and unspoiled. It is very quiet and comfortable to walk inside. If you want to go around the crater, you must wear long sleeves and long trousers. Miscanthus grass is taller than people and many paths are blocked. It is necessary to You have to push aside the miscanthus to walk across... You must also have an offline map to prevent you from getting lost and unable to get around...

The total return trip is about 10 kilometers. There is not much height difference. It is also very suitable for family travel. You need to apply 3 working days in advance. Unpopular Mountain. There are few people on holidays.

Need to apply online. There is an anti-lost line and the route indicators are obvious. It is recommended to download an offline map, which is safer. Wucheng Mountain is also called Lianwu Ridge. There is a high-voltage electricity tower on the top of the mountain with an altitude of 418m. There is no foundation stone. There are mountain huts, stone tables and chairs built by mountain friends for resting. It is the only way to pass between Tucheng Tianshang Mountain and Zhonghe Fengludi Mountain. It can also be connected with the surrounding mountains such as Shanzhong Lake, Taiji Ridge, and Wenbi Mountain.
It’s a nice place. There is a pavilion next to the triangle point and there is water supply for making tea and resting. Great!

Wucheng Mountain, also known as "Lianwu Ridge", the name of Wucheng Mountain is related to the place name of Wucheng in the Xindian Ankeng area at the foot of the mountain on the south side. The Ankeng area belonged to Wenshanbao Ankengzhuang in the early days. There are place names such as Toucheng, Ercheng, Sancheng, Fourth City, and Fifth City along the pit valley, which fully reflect the way in which the Han people colonized the Ankeng area and gradually established settlements in the past. history.

It is a good choice to start from the Tucheng Shanzhong Lake trailhead. On holidays, there are free buses to and from Shanzhong Lake to Nantianmu. There are many trails that can be extended. You can connect Wenbi Mountain, Jiangjunling, Wucheng Mountain, Taiji Ridge and other trails in an O-shaped way. Even walking.

Wucheng Mountain is also a section of the Tianshang Mountain Range Trail. The Tianshang Mountain Longitudinal Walk (the 10th section around the Taipei Skyline) is a popular hiking route. Along the way, there are shades of green trees, the chirping of insects and birds, and a rich ecology. There are also many resting pavilions with a wide view. During the tung blossom season every year, you can enjoy the scene of tung blossoms flying along the route.

It was very foggy when I went there, and it took almost 3 hours to walk from the parking lot to the east peak and back. The trail was slippery, so be careful when walking.

Among the three routes to climb Qixing Mountain, it is the most user-friendly and the most scenic hiking trail. It starts from Xiaoyoukeng Service Station and the total distance is about 1.6km. It takes about 45-60 minutes to climb the main peak first, and then reach the east peak in 10-15 minutes. Along the way, you can admire the unique volcanic landforms of Xiaoyoukeng such as the Sulfur Fumarole, as well as forest changes such as arrow bamboo forest and miscanthus. There are also beautiful views of Taipei Matcha Mountain, Xiaoguanyin Mountain, and Datun Mountain.

Although some steps on the Xiaoyoukeng Trail are steep, the climb is short and then followed by a long and gently ascending trail, making it a good introductory route to hiking. Men, women and children, as long as their physical fitness is not too poor, and they pay attention to their steps and be careful of slipperiness after rain, they can climb the highest peak in Taipei City. In addition, there is almost no shade for half of this trail. When the weather is sunny, you need to take sun protection and prepare drinking water.

Qixing Mountain, the highest peak in Taipei City, is indeed extraordinary. When the weather is clear, you can have an unparalleled view of the Taipei skyline and other mountain and sea cityscapes. You can even see the north coast and Keelung Island; when it is covered in heavy fog, it looks like a fairy mountain in the sky or an out-of-this-world floating mountain. The weather here changes very quickly, from sunny days at the foot of the mountain to white walls at the top of the mountain, but there are different styles when you visit in different seasons and climates. Since there are always a lot of people climbing there, mountaineers jokingly call it the Qixing Mountain Vegetable Market.

In addition to retracing the original path when going down the mountain, you can also go down the mountain in the direction of Lengshuikeng or Nursery. Along the Lengshuikeng Trail, you have a good view of the Lengshuikeng and Qingtiangang mountains. You can also see the Taipei city skyline halfway. You can also turn to Dream Lake, Qixing Park and other scenic spots halfway. The whole journey is about 1.8km, and it takes about 45-70 minutes to go down the mountain to Lengshuikeng Service Station. However, this route has almost no shade and can be quite exposed when the weather is good.

If you go down to the nursery trailhead, this route is the longest but provides the most shade. The whole journey is about 2.3km. The first 1km is steep with stone steps. Be very careful when it gets slippery after rain. The 1.3km after passing the pavilion becomes quite gentle and easy to walk, and the atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable. The end point of the Miaopu trailhead is located behind the National Park Visitor Center. Afterwards, you can follow the pedestrian-vehicle separation trail to Yangmingshan Bus Terminal, a distance of about 600m.

February 2024｜Holiday｜Afternoon

The entire route is a gentle walk made of stone steps or stones.
The total length is 1.6KM, and every few hundred meters there will be notices showing the distance to the main peak.
If you walk faster, you can reach the main peak in 40 minutes; if you climb slowly, you can reach the main peak in about 1.5 hours.

There are three sections of the process that are steep, and the rest can be considered gentle. After all, most of them are stairs, and people who are not good at walking are definitely not suitable.

Compared with Lengshuikeng and Nursery, this is the gentlest, shortest distance and best way to climb Qixing Mountain. Many parents take their children to climb Qixing Mountain from the Xiaoyoukeng trailhead.

The landforms along the way are also very rich: there are miscanthus, arrow bamboo forests, geothermal mountains, and sulfur vents; there are 2 observation decks where you can overlook the distant mountains, Keelung River, and Tamsui River.

One of the observation decks has an AED.

Starting from Xiaoyoukeng to the main peak of Qixing Mountain, this is a trail with the smallest height difference, but there are still several steep slopes. Fortunately, there are viewing platforms on each steep slope for tourists to rest. It takes about an hour to walk slowly. Climb to the top.
Photo 1. The trailhead is right next to the bus shelter.
Photo 2. Don’t work too hard when climbing a mountain. Look back occasionally to see the beautiful scenery.
Photo 3. The first viewing platform, equipped with AED equipment
Photo 4. The first platform is located at 0.6Km and is about 1/3 complete.
Photo 5. The second viewing platform is on the right side of the road. It is easy to miss it if you walk too fast.
Photo 6. Close view of the main peak from the second observation deck
Photo 7. Main peak summit platform

Zhusong Mountain is located in the south of Qingtiangang, with an altitude of about 830 meters. Although it is not the highest overlooking point in Yangmingshan National Park, it is surrounded by mountains and has an excellent view. When the weather is clear, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery in all directions. From here, you can see the Huagang Terrace and Shamao Mountain to the southwest, and the urban texture of Taipei Metropolitan Area, Linkou Terrace, Guanyin Mountain, etc. to the northwest, and the distant mountains such as Qixing Mountain and Qigu Mountain to the northwest. You can see the gentle Qingtiangang grassland scenery, and to the east you can find the Shiti Ridge and Dingshan features.

reviews.text: Nobody is there!
A great trail, with historic coal kiln ruins, shaded by trees, rich ecology, and a good view. On clear days, you can clearly see the sea and Wufen Mountain. It is a good place worth exploring.

The entrance to the Sijioting hiking trail is about 1.2 kilometers from the fort. Most mountaineers will reserve a parking lot from Ruifang Sports Park. They start climbing down the path next to the residential house. Most of the trails are stairs, not too steep, and almost all the way. There are trees in the shade, so the walk is not tiring. Along the way, you can see the ruins of the Yan family's ancient residence. In May, you can also see the beautiful tung flowers falling, which is very romantic. From the top of the mountain, you can reach the fort area, which was a battleground for military strategists in the past. Therefore, there are forts, barracks, bunkers, ammunition depots... military bases, some of which are incomplete. The New Taipei City Government has approved it as a third-level historic site.
On the return trip, you can retrace your steps, or take another Sankeng Trail + Industrial Road and return to the original Ruifang Sports Park reserved parking lot to form an O-shaped circular trail.

Coukengkou Trail: Located in Sijiaoting Shangtianli, Ruifang District, it was a mountain road between the Coukengkou settlement and Nuannuan Dongshikeng in the past. The Coukengkou Trail is also an ancient road. The total length of the ancient road is about 707 meters. Beside the trail There are well-preserved coal kiln ruins. Walking around them makes people think about the ancient times.
You can take the Coakengkou Trail and see the coal mine ruins~

details.adr_address: 111, Taiwan, Taipei City, Shilin District, 服務站(往擎天崗
details.formatted_address: 111, Taiwan, Taipei City, Shilin District, 服務站(往擎天崗
details.name: Qixingshan Trailhead - Lengshuikeng

plus_code.compound_code: 5H87+C8 Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan

reviews.text:
Highly recommended ❤️
The view on the top of mountain is amazing,its worth it,,Beautiful!!!
Love it..fantastic the view if you are in the top of the mountain and the wind are just a music in the ears

Climb to the top of Seven Stars and feel the natural atmosphere

Climbing the main peak of Qixing Mountain (Taiwan Xiaobaiyue #2) is not only the highest point in Taipei, but also a rich natural and geological adventure. Qixing Mountain, which is 1,120 meters high, stretches across the north and south, showing completely different ecologies and landscapes. The dense broad-leaved forests and abundant wildlife at the southern foot are in sharp contrast to the open grassland and strong northeast monsoon at the northern foot. Along the way, wonders of volcanic geology, such as fumaroles and sulfur crystals, provide unique learning opportunities. Starting from the four entry points, when you reach the top of the mountain, you will be greeted by a breathtaking 360° view, from the Datun Mountains to the North Coast to downtown Taipei.

From here, you can climb Qixing Mountain, with a total length of about 2.1 kilometers, and the round trip is 4.2 kilometers. Most of the stairs along the way are steep, and it takes about 2 to 2.5 hours to go back and forth, stopping and taking photos.

2️⃣0️⃣2️⃣3️⃣1️⃣1️⃣0️⃣1️⃣
Climb the main east peak of Qixing Mountain⛰️

I got up at 3:30 in the morning and arrived at the Lengshuikeng parking lot in Yangmingshan at 4:50. I was the only car in the parking lot, and the surroundings were foggy and visibility was poor. It seems that the sunrise should not be visible from Qixing Peak at 6 o'clock, so I have to take a short break in the car~🤭

We started climbing at 5:50. The wind was quite strong along the way. We met several mountain friends and started descending after climbing. We reached the main peak of Qixing Mountain at 6:55. It was very windy and a bit cold at the top of the mountain. I jogged down the mountain at 7:05 and returned to the trailhead at 7:35 to end today's trip.

Climb to the top of Seven Stars and feel the natural atmosphere

Climbing the main peak of Qixing Mountain (Taiwan Xiaobaiyue #2) is not only the highest point in Taipei, but also a rich natural and geological adventure. Qixing Mountain, which is 1,120 meters high, stretches across the north and south, showing completely different ecologies and landscapes. The dense broad-leaved forests and abundant wildlife at the southern foot are in sharp contrast to the open grassland and strong northeast monsoon at the northern foot. Along the way, wonders of volcanic geology, such as fumaroles and sulfur crystals, provide unique learning opportunities.
