From here, you can climb Qixing Mountain, with a total length of about 2.1 kilometers, and the round trip is 4.2 kilometers. Most of the stairs along the way are steep, and it takes about 2 to 2.5 hours to go back and forth, stopping and taking photos.

2️⃣0️⃣2️⃣3️⃣1️⃣1️⃣0️⃣1️⃣
Climb the main east peak of Qixing Mountain⛰️

I got up at 3:30 in the morning and arrived at the Lengshuikeng parking lot in Yangmingshan at 4:50. I was the only car in the parking lot, and the surroundings were foggy and visibility was poor. It seems that the sunrise should not be visible from Qixing Peak at 6 o'clock, so I have to take a short break in the car~🤭

We started climbing at 5:50. The wind was quite strong along the way. We met several mountain friends and started descending after climbing. We reached the main peak of Qixing Mountain at 6:55. It was very windy and a bit cold at the top of the mountain. I jogged down the mountain at 7:05 and returned to the trailhead at 7:35 to end today's trip.

One of the three routes to climb Qixing Mountain, starting from Lengshuikeng Service Station, the total journey is about 1.8km. It takes 60-80 minutes to reach the East Peak first, and then 10-15 minutes to reach the main peak of Qixing Mountain. The last 600m before climbing to the east peak requires some physical strength, but you can reach the top with more effort.

Along the way, you have a good view of Lengshuikeng and Qingtiangang mountains. You can also see the Taipei city skyline halfway. You can also turn to Dream Lake, Qixing Park and other scenic spots halfway. However, there is almost no shade along the entire trail, so be sure to take sun protection and have drinking water ready.

Qixing Mountain, the highest peak in Taipei City, is indeed extraordinary. When the sky is clear, you can have an unparalleled view of the Taipei skyline and other mountain and sea cityscapes. You can even see the north coast and Keelung Island; when it is covered in heavy fog, it looks like a fairy mountain in the sky or an out-of-this-world floating mountain. The weather here changes very quickly, from sunny days at the foot of the mountain to white walls at the top of the mountain, but there are different styles when you visit in different seasons and climates. Since there are always a lot of people climbing there, mountaineers jokingly call it the Qixing Mountain Vegetable Market.

In addition to retracing the original path when going down the mountain, you can also go down the mountain in the direction of Xiaoyoukeng or Nursery. Along the Xiaoyoukeng Trail, you can enjoy various volcanic landscapes such as sulfur fumaroles. The total distance is about 1.6km. It takes about 30-40 minutes to go down the mountain to the Xiaoyoukeng Service Station.

If you go down the mountain to the Miaopu trailhead, this route is the longest, about 2.3km. The first 1km is steep stone steps, so be careful of slippery conditions after rain. The 1.3km after passing the pavilion becomes quite gentle and easy to walk, and the atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable.

The end point of the Miaopu trailhead is located behind the National Park Visitor Center. Afterwards, you can follow the pedestrian-vehicle separation trail to Yangmingshan Bus Terminal, a distance of about 600m.

reviews.text: This is not the longest, most difficult or most exciting trail. Two of the trails were closed due to damage. There are some somewhat steep stairs to to up and down, but it's short and not particularly interesting. There are one or two good viewpoints where you can see the city. I did the outer loop (including one of the closed trails) in less than an hour. Good if you want a quick morning exercise, but not that good if you're actually interested in hiking, scenery, challenges etc.
Nice
The walk up to the trail head was the worst part 😅 after that, the rest was fairly easy (if you don't mind stairs) and we were rewarded with beautiful views of the country and the city
it's quite nice hiking trail.there is nice view but some stairs in some places was broken. there is need some repair. but over all it's nice.

Close to fengyuan, but feels far out. Lots of green. Can be a bit steep if you are out of shape, but otherwise it's great. Start on the left trail, and work your way in a circle back to the start. There are a lot of nice views near the top.

reviews.text:
Great outdoor place and hiking.

Saw a tour bus bringing all the local seniors here for a morning hike.

Would definitely try the hiking when I am next there

Located at 106.1k Lulin Trail, Route 18, Hengtai, Xinzhong, the entire zigzag slope is about 1.1k to reach Lulin Villa. The entire journey is walking under the forest. The ground is covered with arrow bamboo leaves and pine needles. It is very pleasant to walk on. It is relaxing and comfortable, and you can encounter mountain Qiang. The long-maned goat is very cute if it wanders around.

03 This mountain climbing entrance has very good stairs and a lot of parking spaces. It is very suitable for novices to practice mountain climbing. The difficulty is normal and not difficult, but you must wear hiking boots or rain boots and a large first one. It is a fairly simple mountain climbing path. You can come first. Challenge it and see if it's not bad. The maximum is more than 2,800.

Walking slowly and hiking on the trail, sometimes the clouds are dim, and sometimes the sun is visible, the weather is ever-changing, the scenery is breathtaking, you can meet the unafraid of the mountain sheep, and there are some birds, it is a beautiful mountain climbing route.
There are about three parking spaces at the trailhead, and six further away. The trail is steep at the beginning, and perseverance is more important than brute force.

reviews.text: Incredible experience when it is raining! the mist.
Good place!

There will be many stairs going up and down along the way (it is recommended to bring trekking poles), which is a lot of leg strength training, but the air is good and the scenery is beautiful.
If you want to go, it is recommended that you first climb the historical background (relics), which will give you more depth.
From Xiaojingua Outcrop, take the Dakukeng Trail. The stepped trail is very easy to walk. Go down the mountain and take the bus to Houtong Railway Station.

Alongside the Dakukeng Trail, you can see a beautiful Caidaolun Waterfall halfway up the mountain in the distance! Let me share with you my close-up shot of the beautiful waterfall! I can't mark the correct location on the map!

details.name: Fengqi Sunset Trail

plus_code.compound_code: VX9H+39 Taiwan, 新竹縣竹北市大義里

reviews.text: I decided to do this hike based on how easy the trail looked on profile. At the top got a nice surprise where this coffee shop/Restaurant becomes part of the trail. Amazing views and the coffee reminded me of back home. Not the gourmet type of coffee most people enjoy nowadays, but it was just what I needed during a sweaty hike. Thank you for being so kind and sweet to us!

It's a short 20min drive from Zhubei and one of the nearest locations where you can catch a glimpse of the ocean. There is a paved road all the way through.

The shortest direct path takes about 1.5 hours round trip. There are some play structures and a pavilion along the way. There is also a coffee shop with a bathroom and a bathroom at the trail end. Chill place but nothing too breathtaking.

It's a nice trail. It basically joins 天德堂 (TianDeTang) to 蓮花寺 (Lianhua temple, and even Lianhua park) but the starting is actually easy to pinpoint exactly at the place with the military tank (even if there are other entry point to the trail). On both ends, there are some free parking. The trail is easy, with nice views, under shadow most of the time, which makes it quite popular for everyone (family, sportive, retired people). Therefore, do not expect to be alone, especially on weekend. On the trail, there are a few platforms eventually with a few swings or bars for exercises. There are also some old bunkers from Japanese occupation, scattered here and there. One landmark is definitely the coffee shop in the middle which proposed beverages, rest and quiet atmosphere. Be aware that part of the trail runs below a military base and if you are unfortunate, they may train in shooting exercises, which is very noisy, unpleasant and scarring.

Nice medium level mountain trail with great scenery and sunset views. Most of the paths are steps or nice concrete, in some areas it's a scramble over  tree roots and down sandy slopes.  It can get a bit crowded at the weekend. Hiking sticks are optional as it's long rather than steep.
Nice view. Theres a cafe in top of the trail. The old war battle tank is cool. Enjoy hiking in xinfeng hsinchu taiwan.

A comfortable trail that is easy to walk and suitable for families and children to travel together. If you are not physically fit, there is a cafe at 1.7km to relax and enjoy the scenery. If you are physically fit, you can walk down (the total length is 3km).

It takes about 20-30 minutes to ride a bicycle from Hsinchu City to Xinfeng Township, Hsinchu County.
The trails are very friendly and easy to walk.
I will always hear the sound of fighter jets flying across the sky,
The pizza at Fengqi Shop is delicious!
The boss is cool and has several cute cats with personality🐱

Recommended to exercise and walk!

details.adr_address: Taiwu Township, Pingtung County, Taiwan 921
details.formatted_address: Taiwu Township, Pingtung County, Taiwan 921
details.name: Beidawushan (Kavulungan)

plus_code.compound_code: JQG6+RH Taiwu Township, Pingtung County, Taiwan

reviews.text: One of the most famous mountain in souther Taiwan. Usually it took two days to finish the trail. People who intend to finish it in one day must be fully prepared.
if you like hiking, it is a good place to go.
Good

Beidawu 2 days and 1 night trip
Day1~
Meet at 6 a.m. and get on the bus
8:30 Depart from Beidawuxin trailhead
Arrive at Higu Villa at 2:00 pm
Have dinner at 5:00 in the evening
At 5:50 in the evening, watch the sunset and sea of ​​clouds at Kitori Cliff
Go to bed at 7:00 pm💤

There is a total distance of 7K from the new trailhead to Higu Valley Villa. We have plenty of time today to take a leisurely walk.

Beidawu, which I have fantasized about for a long time, finally settled into the mountain villa successfully, and ate the most delicious mountain villa food recognized by all mountain friends in Taiwan. I saw the dreamy sea of ​​​​Kitori clouds, took a photo with the idol owner, and the weather was sunny and did not rain. I got rid of the feeling I had before going out. The tragic fate of Yu Yu, the right time, the right place and the right people made my dream come true.

Day2~
Get up at 1am and have breakfast
Arrive at about 2 o'clock
Arrive at Beidawu Triangle Point at 8 a.m.
Return to Higu Valley Villa for lunch at 1pm
Return to the new trailhead at 6 p.m.

Today I broke my biggest walking record of the day ~ 17K
From Higu Valley Villa to Triangle Point, the forest scenery is beautiful.
It was dark in the middle of the night and I didn't know the scenery next to me, so I kept my head down and followed the team. It was steep all the way up, but the slow progress actually didn't make me feel breathless.

After passing the Dawu Temple, there is a relatively gentle section, but then there are three ups and three downs, and three rockery hills. It feels like an enlarged version of Qi Ling Zong Zong.

I think what’s more troublesome is that the return journey is steep all the way, with large step intervals, sometimes dangerous cliffs, sometimes iron ladders, tangled tree roots, and large rocks that can be slippery. Every step must be very careful. Be careful, Beidawu has been slippery all year round. Everyone walked downhill very slowly and tiredly. Several people in the same group slipped and fell. Even I slipped once while walking very carefully. I really have to be very focused on walking. You should also choose your stepping points carefully, and it is best not to chat when going downhill.
When I returned to Higu Villa, my legs were already numb.
The section from Higu Valley Villa to Triangle Point was really difficult to walk. It was a 10K round trip with nearly 1,000 climbs. It took nearly 10 hours to complete the walk, and I felt really tired.

Then I had to drag my long legs from Higu Valley Villa back to the new trailhead and walk another 7K. I really relied on my willpower to finish it.

On the way back, I met many masters of solo attack, and even met an 82-year-old brother who was very powerful in solo attack👍
But as I am a weak person who loves taking photos, 3 days and 2 nights is the most suitable for me. It would be a waste not to spend more time admiring such beautiful scenery.

Also, the sleeping bags at Higu Valley Villa don’t stink and are very warm and comfortable. The toilet was also cleaner than I expected.

In the second week after I was diagnosed, I actually didn’t feel out of breath while climbing the mountain. I felt refreshed on the mountain and my energy was much better than at the foot of the mountain. Thank you to the ancestors, mountain gods, earth gods, and God of Heaven for blessing me with a safe and safe return. .

Nanshan Peak, one of the Five Mountains, is the highest mountain in the south. When you reach the top of the first-order triangular point, you can enjoy the wide view of the mountains and the clear layers of clouds and the high-screen open plains in the distance, and your mind will naturally feel relaxed.
One of the most famous mountain in souther Taiwan. Usually it took two days to finish the trail. People who intend to finish it in one day must be fully prepared.
if you like hiking, it is a good place to go.

On the way back, I met many masters of solo attack, and even met an 82-year-old brother who was very powerful in solo attack👍
But as I am a weak person who loves taking photos, 3 days and 2 nights is the most suitable for me. It would be a waste not to spend more time admiring such beautiful scenery.

Also, the sleeping bags at Higu Valley Villa don’t stink and are very warm and comfortable. The toilet was also cleaner than I expected.

In the second week after I was diagnosed, I actually didn’t feel out of breath while climbing the mountain. I felt refreshed on the mountain and my energy was much better than at the foot of the mountain. Thank you to the ancestors, mountain gods, earth gods, and God of Heaven for blessing me with a safe and safe return. .

Nanshan Peak, one of the Five Mountains, is the highest mountain in the south. When you reach the top of the first-order triangular point, you can enjoy the wide view of the mountains and the clear layers of clouds and the high-screen open plains in the distance, and your mind will naturally feel relaxed.

Itinerary: New trailhead to Kitori
Round trip time: about 8 hours (including rest time)
It started to fog around 2 p.m.

▪️At the beginning, the stone staircase road has ups and downs, and you will want to give up, but keep going. There is a section of the road that will always be slippery if the sun doesn't shine on it. Please walk slowly, as there is a village full of bright flowers and dark trees.

Equipment and advice
▪️Weather: Climbing a mountain at the end of January, it’s hot during the day (you can wear short-sleeved clothes), and it starts to get cold at 1pm (heating clothes and windproof warm jackets are a must)
▪️If you don’t have the habit of climbing mountains, don’t challenge it first. You need to use your thigh muscles.
▪️Water: 1500cc-2000cc recommended
▪️Food: Candies, biscuits, recommended salt and sugar (less thirsty)
▪️Shoes: Hiking shoes with wool socks (single or double layer)
Because the toes touch the ground first, socks that are too thin will chafe your feet.
▪️Cut your toenails!
It is a difficult mountain climbing spot. It is often foggy and rainy when climbing to the top in the early morning. It is recommended to bring a raincoat as a backup.
It’s a beautiful place, but it’s hard to climb up!
There is no outlook at Triangle Point, but the scenery along the way is nice

reviews.text:
Nice trail for intermediate level, on the way down to the bus, possibilities to see sulfur formations and steam, the path is also really well maintained!

Recommend to check the weather before, and say hi to people on the way, to meet friends on the go!
Good place for climbers

I feel like the foot injured in the car accident 2 weeks ago has healed! I got up early on the 29th and stuffed 10 kilograms of dumbbells, water bottles and other items into my backpack, and set off on time at 8 o'clock. 0800 Nursery Trailhead - Qixing Park - Main Peak of Qixing Mountain - East Peak - Dream Lake - Lengshuikeng - Lengmiao Trail - 1150 Nursery Trailhead, the whole journey is about 9.6 kilometers and ends in 3 hours and 50 minutes. My calves are really sore. This should be the most physically demanding section of the mountain in the suburbs of Beishi. Except for the section from Dongfeng to Lengshuikeng, which is unprotected, the rest of the route is lined with dense woods. It is very cool and comfortable, and is very suitable for beginners to practice.

1. The Qixing Mountain Hiking Trail Nursery Line (+Lengmiao Trail) has stone steps all along, which are dry and almost moss-free, and are gentle and easy to walk. There are little squirrels waiting to be fed in the rest area at 1.2 kilometers, and there is a no-feeding sign next to it.
At 2.1.2 kilometers, enter the Lengniao Trail on the right side of the rest area and you can go to Lengshuikeng. Continue on the nursery line of the Qixing Mountain Hiking Trail on the left side and you can reach the main peak and the east peak of Qixing Mountain. You can also turn right at about 1.5 kilometers and go forward. Go all the way to Qixingshan Park, Dream Lake, and Lengshuikeng.
3. The scenery is beautiful and many people come here to hike.
4. The signals of Taiwan Mobile and Chunghwa Telecom are both weak. There is no signal when you first enter Qixingshan Park. The signal at Dream Lake is weak and unstable.

The Lengmiao Trail is really beautiful and surprising, and the walk makes you excited and chanting:
The east entrance is at Lane 101, Jingshan Road (200 meters north of Lengshuikeng Service Visitor Center
The west entrance is about 1.2 kilometers from the midpoint of the nursery hiking trail on the main peak of Qixing Mountain.
The total distance from east to west is about 1.5 kilometers
The terrain is gentle and the stone steps are widely spaced, so you won’t be out of breath while climbing. You can hum songs here after climbing the arduous main peak.
The woods along the line are dense, and no matter how strong the sun is, it can only pass through the forest tops at most, forming small light spots on the ground, which is really healing visually.
You can stop by here after walking to the main peak and east peak of Qixing Mountain.
(1) Qixing Mountain Nursery Trailhead - Main Peak - East Peak - West Entrance of Lengmiao Trail - Lengshuikeng Visitor Service Center, take bus 15 to go down the mountain, the whole journey is about 6 kilometers up and down
(2) Lengshuikeng Visitor Center - East Peak - Main Peak - West Entrance of Lengshuikeng Trail - Lengshuikeng Visitor Center, the whole journey is about 6 kilometers up and down
The above two methods of climbing to the top of the main Qixing Peak are 2.4 kilometers, and the 1.6 kilometers in Xiaoyoukeng are the most accessible.
Especially for the nursery route, the first few steps before 1.2 kilometers are easy to walk. The steps from 1.2 kilometers to 2 kilometers are long and strenuous, which is very physically demanding. However, it is also because of this that the cold seedling trail at the back is sweet. with surprise

Nice trail for intermediate level, on the way down to the bus, possibilities to see sulfur formations and steam, the path is also really well maintained!

Recommend to check the weather before, and say hi to people on the way, to meet friends on the go!

It is a connection path between Lengshuikeng and Qixingshan Nursery Hiking Trail. It is well-shaded but has no view along the way. Because the drop is not big, the up and down time is similar and can be completed in about 25 minutes.
The trail from Lengshuikeng to the Miaopu trailhead (near Yangmingshan terminal) is gentle, easy and easy to walk. There is a fork in the middle that leads to Qixing Mountain.
I really like this section of the Bamboo Forest Tunnel.

reviews.text: Very good hiking trail with shade almost all parts along the trail! Take about 45 minutes from the entry to the top! Very cool, but be careful! It’s also almost all the way up without much flat land, a bit hard working for the elderly!
This little mountain is an easy hike whether you get to it by bus or other transportation. The trail is nicely paved with natural stone, and the view from the peak is stunning!

Nice trail to experience some nature. Autumn could be a good time to go. There are trees to hide away from the sun most of the time. Remember to stop by the observatory and enjoy the breeze of Yangming MT.
Trail is not long... About 30min one way. Saw wild monkey 🐒 family and a 🐍 snake.

Nice trail crossing Shamao mt.It takes about 1h one way. Rewarding view on top.
The path is quite lonely and many snakes, mainly Chinese Cobras show themselves.

The view from the top of Shamao Mountain is excellent. You can look at the ten peaks of Yangmingshan including Qixing Mountain, Datun Mountain and other famous mountains. You can also overlook the mountainous settlements of Yangmingshan such as Zhongshan Tower. It is also a relatively easy to climb entry-level mountaineering. route. Shamao Mountain is a parasitic volcano of Qixing Mountain. It is named because the mountain resembles a black Shamao. Shamao Mountain next to the Cultural University can be clearly seen from downtown Taipei.

There are two main trailheads. The most popular one is the Yangming Lake trailhead near Yangmingshan Bus Terminal and opposite Yangming Lake in Qianshan Park. The other one is the Dabu trailhead near the first observation deck on Shamao Road. Personally It is recommended to go up the mountain from the Yangming Lake trailhead, which is easier and safer.

The total length of the Yangming Lake trailhead route is about 1.2km. The trail is generally gentle and easy to walk. On the way, you will pass by historical sites such as Chen Hejie Stone and Chen Xialin Flag Base, a famous scholar in the Qing Dynasty. Generally, you can climb to the top of Shamao Mountain in about 30-40 minutes, even if it is People with poor physical strength can surely climb the mountain within an hour by walking slowly.

Although the other route to the Tai Po trailhead is shorter, with a total length of about 1km, it is steep and slippery. There are many fallen leaves and moss on the steps, so it requires more physical strength. It usually takes about 40-60 minutes to reach the top. Personally, I went up the mountain from the Yangming Lake trailhead (30 minutes) and down the mountain from the Dabu trailhead (25 minutes).

There is a wooden viewing platform on the top of Sha Mao Mountain. The scenery is very open and pleasant. About a minute's walk away is the cornerstone of Sha Mao Mountain's triangular point. Shamao Mountain is 643m above sea level. Its foundation stone is a third-order triangular point. Walking further from the triangular point, you can reach the historical site Prince Pavilion. A small disadvantage is that there is no seating area on the top of the mountain except for the viewing platform to provide mountain friends with a rest.

Shamao Mountain is very suitable for mountain training before climbing Baiyun, especially the steep stairs and heavy bags on the back will make your legs really sore after climbing to the top. The strong northeast monsoon in winter can be extremely cold, so it is recommended to bring a windproof jacket and hat to avoid catching a cold after climbing to the top.
On the Yangming Lake trailhead...1.2km...the first 1km are all uphill stairs, and the 200 meters behind are flat...the scenery is pretty good

reviews.text: A extraordinary trail of Yunming mountain where either hiking on the riverside or river tracing to Qingtiangang. It’s a highly recommended trail,especially the hot season in Taiwan.
Goog

The road signs along the Inner Shuangxi Ancient Trail are unclear. It is recommended to download an offline map before going there. You will pass many tributaries of small streams along the way. Pay more attention to the shoes with light waterproof and anti-slip function. The road will be very muddy after the rain. It is also recommended for a long journey. Bring enough water and food.
This time we went up the Duanyan stream from Guzhen in mid-November. There was only a small amount of uphill. Most of the road was gentle and easy to walk, but the conditions were relatively primitive. It is not recommended to go after heavy rain or typhoon to prevent the water level of the stream. It's hard to walk when you're high.
If you don’t go straight to Qingtiangang Grassland, it is recommended to cross Neishangxi River in the middle section and then turn left and take the O-shaped route to Qingfengting Route. It is better and more user-friendly. It is very cool along the way and the journey takes about 3 hours.

haven't seen you for a long time.

Stretch out and relax by the shimmering stream
The smiles of the mountain friends and the lush forest have the magic power full of energy.

light and shadow.

It is connected to Dengfeng Town, Pingding New Town and Pingding Ancient Town. The water source is taken from the Neishangxi water source. It is easy to get lost in the forest valley. You need to download the offline map. After passing the stone house and earth house, you will return to the water source of Pingding Guzhen. After the rain, the mountain road is muddy and slippery. Next to it is the Neishuang Valley. The valley is more dangerous than the Shuizhen Trail. Be careful of slipping. Beautiful virgin forest valley.

reviews.text:
Like climbing Nancha Tianshan, Luping Mountain is usually climbed from the traditional trailhead of Nancha Tianshan. Especially in the season when the beech trees turn yellow, it will be climbed together with Nancha Tianshan. However, the challenge is higher. It takes about 10 hours to walk back to the traditional trailhead.
Luping Mountain (Lupei Mountain), with an altitude of 1905m, is the forest triangle point.

20210207 Luping Mountain seems to be also called Lu Pei Mountain... Anyway, there seem to be many names, which makes me a little confused. This mountain is considered a mountain that many mountaineers would use to make a hiking trip together with Nanchuan Tianshan. However, just Nanchuan Tianshan requires 8 hours of time. If you add in the total time of Luping Mountain, it will take at least 10 hours.
Just after climbing to the top of Nancha Tianshan, you will reach the fork between Mount Luping and the trailhead about a few hundred meters away. At this point, as long as you go straight without turning, you will enter the path to Mount Luping. The trail is really gentle at first. It's very easy, but then you start to cut down sharply, and you will encounter a fork in the road. That fork is a shortcut down the mountain. Don't take it and continue moving forward. Then the hard uphill begins again. There are about three rockery hills on the way. These rockery hills are still difficult to climb. There is a forest full of arrow bamboos. You need to pay special attention here because it is difficult to fix cloth strips with arrow bamboos, so this is a place where it is easier to lose your way. It is about an hour from leaving Nancha Tianshan to Luping Mountain.
The next step is to go back to the fork in the road and choose a shortcut down the mountain, but this shortcut is actually not easy. It seems that because the trail has just been opened, the earth and rocks on the trail are easy to collapse and slide. In addition, the frequency of setting up the strips is relatively low, so there are often things you don’t know. The confusion of where to go. This climbing trip started at 7:00 and ended at 15:20. On the way, we gave up the south-to-north peak. Since it gets dark quickly in winter, we hope to return to the trailhead earlier.

2020 Beech has come to an end.

Only part of it is left, but it’s still great!

Well worth the climb!

The path is clear, so don’t go up the mountain on rainy days!

Without the scenery, the path will be unclear!

reviews.text: As we walk up Mount Lianbao, we reach Wainiaozui Mountain and the outlook is excellent before we arrive.
Walking down such a steep descent in the dark can be quite scary ~ You still need to hold on to the rope ~

Lianbao Mountain, 1055 meters above sea level, has the foundation stone of the Governor's Mansion. Park the car and start climbing from the Yuanyang Valley Waterfall Trail. It takes about 60-70 minutes to reach the top. It should be the fastest route to the top.
After reaching the top, you can continue walking up Neiniaozui Mountain and Najie Mountain; or you can go back to Mawudu Mountain, get off Zhu 29 County Road, and go towards Nuwa Empress Temple, and continue to climb Liuwu Mountain, Baka Mountain, and Maohe Mountain. Mountain ⋯ ⋯.

From the paddy field to the forest road, the mountain path is clear, steep in one section and gentle in the other. All have obvious white auxiliary ropes.
There is a fork on the left leading to private land, both signposted.
In the summer of 2021, approaching Lianyubao Mountain, there was newly collapsed terrain. I visited in October, and some enthusiastic mountaineers have already organized a new route and bypassed it.

Mountaineers who make a large circle will be advised to return to the paddy field forest road from other hiking entrances in advance. It is not easy to go down the steep path in the dark. Pay attention to the white auxiliary rope to avoid getting lost in the artificial forest.
It takes about 1-1.5 hours from the exit of Shuitian Forest Road to Triangle Point and continues steeply.
As we walk up Mount Lianbao, we reach Wainiaozui Mountain and the outlook is excellent before we arrive.
Walking down such a steep descent in the dark can be quite scary ~ You still need to hold on to the rope ~

Lianbao Mountain, 1055 meters above sea level, has the foundation stone of the Governor's Mansion. Park the car and start climbing from the Yuanyang Valley Waterfall Trail. It takes about 60-70 minutes to reach the top. It should be the fastest route to the top.
After reaching the top, you can continue walking up Neiniaozui Mountain and Najie Mountain; or you can go back to Mawudu Mountain, get off Zhu 29 County Road, and go towards Nuwa Empress Temple, and continue to climb Liuwu Mountain, Baka Mountain, and Maohe Mountain. Mountain ⋯ ⋯.

From the paddy field to the forest road, the mountain path is clear, steep in one section and gentle in the other. All have obvious white auxiliary ropes.
There is a fork on the left leading to private land, both signposted.
In the summer of 2021, approaching Lianyubao Mountain, there was newly collapsed terrain. I visited in October, and some enthusiastic mountaineers have already organized a new route and bypassed it.

Mountaineers who make a large circle will be advised to return to the paddy field forest road from other hiking entrances in advance. It is not easy to go down the steep path in the dark. Pay attention to the white auxiliary rope to avoid getting lost in the artificial forest.
It takes about 1-1.5 hours from the exit of Shuitian Forest Road to Triangle Point and continues steeply.

reviews.text: Zhuzi Mountain, H672M, Tugenbu Point of the Governor's Mansion, surrounded by natural rocks as the foundation stone. There is a poem on the tree trunk next to the cornerstone: Mount Zhuozi is as high as the starry sky, looking up to the peaks of Eight Talents and Hundreds of Rivers. The Governor's Mansion is carved in stone, and the mountain peak protects hikers. You can take a shortcut to Mount Zhuozi, or you can go from Tudigong Temple to Tianliao Mountain to reach Zhuozi Mountain. There is a spacious viewing spot in front of Tianliao Mountain. From Tianliao Mountain to Zhuozi Mountain, you can go through bamboo forests and pass rock walls. The journey is short. Long and relatively varied. The entire cedar forest along the industrial road at the foot of Mt. Tsuki is also beautiful.

Zhuanzi Mountain is located in Hengshan, Hsinchu, with an altitude of 672 meters. There is a cornerstone of the Governor's Mansion. The fastest route to climb this mountain only takes 5 minutes. However, it takes about 30-40 minutes to take the ridgeline from Tianliao Mountain Observation Deck and Tianliao Mountain, which gives you a sense of accomplishment. You can walk Shuitou Pai Mountain and Shuyuan Mountain continuously to complete an O-shaped circle, which takes about 5.5 hours.
There are many B&Bs in Zhuzi Mountain, the trails are well managed, the scenery is beautiful, and the paths are clear and easy to walk.

reviews.text: Good!

Enter from Mawudu, pass by the waterfall, and then go to Wainiaozui Mountain after the bayberry and grandma sacred trees.
The mountain road is generally easy to walk, but be careful as it may be slippery.

There is no cornerstone at the triangular point, but the outlook is very good

Going down the mountain, there is hot food sold near Green Light Elementary School, which can satisfy you.

Wainiaozui Mountain, with an altitude of 1,350 meters, is located in Guanxi Town, Hsinchu County, near the Mawudu Discovery Forest. There are many paths to Wainiaozui Mountain. Most people will choose to start from the trailhead in the Mawudu Discovery Forest. It mainly consists of stone steps and primitive mountain trails. The first short section is mainly wandering in the Mawudu Discovery Forest. Until you find a sign saying that the road ahead is primitive and not part of the park, you will reach the Wainiaozui Mountain trailhead, and start the trail from there. It gets smaller and climbs steeply all the way, with beautiful lush woods on both sides, providing beautiful scenery as far as the eye can see. After reaching the top, you will find a horizontal rock with a broad view of Shimen Reservoir and the surrounding peaks. The trail is about 6 kilometers long, climbs 650 meters, and can be completed in about 5 hours.
Enter the Mawudu Exploration Forest and go straight up to Wainiaozui Mountain. The native rhododendrons are in bloom, so beautiful! Great trip

The 20190113 Niaozui Mountain trailhead is located next to the Mawudu Waterfall. In fact, you don’t have to worry about not finding it, because the warning sign is large and obvious. It is more obvious than the mountaineering team’s banner in the foggy woods... quite Ironically, without the sign warning you not to go up the mountain, you might not have found the way.
To be honest, if you don’t have much mountain climbing experience, you may want to give up at the beginning. Because the trail is slippery at the beginning, the walkable trail is very narrow and it feels almost uncomfortable to walk through the grass. In January, there are a lot of spider webs and even snakes are found, which is really scary. This trail was a foggy, wet and slippery rainforest trail before going up to the ridgeline. After going up the ridgeline, it completely changed. The ground was dry and the sun was even shining on me. Even when I climbed to the top, the sun was shining. It was so big that I couldn't open my eyes, and the heavy fog below turned into a sea of ​​clouds.
The entire journey took three hours to climb up to about 600 meters. Although the data did not seem particularly tiring, there was no place to rest before walking up to the edge, because you definitely don’t want to sit down and rest in the slippery mud. So this will also cause you to unconsciously force yourself to hurry.
Some people may think that people can climb up from the paddy field forest road to explore the forest in Mawudu for free. I don’t know if there will be a mountaineering team shuttle bus to explore the forest to pick up hikers. Otherwise, it would not be easy to walk from the fork in the two routes to the downhill section of the Exploration Forest. If you have to turn back the same way... I think the boss of Exploration Forest should recognize him if he has that kind of ability... The boss of Exploration Forest is not stupid either. The tourists who paid his ticket to climb Wainiaozui Mountain must be far better than the fare-evading tourists who had to climb the paddy fields and forest roads. For him, the advantages outweighed the disadvantages.
Good!

Enter from Mawudu, pass by the waterfall, and then go to Wainiaozui Mountain after the bayberry and grandma sacred trees.
The mountain road is generally easy to walk, but be careful as it may be slippery.

There is no cornerstone at the triangular point, but the outlook is very good

Going down the mountain, there is hot food sold near Green Light Elementary School, which can satisfy you.

Wainiaozui Mountain, with an altitude of 1,350 meters, is located in Guanxi Town, Hsinchu County, near the Mawudu Discovery Forest. There are many paths to Wainiaozui Mountain. Most people will choose to start from the trailhead in the Mawudu Discovery Forest. It mainly consists of stone steps and primitive mountain trails. The first short section is mainly wandering in the Mawudu Discovery Forest. Until you find a sign saying that the road ahead is primitive and not part of the park, you will reach the Wainiaozui Mountain trailhead, and start the trail from there. It gets smaller and climbs steeply all the way, with beautiful lush woods on both sides, providing beautiful scenery as far as the eye can see. After reaching the top, you will find a horizontal rock with a broad view of Shimen Reservoir and the surrounding peaks. The trail is about 6 kilometers long, climbs 650 meters, and can be completed in about 5 hours.

For him, the advantages outweighed the disadvantages.

In addition to being as slippery as Neiniaozui Mountain, the cedar forest is beautiful and the trail is clear and the journey is short, about 3 hours round trip. It is a relatively easy trail that will pass by the upper reaches of Mawudu Waterfall.
If the weather is good, you should be able to see the connection between Shimen Reservoir and Najie and Neiniaozui Mountains.

It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the intersection of Yuanyanggu Waterfall Paddy Road, cross the stream on the left, and start climbing up. It takes more than 6 hours to climb back and forth from the entrance of Wainiaozui Mountain. Please bring enough water. Be sure to go down the mountain after two o'clock, because it is very thick in the afternoon. It’s foggy and it’s dangerous to go down the mountain too late. Remember to spray mosquito repellent. There are so many mosquitoes. Remember~

reviews.text: Breathtaking experience. Very tiring yet satisfying adventure before this year end as we're able to reach the summit considering that the weather is getting bad as we approach the main peak. But still all our team reached the main peak safely

1-2/11/2023

Absolutely stunning but a little bit too busy for my taste. There was a lot of people of all ages and abilities so sometimes you have to slow down before you can pass them.

Doable in one long day but worth sleeping at Paiyuan and hiking to the top for the sun rise. Not the most challenging hike but some can feel the altitude.

Well maintained trail, some parts in forest, some in full sun. Some bits are little exposed. Great wildlife.

Permit needed.
Full mobile signal 99% of the time.
Please take your rubbish home.

The mountains are often shrouded in a mystical veil of clouds. Wisps of fog and mist drift gracefully between the peaks, lending an aura of enchantment to the landscape. It's as if the mountains themselves are breathing, their secrets whispered through the soft caress of the clouds.

These ancient mountains, with their jagged profiles and rugged contours, seem to touch the heavens themselves. As you ascend into their realm, you can't help but be humbled by their grandeur and magnificence.

s you climb higher, the clouds begin to part, unveiling vistas of breathtaking beauty. The setting sun paints the sky with hues of pink, orange, and purple, casting a warm, ethereal glow over the land.

Whether you're an avid photographer or simply a lover of beauty, these mountains are a photographer's dream. Each vista is a composition waiting to be captured, each cloud formation a work of art.

Well maintained trails.  Spent first night at Dong Pu mountain lodge (東埔山莊) to be accustomed the high altitude.  Checked in at the Tataka visitor center (塔塔加遊客中心)with the permits in the morning. Caught the shuttle to the trail head (NTD 100 one trip).  Hiked 8.5 KM Tataka tail  up to PeiYung mountain cabin.  6-7 hour hike depending on your pace. Spent one night at PeiYung mountain lodge with the options of meals purchased and sleeping bags rental.  Early rising next morning to climb up to the peak of mountain Jade (Yu Shan) for viewing sunrising.  2.5 KM strenuous mountaineering from PeiYung mountain lodge to the peak 3952Km above sea level. For high adventurers there are multiple peaks, east, wast, south, and north can be accessed from the PeiYung mountain lodge.

Very nice and beautiful mountain
Best sunrise point

The highest peak in Northeast Asia, with an altitude of 3,952 meters, is already common knowledge and needs no further introduction.
Most mountaineers start from the Tatajia saddle in Xinyi Township, but I heard that there is a longer way.
Going up from Tatajia, there are mountain walls on the left and cliffs on the right. The trail is not very wide and there are more than 80 small bridges. It is not suitable for people with a fear of heights.
Because there are so many people climbing Yushan Mountain, if they don't capture Paiyun Villa, they have to attack alone. Counting from the Anbu trailhead, it is 21.8 kilometers round trip to the summit. The one-way distance from Shangdongpu parking lot to Tatajia Anbu is an additional 2.8 kilometers. However, if this period of time permits, you can spend money to take the shuttle bus, except for solo attacks. Because solo attacks mostly start in the early morning, there are no shuttle buses at that time.
Overall, climbing Yushan is not difficult for most people. The most difficult part is probably the last section of the gravel slope which is a bit dangerous and hard.
If this is your first time climbing to the top, you will basically be inexplicably moved.
Attached is another angle of the main peak of Yushan. It is different from the generally recognized angle on the north peak of Yushan. It looks like a big dinosaur lying on the ridgeline.
After climbing the main peak of Yushan Mountain, you can go to the "Jade Management Office" in Nantou Shuili with your photo to apply for a climbing certificate. It seems to cost 300 yuan.
Also, it is more difficult to win the lottery for Yunshan Villa after choosing the date to climb Yushan Mountain. Generally, after deciding to go to Yushan Mountain, let him draw it every day. He will go on the day he is lucky enough to win. This way, it is easier to win the lottery. .
It is very important to keep warm while climbing Yushan Mountain.

Why am I doing this?
It makes me think.
The difficulty level increases rapidly from the remaining 0.3 km.

reviews.text: There is no outlook on the top of the mountain, but there is a spot from the Bureau of Land and Resources. The trail is less primitive than Baishi Mountain and is less popular. You can go back and forth in an O-shaped circle from Baishi Mountain.
The road extending from Baishi Mountain to Shicuokeng Mountain has beautiful forest scenery. This mountain is relatively unpopular and rarely visited by people. The path is clear!

Coming out of Baishi Mountain, I accidentally chose this route. After leaving, I realized that if you were not a frequent mountain traveler, the walk might be very difficult (just like me...).
There are many steep climbs and descents along the route that require rope climbing assistance, so it requires more physical strength, and the plants on the route are densely grown. Some routes are not so obvious. In addition, some trails are narrow, so if you don't pay attention to your steps, it will be easier. Danger occurs (because there may be a cliff on the other side...), so you really need to pay attention. But looking at it from another perspective, just because it is not convenient for most people to walk, you can see a lot of ecology along the route, which is also a good gain.

This route is rarely climbed by people. It starts from the Datieliao Trail and goes straight up to the upper left of the intersection of the sentry post. It takes about 40 minutes to reach the triangle point. The route is not obvious, with waist-high weeds and cobwebs. It is undulating up and down. It is recommended to wear long sleeves and long trousers. , anti-cobweb equipment, and there are many climbing routes. After arriving at the triangle point, you can go left to Shisanshan Mountain and Wuliaojian. To the right, you can reach Baishishan Mountain. Then go down the mountain via the Datieliao Ancient Trail or pass through Baishipi Shiguikeng and Baiji Trail. Going down the mountain, although I am not a professional, the road conditions are challenging and the physical burden is heavy!!
There are only a few hikers who want to leave the world for a while and come to this hill for a walk.

reviews.text:
The Start: The journey begins with the thrill of anticipation. i pack my bags, bid farewell to the familiar, and set off into the unknown. There's a sense of excitement and wonder as you embark on this adventure.

The Destination: The destination is a place of enchantment. Whether it's an exotic foreign land, a remote wilderness, or a bustling city, it holds the promise of new experiences and unforgettable memories.

Exploration: An amazing trip is marked by exploration. i immerse myself in the local culture, savoring the tastes, sounds, and traditions of the place. Every corner is an opportunity for adventure, every encounter a chance to connect with others.

Nature plays a starring role in this journey. i stand in awe before majestic mountains, stroll through ancient forests, and bask in the beauty of pristine beaches. The world's natural wonders become your playground.

Taoshan is a very beautiful mountain with a fantastic view of the surroundings. But it's a long walk from Wuling villa. The walk is not difficult, but it is just long and steep, as you have to climb 1400 vertical meters, which should take between 4 and 5 hours for ordinary hikers (and then, need to go down !). At the top, it is possible to reach the Taoshan cabin (within 200 m), which can be an emergency shelter or a place to spend the night, but it is necessary to reserve with the administration of the Shei-pa park. Taoshan is also a starting point to go further to the top of Kalayei but it will no longer be a day hike.
Surrounded by central mountain range and holy ridge line.

There is an excellent 360 degree view from the top of the Tao mountain. Although the distance is very short, only 4.5 km, it is uphill all the way, climbing about 1,400 meters and taking about 5 hours (one way) to reach the top.
Nice and beautiful place

2024.03.03 (Sunday) Momoyama’s first hundred mountains! Single attack completed✅

Arrive at Wuling Farm camping area the night before
3:00am Get up, pack camping tent, sleeping bag, and get dressed
4:30am Depart from Wuling Villa parking lot
10:30am Private viewing of the top of Momoyama Mountain
11:30am Departure from the mountain
16:30pm Return to Wuling Villa parking lot

The first Chubaiyue
The weather changes
It wasn’t until the back that I felt the sun and the great view of the sea of ​​clouds
Very shocking nature
I'm still walking in the clouds and mist ahead.
The temperature probably falls between 2-6 degrees! Hands are super cold and squeaky
I’m so happy to choose Momoyama for my first hundred mountains.
I didn’t meet anyone on the way up the mountain.
When you reach the top of the mountain, no one is there, so it’s super cool to book the place
It was the first time I saw various famous mountains so close and in super high definition.
Cameras and mobile phones cannot capture the reality of the scene
Later, I met a staff member who said that there was ice and sleet on the top of the mountain during the cold snap two days ago.
So everyone probably thought that the weather would be bad on Sunday, so they didn’t come up.
I was very lucky and happy. No one was there, so I just played and was in a daze for an hour.

Very satisfied with my first trip to Baiyue
Thank you for the hospitality, Mountain God

The scenery is great every time I come here

reviews.text: 20240107 This time we entered through the bamboo forest trailhead next to the house. The real difficulty of the climbing path is the steep slope that is about to reach the top at the end. The steep slope is not only super steep, but also a pile of weeds and fallen wood piled on top, from bottom to top. At first glance, I thought it was impossible to go up from here...but it just happened that I had to climb hard from there. I just started to go around and around to find a way, but I couldn't get through.
The path is not very clear, unpopular mountain

reviews.text: Ok

Nankan Mountain has an elevation of 155 meters, a third-order triangular point, and a foundation stone.
Located next to the observation deck, the observation deck has an excellent view. It can have a panoramic view of the Airport MRT, the Taiwan Strait, and the airport. It can also overlook the 3D land, sea, and air of the express train running on land, ships berthing at sea, and aircraft taking off and landing in the air. Three-dimensional picture!
This is also a good place to watch the sunset and night view of reed bamboo.

You can easily pull up a mountain. There are many pottery wine barrels on the mountainside of Wujiugong to decorate the landscape. There are exquisite Buddha statues and a viewing platform that can be sheltered from the rain. Visit during the cherry blossom season, and the cherry blossoms and apricots are intertwined, which is even more beautiful.
The cherry blossoms bloom at the Triangle Point of Nankan Mountain
A great place for those who like walking

reviews.text: Next to the Huang Family Ancient Tomb, there is no obvious path. You have to follow the hiking trails to find the triangular point.

Fuxingtou Mountain, also called Fuxing Back Mountain, is located 4 kilometers northwest of the urban area of ​​Emei Township, with an altitude of 150 meters. It is the root point of the Land Survey Bureau. The trailhead is between 92.0 and 92.5km of the third line of Emei Township.
Hsinchu Jiaoshan
